reviewText: I am really enjoying having this litter box, I had the single cat home one previously and upgraded to this one when my old one went to crap. Sure once in a while, some poop or pee gets stuck to the rake, it does have a bit of a noise to it when its scooping, BUT, I never have to scoop the litter box! and it no longer stinks in my house like litter box!!! AMAZING!!!! I was content with "the old way" until I got my siamese cat who doesn't believe in cover her poop, and so it was SUPER STINKY! Not anymore! My particular one came broken but amazon did issue my a credit because of it.
summary: I can't believe I used to scoop poop and have litter box smell

reviewText: Not a bad chew, the dogs like the flavor, but the product does break apart easily causing quite a mess. I'll stick with another brand when it comes to Buffalo tendon chews.
summary: Harder and more brittle than expected

reviewText: Great, easy to use.  A lot of people do not take the time to read the fine print on the label to see the peel off that shows the color chart to read the test results.  We laminated ours and it works great.

Steve is playing with this as I type this review. He seems quite intrigued! He is a large kitty and I wish I would have got the large one instead of the small. The spaces in the small are better for a smaller cat or kitten, not a bigger cat. Overall, though, he seems to like it.
summary: wish I would have got the large one

reviewText: I have 2 cats, one is extremely persnickety, and one is not - I've had the box sitting next to the old box for about a week.  So far Miss Priss has not used the Nyantomo litter box.  However, the other cat started using it right away. It really does control urine odors - I'm pretty impressed.I will have to update this post after a few weeks to see if Priss is going to decide to use it.  The instructions on the box say to go without cleaning the old litter box for a while and see if they will use the Nyantomo.  Because it does such a good job controlling odor, I definitely think that the box would be worth the extra expense but only if I can get both cats to use it.  (as a side note, the refills are not available at this time.  Amazon says they are out of stock...?)UPDATE May 8, 2014:  Prissy cat is now using the box - I saw her use it last night.  I'm going to love this product!  I hope the refills become available soon.  Right now they are "out of stock" on Amazon and the pet store doesn't carry this brand, which is unfortunate, because I need to clean the box :-/**update when they dig in the box, it is NOISEY! It sounds like they are excavating a construction site.
summary: Works great if they will use it -

reviewText: I don't think this product is built to last. I would not get it wet, but for a dry day, if you have a nippy, leash biting dog, this will put a stop to it. (It's why I got this, as my puppy was going through a rebellious phase.)The item was cheap, and I feel like the amount I paid and the use I should get out of it is definitely fair. If you want a better product, you can expect to pay more than the $4 Amazon charges for this as an add-on item.
summary: Hmm, will do well for the price.

reviewText: This crate has been really great for me and my GSP.  I just started showing my pups so I break this down and set it up a lot (almost every weekend, both days).  The plastic handles for it broke with my abuse but I didn't really want to use them anyway.  I really like this crate and want to order another soon.  This fits just snug and perfect in the trunk of my 1995 Lexus SC400.

I'm not sure what the big hype is, this is nothing but corrugated cardboard in a cardboard box.  My cat wanted nothing to do with actually scratching it but when I scratched at it to give her the idea she should scratch at it (instead of our couch) little pieces of cardboard just scraped off.  She did like chewing on the cardboard box though, which was wonderfully frustrating.  I can't figure out why you would want this replace this when you just spent so much time vacuuming it up.
Nice extra space for a pet to play in and explore. My pets love climbing in here for some quiet time.

I have never found any toy which could make any cat so passionate. My cat will stand over this toy 2-3 times a day and meow to demand I play with him, then let out an excited yelp when I actually start to play. He'll run after the ribbon as quickly as he possibly can, stopping only after he's panting and too exhausted to continue. When he finally catches the ribbon, he'll prance around with it in his mouth, dragging the whole stick toy off into a corner where he can feast on his catch.When I was extremely busy at work and not spending much time at home except to sleep, he dragged the toy upstairs while I was showering and waited for me to come out of the shower so he'd KNOW I'd see him when he started meowing.I've had other string/stick toys but none really pique my cat's interest like this one. Also, despite very heavy use the toy has not shown signs of wearing or breaking apart.

My very persnickety cat, Princess Pia, loves the taste and it works for her.  Actually she was named PIA (for pain in the ***)before I got her.  Once I got to know her, I added the "Princess".  If you're a cat lover, you'll know just what that implies!But she likes it, it works, and so I, her minion, recommend it!

Alright . . . it's a stainless pet bowl.  It was a few dollars less than a better reviewed one, so I went for it.  If it's stainless and doesn't leak, what's not to like?Well for one thing, the "three quart" bowl doesn't hold three quarts.  Right out of the box I noticed it looked small, so I verified first that Amazon sent me the right one.  A sticker on the bottom confirmed it was the three quart model.  Now perplexed, I got out my measuring bowls and poured two quarts of water into it.  It filled to a little less than about one inch below the brim.  Even though I knew what would happen, I placed it in the sink and poured in another quart.  As expected it overflowed.  It WAY overflowed.  I couldn't believe it was so much smaller than advertised, so I repeated the process and got the same result.  You could perhaps get 2 1/2 quarts in the thing if you filled it to the point where it was about to overflow.As others have said the bowl is most definitely not heavy duty.  It's actually fairly thin.  I can also confirm that, again as others have reported, the label inside is absurdly difficult to clean off (no, vinegar doesn't work - maybe if you soaked it for longer than I have patience for).  Of course, a goo gone type product works, but should you really need to do that?If I had to do it again I'd spend a few dollars more to get something that (a) holds the advertised volume, (b) is more substantial in terms of thickness and weight, and (c) doesn't cause aggravation in trying to remove a silly label.You might want to pass on this one.  It earned its one star because it doesn't leak.  Unless you actually try to put three quarts in it.
A good dish that is low to the ground. Perfect for serving wet food to a smaller kitten. For a bigger kitten I might go with the water dish from this same brand, which can double as a food dish.

I use a Kong to hold peanut butter and freeze it for my dogs to have as a treat.  I have a Belgian and German shepherd and their tongues aren't long enough to get the peanut butter out of the very bottom.  However, the xx-large size is big enough that I don't have to worry about them swallowing the whole Kong.  After several months of use, they chewed the top off of this red one so I'm now trying the black Kong which is suppose to be stronger.  I've been using the black one for about a month and it's holding up fine so far.
Would give it a 5 but not much squeak to it, Yes they like playing with it but without the louder squeaker they do notplay long

I think this would be a great little booster seat for dogs that enjoy sitting and watching out the window.  It was easy to install, and seems to be well made.  If you have a dog that would sit calmly then I would highly recommend it.  However, if your little dog is extremely hyper like mine is, I wouldn't try it.  It has a safety strap with a clip to keep the dog from jumping out, which is great.  But when I took my Yorkie for a ride in this seat, he kept flipping through the air until he was hanging himself from the safety strap.  I had to keep pulling over and un-winding him.  So while it is a great seat, it won't work for every dog.

We bought this bed for our 15 lb Boston Terrier. The quality was only so-so and it was a strange shape - long and skinny! The pup wasn't so interested in it. She only started sitting on it when we put it in the window but she ended up chewing through it pretty quickly (which she usually doesn't do). I wouldn't buy this again.
Good to use in the Sherpa Carrier to keep it clean.

I have to start out by saying that I don't like it "fancy or gourmet" dog products. Dogs will eat just about anything, except for broccoli and carrots with my baby Jilly, and to get some item when you are paying mostly for either package design or brand name isn't something I buy into being that stuff impresses me, not her.  That being said I did like this product and more importantly Jilly loved it.  These have the same X shape as a dentastix, so I have to assume it would help getting rid of some plaque buildup, although there are no claims on the package.  The cinnamon and spice flavor was potent enough that I could smell it when I opened the package, which I liked, being I knew what she is getting.  And even though the flavor might be more for me than for Jilly, it sure is an improvement over liver flavors etc.Compared to similar products this was harder and took her more time to eat, which I liked.  It took her about 8-10 minutes and a lot of similar type products she eats in just a few minutes.  All that being said, I really did enjoy the product for what it was, but I am not so sure about any weight loss or health benefits.  The L-Carnitine proudly displayed on the front of the package, right next to the antioxidants came off as something like lycopene does for people.  Sure it's good for you and you should eat more of it but when you do do you honestly notice a difference in the way you feel?  As to the weight loss aspects, my dog is only about 8 months old and she's normal weight, but a bit husky being she's a lab. She has some small milk dud sized treats that are her absolute favorites that are 3 calories each and a handful would have less calories than this bone, if weight was an issue and Jilly prefers a natural bone (real bone not rawhide) and it takes her a LONG time to eat and I can't believe the amount of calories she gets per preserving is more than 92.Basically, for what it is it's a very good product, that being said there are most likely better options out there if you aren't willing to spend money on the nice smell and nice packaging.  I'm not sure if I would order it again, but maybe being I like to give her a verity in treats being she eats the same old same old kibble.4 1/2 stars.

These are Arctic dried catfish skins.  When I took them out of the shipping box, although I couldn't smell anything, all at once my three dogs were clustered around me.  They wouldn't leave.  Because the skins are quite large length wise and my dogs are small, the skins have to be cut.  not broken, not cut with scissors, but cut with a sharp knife.  Although there is a smaller size, the "tall' ones are more economical.  And the "kids" LOVE them. It takes a while for them to eat these skins too, because they are really tough.  We keep the opened box in the refrigerator in our garage.  A little too smelly for in a cabinet.  But the dogs adore them.  These are something they'd never turn down.

We have 2 large dogs, one LOVES rawhides of any kind, and she'll eat these just fine.  The other dog isn't that crazy about rawhides overall, will take one of these, immediately look for a place to bury it and that's the end of it til it's dug up by the other dog.  Many of my dogs have seemed to prefer a thinner rawhides, and alot of these are quite thick.  I don't care for that either, since with ANY rawhide treat I've ever bought, moderation is necessary.  Basically, rawhides are leather, and too many of them can cause constipation or other digestion issues.  I, personally, would never feed a small dog a whole piece of this particular rawhide treat as some are quite thick and they seem pretty "tough" (So good luck trying to cut them into smaller pcs!)  These are really inexpensive compared to other rawhides, though, and there are ALOT of them in this 5 lb bag! If your dogs love anything rawhide, this is a good choice. Otherwise, I'd look for a better quality rawhide treat.  (Such as "Merrick Hungry Dog Value Pack", 2 lb bag, favored by both my dogs.)
summary: If your dog LOVES rawhides, these are a good choice (IN MODERATION).

reviewText: Ok, we have so many toys for our little fuzzy guys.  We purchased these as a holiday gift for all of the kitties in our family.  We gave a few to our little guys and they went nuts for them.  I wake up with them laying next to me as gifts from them!  Great little gift idea and there are so many in the pack!  :3

Right now, "Mini Naturals" are the only treat that I give to my dog.  I prefer them for several reasons:1) Ingredients:  When you buy any food or treat for your dog, it is always important to look at the ingredients and the first ingredient especially.  The first ingredient in the chicken flavored mini naturals is chicken.  In a lot of other treats it is something less nutritious like sugar or corn meal.2) Calories: I have a dog that gains weight easily.  Each mini natural has only 3 calories.  Many other treats have 15.  My dog has lost a little weight since I switched from the other treats I was using to mini naturals.  Although the treats are small in size, they are large and tasty enough to get my dog to do what I want him to do (most of the time).3) Flavor: My dog seems to like the chicken flavor the most.  He will eat the others but definitely seems to notice the difference and have a preference for chicken.  They all look the same to us but maybe not to our dogs.4) Buying on Amazon: I have been buying mine at a health pet food store.  But I was pleased to notice that it is actually a better deal to buy them on Amazon.  I will be doing this in the future.
Work great and fit perfectly.  I would highly recommend this product to anyone who needs replacement parts for the 500 series!

This toy is great even after your dog has figured out what to do. Somehow my little monster was able to get the ball separated in half and get the "adjuster" out, but she still loves it and spends hours a day pushing it around the house.
He likes Crispies better, but these were less expensive, so we compromised.  Well, for now.  You all know who's really the boss around here.
summary: The picky old kitty is OK with them.

reviewText: My German Shepherd Loves this Toy and I do too.  I am disabled and my GSD service dog likes to play fetch.  I like the rope so I can fling the ball without having to perform an over hand throw.  My dog usually chews the rope off the toy first thing.  For some reason he does not do so with this one.  Probably because of the knot at the bottom.  Good product.
summary: My German Shepherd Loves this Toy

reviewText: I've bought this stuff several times. It's sooo handy and gets the smell out.I have one cat that pees on specific things (ie: wet towels and shoes...). We've tried just about everything to get her to stop (vet visits, antidepressants, feliway, calming collars, changing litters, etc). Some things help, but she still does it some. I think it's become a habit. So, I try to do what I can to treat any spots. Luckily, I don't have much carpet in my house and she doesn't care about furniture. This stuff works well to get the smell out and seems to help keep her from peeing in the same spot over and over.

This may not be an issue inland, but in  coastal areas , this type of litter box should NOT be used as the waste may cause toxoplasmosis to enter coastal waters.  Toxoplasmosis has been linked to death in sea otters. Other sea mammals may also be affected. Since cat waste often is a source of toxoplasmosis, it should never be flushed!Do I own a unit? No. So I'm sure that people will point out that this is a place to review the unit. I know that, I'm pointing out something many people would not think about otherwise.

My 9lb dog likes most of the pieces in this food.  She picks out the chicken first and then will come back and eat the other two kibbles (corn and peas). I did not like that corn was listed in the ingredients list along with soy because theses are allergen triggers for some dogs. But all and all my dog did enjoy this food.
summary: My dog likes most of the pieces

reviewText: I have bought five packs of these springs and I have to say the cat which is two cant get enough of them.  I have shared them with friends and there cats as well like them.
We love all of the Stella and Chewy's product flavors and appreciate the ease of use.  Since it is freeze dried, can be packed for trips, put in hurricane prep box, or in doggie to go satchel

What can I say.  They are Chuckit Balls.  If you got the rubber ball with you Chuckit you know what I am talking about.  If you got the tennis ball these are denser, go farther, don't hold dirt and last longer.  I would recommend them to anyone with a Chuckit.

I tried this collar out on two dogs, both smaller miniature schnauzers. One dog was never able to get used to the leash part that hung down.  She just stayed in one spot and acted like she was in trouble no matter us trying to get her to move around.  The other dog acted like it was just an ordinary collar and didn't notice the leash and carried on like normal.  I think before ordering this collar you need to analyze how sensitive your dog is to changes on their collars.  With the dog that didn't mind it, it was a handy addition to have.  It is quick and easy to grab and restrain him if necessary.  It doesn't have a "stop" on it, so the dog can go the length of the cord before being stopped, but it isn't excessively long, so no worries.  I found it very handy and I would like to try it on some of my larger dogs and see how it holds up.
summary: Handy but some dogs don't like it

reviewText: I bought this for my 5 yr old yorkie who has terribly bad doggie breath. It started noticeably working the first time she drank but I noticed she was apprehensive about drinking, so I tried using half as much of the product and it still seems to be helping her breath and she is drinking normally again.

My puppy loves this bed, especially now in winter. Nice, cozy and warm. I was concern at first to buy this item since one customer left feedback that bed was destroyed after washing. I wash it on wool/hand cycle and then I put it in dryer on gentle cycle and bed is as new. No problems at all. I am really impressed by quality of this product since the price is pretty low. I definitelly recommended it. There is little bit of shedding when my pup is fighting war with his toys, but nothing concerning. I believe this bed will last long time.
Wonderful addition to any dogs diet. It is good for their heart health and keeps the coats gleaming. Have used this with all my LH dachshunds

I have two cats -- one who is almost nine, but acts like he's about three (Loki), another who is about a year and a half (DiNozzo).  Loki seems to think most of the toys are his, so I primarily bought this for DiNozzo (though Loki gave me dirty looks for not getting him a new toy too).  DiNozzo plays with the frog often, sometimes even carrying it around.  I have seen Loki bring the frog upstairs and drop it, but I haven't seen him play with it, which is good because I wanted DiNozzo to have a toy that is his.  I highly recommend this little frog.
I really expected this thing to be big enough to hang a coat on for some reason. Well it's not- more like keys. I will be returning it.

I have not had a lot of birds. Each type of bird, and of course each individual bird of any type, is likely to react to new things differently.That being said, my canary, Makana, did not go near this perch for weeks. He loves his millet sprays, so I began wrapping them around the perch. Although highly suspicious of the perch, he tentatively started reaching for the millet.At the beginning he was usually either reaching from another perch (hanging by his toenails) or clinging onto the side of the cage. Finally,as the size of the spray decreased, he began perching cautiously while he munched the seeds. He does not seem too interested in perching there without the millet incentive, however. He prefers his rope swing and wooden perches. Since he is a young bird and pretty animated, it surprised me that he didn't show more interest. Again, that could just be his personality.

I have several cats, two of which are Ragdolls, very large cats (they can reach the kitchen counters when standing on their hind feet). So let me tell you, that this litter pan is the best I've found for my big cats. No more 'dumping over the side' of the box. They can easily walk in and turn around without crowding to do their business. Naturally, it takes a fair bit of litter to fill this box to an appropriate level, and frequent cleaning is encouraged. The smooth sides and bottom make it easy to scoop, and the high sides have really helped keep the surrounding areas clean of urine. Highly recommended for large cats or multiple cat households.One con:  I wish the front was a little higher, as they can really scoop the litter out the front when covering up their business.
summary: Big enough for really big cats

reviewerName: Carolyn Bragg or C. Bragg "Carolyn Bragg"
reviewText: My cat is a kicker, so even an extra tall litter box wasn't keeping the sharp litter rocks from hurting our feet. I changed to a different type of litter, but this mat handeled the big clay rocks and now the smaller granules like magic. Seriously. I put this mat in front of the litter box and it's comfortable to walk on with bare feet any time, keeping the litter in thousands of little pockets away from our feet--or hands and knees if needed. It is so easy to empty, by opening either end and dumping in the garbage!Although money is tight, this is well worth the price for me, and I smile every time I walk on the mat instead of tracking kitty litter around the floor!
summary: The Cat Mat YOU WILL LOVE!

reviewText: Better late than never, but I sure wish I has seen this BEFORE my squirming, wiggling, bundle of joy came to her forever home.My damage is primarily on woodwork, making this size perfect. I used a bit of spackle to repair the scratches, painted, and then covered. It goes on like painters tape, but clear.Great idea.
summary: Terrific gift for new pet parents!

reviewText: My dogs and I absolutely hate it. This machine does not work the way it should and it was a waste of my money. It does not really trim my dogs nails and they let me know that they are not so happy about it.

Recently I've read a number of books on natural food supplements for dogs and most recommend safflower oil as a healthy additive to your dogs' diet, good for both digestion and coat.  These Pet Natural tablets are a convenient way of getting some healthy nutrients into your dogs' food, especially if they don't like oil added to their regular meals.  My dogs munch 'em down like treats.

Great simple toy for my cockatiels. I will catch them playing with the bell at the end. I also like to stick pieces of fruit within the lattice of the globes to offer a kind of foraging for them. Great enrichment piece, I definitely recommend it.

UPDATE: Tracking it all over the house finally got to me. Switched to World's Best, which is more expensive, but doesn't track and is easier to scoop. The Pine works well for the scent and the cats were fine with it, but it got EVERYWHERE. Oh well.I love this litter so far. My cats have taken to it immediately, even when given a choice between clay and this, they don't seem to differentiate.PROS:1) Safe for environment and pets and people. Only pine and guar gum, all natural. Cardboard rather than plastic container.2) Covers smell really well, and even when scooping I find the pine wood doesn't smell as bad as the clay, to me.3) Lighter to carry, and to change box.4) Scoopable, though I recommend a scoop with really wide slots5) My cats seem to like it6) This is key: Doesn't turn into mud or grind into dirt that sticks to the floor when tracked or walked on accidentally. My floor keeps getting little clay spots which are hard to get off when a bit of clay tidy cat gets stepped on. Yuck. Pine doesn't grind in, it just sweeps right up.CONS:1) Tracks and gets kicked out of the litter box very easily. Travels very far.Bottom line: If you have a good vacuum, this litter rocks, but it does travel more than clay, so you really do need to vacuum every day.Still I feel much better about the environmental and health aspects of this litter.I've only been using it for two weeks, so we'll see if my mind changes.
summary: Great litter, but gets all over

reviewText: It works to stop the dog from barking, but it has to be refilled quite often. It works just have to keep it filled.

My 2 cats have been eating Taste of the Wild before trying this. I leave food out for them to eat as much as they want whenever they want. They eat noticeably less (about 1/4 - 1/3 cup) per day by volume. Add it up day by day and it makes a huge difference. They have no problem with the flavor, as they both chowed down on the new food when mixed with the old. The size of the kibble is like other Science Diet kibbles. It's somewhat small - my cats tend to swallow small kibbles. I would prefer the kibble to be larger so I could force the cats to bite down on the kibble and chew so there is some friction against the teeth.

I use two pumps in my turtle tank I have a 55 gl but this one I have too put on a brick it can go in the water all the way so I love it it works great, the filters are great and most of the time a good price I buy the filters all the time , but I do reuse them just clean them

I used these for my golden retriever and they always worked VERY well. They would get 5 stars if they included heart-worm medication in the formula. I eventually decided to shift to a vet recommended flea/tick/heartworm formula that saved me from having to use two different medications and worked just as well.

not just five stars.  Our dog loves many of this company's treats.  Her favorite seems to be the mini treats that come in small bags (and now live in the car's glove box).  She also likes the full size really smelly bacon-strip size treats...nut we don't, since they are really smelly.  These seem like a good compromise.  We'll get them again.
This container holds 20 lbs of dry food very easily.  It is easy to open and to snap shut.  I like the fact that it is tall and slender.  Very convenient item.
bought this as a gift for my cousin's black lab, she loved it and chewed on it non stop. the size was just right for her
I have 6 Cats.  They love this toy out of all the toys they have!  They can play with this for hours if I let them.  Even my abused, skittish, and neglected cat, that I took in can't resist this toy.

I bought this for my 12lb Havanese that loves to play.  I thought it would be fun because of the legs that make it bounce all over.  He loves it and it is a nice size for him, I would say slightly larger than a golf ball plus the legs.  The down side to the small size is that it is hard to squeak.  The squeaker hits the opposite side of the ball and you really have to work to make it squeak. Other than that, it is a good toy and not too heavy.  My dog loves it and thats all that really matters.
summary: Hard to squeak, but still loved

reviewText: Recommended!My Cats immediately flocked to it for scratching & sleepy time alike =). First it was resting then it went to the scratching which was & is cool. They seem to really enjoy it as much as I do. The look of the design & functions are attractive to me in the sense it seems fun, entertaining. I'd recommend if your thinking about it to just go for it, it's worth the investment for its intended purpose.

I use this for my dog during walks on warm/hot days, or if he just seems to be panting a lot.  It seems to make him more comfortable in the hot weather.  I put ice in the collar if he's going to be outside, and use the refreezable gel inserts (Kool Tube) if he's in the house.  The refreezable gel inserts only stay cold for about 30-40 minutes, so they need to be switched out several times during the day.  I recommend getting a few of the inserts if your dog is going to be wearing this indoors or other places that you don't want him to be dripping water.
summary: good to keep dogs cool in hot weater

reviewText: These are more flexible than other brands, so easier to put on cans. They dishwash well. The colors are fun and don't seem to fade.
summary: Work great! So much better than plastic wrap over cans!

reviewText: I have seven cats and this is the best scratching post I have used. I have had it now for a year and it is holding up well. All of the cats use it and has very little wear. It also is right in the middle of my living room and is visually appealing. Very sturdy and my cats also use it to sit on. An excellent scratching post, I plan on purchasing one for the shelter I volunteer at.
combined with Seachem Bag Filter, my tank has been much more stable and therefore easier to clean,  Not as worried about crashing the nitro-cycle.

I love the playpen for my puppy of 2 months. She loves it. I actually used a crate with it on the side to make it like a little house for her. So she is spoiled. The only thing I don't like is the top doesn't zip right. It's hard to zip close. The side zippers are good but now that she is getting bigger she will def hop over so i closed what i could on top. Other than that it is great. I will post pics to show you what I did with crate.
my dog loved them and 2 pounds will last awhile i always take thm when i visit my family with dogs too never found a dog yet that doesnt like my neighbors cat ate one lol great buy

Pros:- Leak free for 6 months and counting- Mounts super easily to wire cages- Bottle portion is held sturdily but can be removed easily to refill- Versatile with mounting options- Holds enough water for at least week for our 40 lb Pit/lab- Cleans fairly easilyCons:- Took my dog a little while to get the idea- The color did not match the picture, mine was a light grey- The lid section is a joke, it simply slides off so you will never need to use it. Its not really a big deal, it fills easier without it- The plastic seems a little porous, so i do have some concerns over leeching and staining etc.This is simply a gigantic version of the gerbil water device. It works well enough once she figured it out, and the price point is good. Keeps her hydrated when she is kenneled for extended periods.Mounted it on the outside of the cage as high as i could, only the metal nozzle sticks through the wire so there isn't any chance of a chewing incident. Despite many other reviews i haven't had a single leak.I would certainly recommend this!
summary: Does the job, although it took some time for my dog to learn it

reviewText: I got this for my chinchilla. I often use bird toys as they tend to be more entertaining than conventional chinchilla toys and usually takes rufus longer to destroy. The picture really doesn't do the size justice - its tiny and im pretty sure it was destroyed within a few minutes.
These are really handy and great for keeping dog food fresh. I love that they come in a three pack and they work great and fit perfectly!

I must have been half asleep when I ordered this dog food because I was looking for a food that was not only grain free but chicken free I didnt even notice until 2nd shipment arrived that it has chicken in it My mistake Having said that the dogs like it ok but cancelled my recurring shipment because I need food grain and chicken free for my dogs with allergies
My cats actually pull this off the shelf onto the floor wanting it!  They try to get into the bag on their own... They LOVE IT!
I was running out of my Petrodex Poultry flavored toothpaste and decided to give this a shot.  My dog loves the taste, which is 90% of the battle when trying to brush a dogs teeth.
Well another ripped apart dog toy in under 5 minutes..I would NOT purchase this if I were you..it's not worth any time nor any money!

reviewText: Since my cat's love it, I buy it. They liked the chicken flavor for a while, but prefer the fish, of course. This "adult" and the "mature adult" varieties are formulated for our senior cats with less phosphorus (easier on the kidneys) and a different ratio of vitamins and minerals, plus a bit less fat and more protein for our less active cats. They like it, and that makes the choice easy for me. Amazon has a better price than the pet stores or the vet.

reviewText: Both our dogs love this big turtle but within 3 days, one of the dogs was able to bite open one of the legs and get to some stuffing. The rest of it seems to be fine and she hasn't been able to rip into more.

In the description above, and in my Subscribe and Save future orders page, the description says, "Milk Bone Large Biscuits for Dogs, 4-Pounds (Pack of 2) ASIN: B0043OX51U."  Does this mean I should be expecting two 4-pound boxes, or 4 pounds of biscuits in two boxes of 2 pounds each?  In either case, I received neither.  I got one 4-pound box, and at least half the milkbones were broken (the dogs don't care, but it was sloppy packaging -- my UPS guy had to retape the exterior box, which contained other items as well, just to get it to the house from his truck).  Two 2-pound boxes might fix the breakage problem.  But If Amazon did indeed mean 2 4-pound boxes, I was shorted on my last order.  Please clarify!

I never want my cats to go through the misery of being without water.  This automatic waterer lets me be sure they have water whenever they want it.  Clean water.  I can fill the bottle and know no matter how long I'm stuck at work I don't have to worry about the kitties going thirsty.  And it's very easy to clean.I had invested in some of the electric-pump filtered water fountains, but my cats ignore those and go to their old faithful Bistro, so I'm unplugging the fountains and adding some more Bistro waterers around the house.

reviewText: My cat showed no interest in this bed, and jumped out immediately when I put him in it. I gave it to my neighbor whose small dog's coat had been trimmed so much he couldn't keep warm in the winter. He loved the bed.

reviewText: I haven't found a window in my house yet that I can install in but I stiil have two more to try

reviewText: I recently purchased this Da Bird value pack along with some other toys. My cats are getting older, and putting on weight. They are very uninterested in all their old toys, and most new ones I have tried. Both of them just sit there and watch me play with it like I am TV! They went absolutely bonkers for this toy!! Both of them played for a long time, and still went after it when they were worn out. It is a really long pole, I finally settled on the top of the fridge as my storage spot for it. With how the nice springy long pole seems to help the "action", I am very glad I got this one instead of the one with the pole that comes apart.
no more cat litter strewn all around, now just a little at the entryway.  no more peeing off the back corner of the box, that all stays inside now.  easy to remove lid for cleaning.

Since I have been sprinkling a capsule on her food each day, I have seen a big difference in the gait of my 20 year old feline. And this is by far cheaper than the prednisone and other DRUGS the vet wanted me to give her. But my vet also gives Cosequin high marks.

reviewText: Fluffy ate a couple more than I planned when I dropped themand she was one HAPPY pooch.Another keeper to reorder!
To much of a hassle getting them mounted. Once they are mounted they will not stay on the bottom. Not for Side mounting which would have been much better.
Best cat food ever!  If you love your animals, feed them like you do!  NO byproducts, just good protein and veggies.

I wasn't sure whether or not our two cats would "play ball" with this toy.  Well, they do.  They want treats enough to more than happily bat the treats out so they can eat them.It's really very entertaining to watch.  Watching our fat cat desperately trying to bat the treats out with her paws is great fun to watch.I was skeptical that they'd understand and use it, but no problems.  Give it a try!

This is a terrific product for my skin sensitive dog and my cat too.  My dog doesn't really like his food when I put salmon oil in it, so these gel caps are a great alternative.  The gel caps are shaped like little fish.  If I want to feed my dog the entire gel cap, I hide a couple of them in his food and he eats them up like he would eat his normal food, especially in wet food.  Sometimes he'll spit it out if I put them in his dry food, so I wrap the little fish gels in a slice of roast beef and he swallows them right down.  If I want to sprinkle the fish oil in my cat's food, all I have to do is twist the tail off the little fish gel cap and squeeze into the cat's food and he eats his food up enthusiastically.  The fish caps seem to be doing wonders for both animals.  A great product by a company (Animal Essentials) that I'm really becoming a fan of.  A great idea that works.
summary: Great alternative for dogs who don't like taste of fish oil.

reviewText: I bought this hoping it could stand up to my dog.  No such luck!  It did take him a while to shred it but by a while I mean and hour or so. The material is heavy and appears to be durable. If your dog doesn't typically doesn't destroy his chew toys then you'll be fine.  If many toys don't stand up to your dog then I wouldn't recommend this one.  I really thought it would be strong enough but within 30 minutes it was half gone and the squeaker was out.  :/
Product is good.  I just wanted something to have handy and small to give my pups water.  It does the job well.
They are made with pumpkin which is healthy for digestion.Made without all of the junk ingredients in them.Would recommend them!

I take my two dogs to daycare 5 days a week. I needed a harness to keep them still in my car for their safety and mine. This harness works GREAT. It keeps them restrained but still gives them enough room to sit up, lay down, turn around etc. Best of all, it's cushioned and comfy. My dogs don't mind wearing them.
summary: This harness works GREAT. It keeps them restrained but still gives them ...

reviewText: Dogtra is recognized as one of the best brands for a reason. This works great, and you can easily buy accessories like larger or smaller prongs. I mostly use it for my 70-lb dog, but it fits the 17-lb dog without weighing her down or looking ridiculous, which is why I chose it over the Dogtra 1900NCP. The range is plenty for most purposes (hunting dogs may need the longer range). The range of stimulation is also plenty. My 70-lb dog rarely needs over 20 on a 0-100 scale. My only complaints are:After about 6 months of (not everyday) use, the little plugs that protect the charging ports from water started to not seat as tightly.The stimulation dial does not click as you turn it, so you have to look at it while you adjust and check frequently to make sure it's on the right level.The controls are not backlit or glow-in-the dark.The three buttons are not intuitively or symbolically labeled, so you have to explain them to a new user.
summary: Great remote collar, with just a little room for improvement

reviewText: My 1 year old cat loves to play with toys....some are his favorite go-to's that he plays with on his own,. and some I can coax him into playing with if I do all the work..  Unfortunately, this WobbleBobble left him completely flat no matter what I did.  He paid 1-2 seconds' of attention to it when I kicked or pushed it, trying to get his attention, but then he turned/walked away.The bell just makes a rattling sound and not a "bell sound"--doesn't interest him at all.  If on an un-carpeted floor, the toy will spring back upright after being pushed, but on carpet, it will lay on its side unless touched or pushed again.  The little feather at the top of the little antenna is very small, and it is attached directly to the antenna, there is not much movement.  In addition, if the toy was made from a rubber material, and not hard plastic, it may have more appeal to cats, as it would have a different type movement when batted around and when it hits the floor.  So the concept is good, but materials and construction needed more thought to appeal to most cats.
summary: It's a bust for my cat.

reviewText: My puppy really enjoyed this food. However, it always gave him loose runny stools which was a pain to clean up. We even tried to mix it with dried food but his stools never improved until we stopped feeding him this.

My dog loves Dingo rawhide bones and these treats.  He has been enjoying them for several years now.  Warning:  Never feed any rawhide treat unless you can be there while he/she is eating it.  Dogs can easily choke on any rawhide treat.
summary: My dog loves these treat sticks

reviewText: This is a HIT for 5 out of our six cats, although the 6th one enjoys watching the others have fun as much as we do!!  I've had my eye on this for a while and my husband surprised us with it. An instant hit with Apollo who tends to hog it but sometimes two play with it at the same time; even 7-yr old Smokey who rarely plays loves it.  They like to leap over it too attempting to catch the ball before it finishes the circuit.  I am ordering a 2nd set to expand it as they play with it daily; besides it is cheaper to do that than to order the extra pieces separately, besides they are of inferior quality than the original set. I wish the quality of the track was slightly better; I just check where they connect regularly.  It is as fun as a train set for kids but for cats!!********************************************************************************UPDATE: Kitties are using their third set.  Originally ordered a second set, was extremely disappointed by the quality as it arrived all dented and none of the pieces connected properly; the poor quality was similar to that of the extra pices when purchased separately.  Contacted Amazon who sent me a replacement free of charge within 48 hours even before I had returned the 2nd set back; they even reimbursed me for shipping the defective tracks back to them!!My third set is as nice as the first set my husband had purchased with Amazon.  All 6 adult kitties are very happy as now even three kitties can play together with three balls in different locations and with two combined sets, I can change the configurations anytime.This is still one of the best purchases we have made for our cats.  Highly recommend it!  Hmmm, debating if adding a third track might be even funner?  My advice to all those who wrote negative reviews about this toy regarding defective tracks: you should have contacted Amazon, they would have replaced it for free and you would have been as happy as my kitties and me!
wheat free, digestible, great for teeth - those are my requirements when I buy bones. These last a while, too. (between 10 min. to an hour, depending on the dog and the size bone you pick).
summary: wheat free, digestible, great for teeth & breath

reviewText: I have two Australian shepherds and one of them eats slowly and carefully, savoring every bite. No more inhalation of Le Kibble.Plus, it is super cute and fun to watch her nose out every piece. I think she actually enjoys it too!

reviewText: We were very happy users of this company's no-handle version (Earth Rated Dog Waste Bags,Lavender Scented, 8 Rolls, 120-Count), but decided to try these before committing to a large purchase.You'll notice that the measurements listed for these handle bags are two inches shorter than those without handles. But they're really even smaller than that, since handle length is included in the measurements. I posted a photo on this product page showing the comparison. (Click the link "See this customer image" to the right of these reviews.)Our dog is 80 pounds and for his smaller "productions" these are fine... but in other cases, we feel a bit insecure using them! No one likes to think they may accidentally touch the waste.Plus, these aren't on rolls so you can't use them in the standard handy bag dispenser. You can put them in a fanny pack, but risk making anything else in there smell like lavender too.Positives: these are easier to open than the type on rolls, and it's kind of nice to have the little loops to carry them with after tying off.But our next order wasEarth Rated Dog Waste Poop Bags, Lavender Scented, 60 Rolls, 900-Count.
summary: For a large dog, go for the version without handles

reviewText: This case of 200 puppy pads was a good buy for the money.  But they are flimsy and as I get more bucks up I purchase a different brand which is much thicker.  These are really thin but my dogs seem to love them as they use them almost constantly.  I recommend them highly if the thicker ones are too expensive for you.
summary: Puppy Wee Wee pads are good deal.

reviewText: This is by far my cat's favorite attachment! And it's really well made. I would very much recommend this attachment.

reviewText: I purchased two of these hoping that my Bostons would enjoy playing with the toy; however, the first one lasted approx. 20-minutes before it was destroyed in a tug of war battle so I gave the second one to someone w/ a dog not so agressive.  The AKC rabbit and squirrel last much much longer and I would recommend them hands down over this monkey.

This is my second one of these harnesses. This one appears to be a newer model, or at least a different one, and I like it even better: this one has a D ring on the chest for a 2nd leash attachment option (very useful for a dog who needs gentle encouragement to follow on a walk), and the plastic buckles that fasten the part that lies on dog's back are positioned higher so they are less likely to interfere with legs when walking (tho the older one I have clears my dog's legs OK). The harness is well made and works beautifully with my miniature poodle (14lbs, & 17" around the chest), both as a car harness and as a walking harness. The easiest harness I've ever bought to get on & off. Dog seems very comfortable & safe.
Unless I spray the furniture every day, the cats still find the spots they love to scratch most and go full-on. So I guess it works, within bounds.

My 11 yo medium sulfer crested pain in the butt cockatoo loves this and has been on it since I got him at 10 months. I mix this with the veggie version of this diet and the nut. This one is his favorite. Never had any skin, health or plumage problems.As a vet tech and registered lab animal tech and holder of half a dozen certificates in all sorts of related and unrelated animal stuff, one of which is animal nurtrition..I can tell you that seed diets are NOT good. Birds will pick out the fattening high oil content seeds they LIKE (like kids picking out the candy vs the veggies) and this results in POOR health, poor feather quality and more often skin issues. ALWAYS choose a pelleted diet for your feather friends!!
summary: My cockatoo loves this and has for years.

reviewText: This is the most popular toy since the chili pepper that's on it's last legs. Bunny kicking and everything. He was at it as soon as I took it out of the package.

reviewText: This clipper starts out with a dull blade, and the replacement blade it comes with is also dull. Very hard to get the blade to slice through the nail, and when it finally gives way with a loud whack, it jaggedly cracks the poor dog's nail and leaves broken edges, torn bits of nail that remain and you have to cut off, and worst of all, it cracks and chips pieces of nail above the point you are cutting. This leads to pain for the dog! All other people's reviews on other sites of this product have stated the same things I have here. Even one groomer who rated this clipper and said she had been a professional groomer for 20 years said "it's the suckiest clipper ever made." No one believes this clipper is any count at all except Millers Forge themselves! I am so sorry I wasted my money on this. One use and in the garbage can it goes.
summary: Worst quality guillotine clipper ever made

reviewText: Small dogs love them and and seem to use it as a binkey or comfort toy my little one carries it around all the time - sqeeker dies quickly with chewers

My dog is a 6 yr. old 100 pound Dobie and she has never learned to walk on a leash despite training classes and buying at least 6 types of collars including Gentle Leaders which served no purpose except to put a huge scar across her snout. She has been determined to pull and is very strong, pulling me down the street every time I walk her. I was apprehensive purchasing this harness as I have tried everything available. I was absolutely amazed the first time I put it on her she walked with me, still pulling but very gently, about 1/10th of what she used to pull. She is so strong that she tripped me while walking with a gentle leader and pulled me down the sidewalk on my stomach until I got control. This harness is amazing. After just 5 uses she no longer pulls and walks with me as this harness holds her breast and stops her in her tracks if she tries to pull. I especially like the very thick padded portion which goes under her legs which is not uncomfortable to her and does not scar her skin as Dobies are very prone to skin problems. She tolerates this very well where with the gentle leader she used to stop every 500 feet or so to try to get it off of her snout. Great product. The only minor complaint I have is the instructions on the package it comes in are hard to follow because they are so small. I would recommend this leash to anyone who has a dog who doesn't want to walk normally on a leash.

I'll rate it only 3 stars. This is why... I got these treats for my dysplastic Lab mix puppy (not severe, and thought these might help) AND my 10 year old GSD mix, who is moderately arthritic.NEITHER dog liked the treats. The puppy took the treat, fiddled it around in his mouth a bit, then spit it out and stared at it. The old dog sniffed the treat, but refused to touch it. She sniffed it and her head shook and a pure look of "disgust" went on her face and she walked off.When I opened the bag, this horrible medicinal smell came out, and honestly... the treats even LOOK like medicine. Brown and boring. I think the beneficial supplements in these treats repulse some dogs or something. I have no idea.I was able to convince the puppy to eat the "treat" but the old dog would NOT eat it. I tried to hide it in some sandwich meat, no go. Tried to use some cheese, no go. So, this treat won't be able to help the old dog as she won't touch it, which automatically knocks down the treats rating.The rating will go up if this seems to help my puppy, but the taste of them is in question because neither of my dogs like it. The Lab mix puppy is very greedy (as are all Labs/Lab mixes) so he finally ate it. I'm not sure how people are saying their dogs love these treats, neither of my dogs were fond of them....August 29th. Treats are now gone. Nigredo (the puppy) picked at them each and every day. Jade, the dog that they were truly for wouldn't touch them, absolutely hated them. Could never get her to eat even one. See no improvement in the puppy, but as it's dysplasia... didn't expect much. Reviews goes down to 2 stars. Didn't help me at all!

I am very disappointed that this stroller arrived defective. When we attached all the wheels and rolled the stroller around the driveway, the front wheels just hopped up and down, and the left wheel looked like it was going to fall off. It looked that way because of the pipes that were bent inward.  The front wheels attached fine but when you rolled the stroller they wobbled and jumped around so much that the stroller was hard to push. The front frame pipes where the front wheels attach are really bent inward - both at different angles. On closer examination, it looks like the pipes where not attached to the main frame correctly, at least that is what we are assuming. It looks like the bend should have been facing outwards and not inwards, both at different angles.The back wheels worked great and the handle was padded with 2 lock positions.The actual stroller is a lovely blue color and the netting very well sewn in with velcro to hold the screens up. I did notice the front seam was straining around the front of the seat base frame - the seam is sewn up the middle. The stitches were pulling and the thread (seam) holes enlarged enough to see light through. The cloth could eventually rip from the constant strain in that area. The cover was very tight on the bottom.Also, the locks on the front wheels were not the ones in the instruction booklet that came with the stroller. These were black half moons and pushed into place instead of the red slide button shown to lock the front wheels in the instruction booklet. The instruction booklet also says this stroller is for pets up to 145 pounds but the package says the stroller is for pets up to 150 pounds. I don't know  why the package and instruction booklet doesn't match.Other than those defects the stroller was nice and roomy and our dog would really have enjoyed taking a ride. I am returning this stoller because of the defects and ordering another one. I really like Pet Gear and have quite a few of their products. I do think they need to tighten up their quality control though after this stroller's problems.
summary: Defective Front Wheel Frame attachments for Wheels

reviewText: This did not keep my dog occupied for long but I know she likes it. In the morning, I set up this toy and also fill a kong bone with peanut butter and treats. She drops the bone and goes to this toy as soon as I put it down. So there is something that she enjoys about it.She's usually done within 5 minutes or so.That said, I am comfortable letting her play with this. I don't use any of the 'caps' when I'm not around because she likely would chew them. Other puzzle toys tend to have parts that can come or and be chewed or the toy itself is easily chewable. Our dog has shown no interest in trying to destroy this toy, and that's a big win!

I bought my Litter Robot last fall and it has exceeded my expectations.  I have two cats, approximately 11 lbs. each and they are happy as well with what I call the Sputnik.  Having used every type of non-electrical litter box ever designed, this one wins hands down.  Seven minutes after the cats use the robot it cleans automatically and the odor disappears.  Clean up is simple, open the drawer and tie a knot in the bag and dispose.  I use basic kitchen garbage bags with draw strings. Once in awhile both cats will try to go in at the same time and it's a very tight fit but they manage.  Well made, the robot withstands my cats jumping on top without moving and scaring them.  I travel once or twice a year for 4-5 days at a time.  Now I'm confident that even if my cat sitter were to forget to clean the box the cats would have a clean toilet to use and not leave any 'surprises' for me.  A nice bonus is that it uses far less litter than conventional litter boxes so I expect that savings to offset the higher price for this litter box. I use World's Best litter for multiple cats and it works great.

If your cats are recommend to be on a limited ingredient diet and they are used to a dry food, then this is a great food to put them on. The quality is good, my cats like it better than venison and green pea. My cats like it better than the canned verson. They are not used to canned food. Vets will recommend you used canned cat food. Cats have a way to deciding these things themselves.

After trying many products for a persistent bad odor that floats up from our basement, with little or no effect, I purchased several cannisters of Bad Air Sponge. This stuff really works and it works very quickly. Initially, it leaves a faint smell of its own but then even that is gone. In areas of the house that tend to be damp, we usedDampRid FG91 Easy-Fill System Any Room Moisture Absorberin addition to the Bad Air Sponge. Together, the two seem to be particularly effective.

reviewText: The perfect halter for the little black Chuweeny.  It is very strong and durable.  I recommend it highly for all smooth coated dogs.

Hey, let's face it. $50 is a lot of money to spend on a scratching post, but after buying several different types, I can say that this is by far the best you can buy. reviewText: Love it! My boyfriend got it for me since he new I was thinking of getting the cats one. I love it. I keep it in the bedroom where the cats hang out, and it's almost completely silent. By that time, your dog is already in the street or on some biker.Again, it'll get you by until you can save up for something more solid.  Like the PetSafe remote.

The collar works and has helped train my dog not to attack other animals on the farm, but it shuts off every 2 or 3 minutes.  This is very inconvenient.  Every time it shuts off I have to turn it back on before it deactivates.  If I get sidetracked and it is shut off for too long, I might try to press the "zap" button but nothing will happen.  So I'm constantly looking at the remote making sure it's on.  This is distracting and definitely inconvenient.

Marineland has come out with this ultra cool powerhead/circulation pump combo. I love powerheads in my tanks because of their efficency in moving water and filtration for a reverse or forward flow undergravel filter/or sponge powerhead combo. It has proven to be ideal in my clown loach tank where I am just using multiple penguin powerheads/sponge combo and have had them alive and thriving for nearly 10 years. When I saw the new Maxijet PRO I just had to give it a try. My clowns love playing in quick water as in nature they are from areas with high water movment-so I decided to buy this for the circulation mode. Other strong circulation filters are three times the price of these and are weaker or equal to the power. I have read many reviews saying they were very loud but I find mine to be very silent considering the power, only a very slight hum can be heard when I am within 3-4 feet. I found that at first when I started it it was really loud, but after a couple of minutes it became almost silent (I think the air had to be purged and propeller locked in, try shaking them a little and putting your hand over the back part where the water gets sucked in to quiet them down when you first get them up and running). Now when I turn them off and on during water changes the initial loud noise is gone and they start up perfectly. If I had saltwater tanks and were using them with a wave maker I probably would worry and instead spend a little more and buy the old maxijets with the aftermarket conversion kits or Hydors. But for my clown loach tank they are perfect, so perfect that I have decided to buy another one! Now, after reading the reveiws I am still worried about the reliability, but after finding out that the loudness is false I feel more secure with these. With a two year warranty like the penguin products I highly doubt they would make the new Maxijet Pro's as bad as some of the reviews have said. If anything, I can still use them as powerheads if the circulation mode fails. I have faith in marineland quality. I would recomend this to people with large tanks or people who keep fishes that love fast moving water! Oh.. and to add I think the black suction cups are great, much better than the crappy clear ones that come with the penguin models which seem to harden and become useless in half a year. I change out the clear ones and use the black suction cups and dont have problems with my powerhead falling anymore. With three of them I feel pretty safe. Maybe saltwater is different and much harder on the suction cups, makes sense since salt water tends to quickly dry out, crack, and corode rubber products...Update: Since using them for a little while I can see no problems with their reliability and they are solid powerheads like other marineland products. I do however have a little problem with them heating up my tank water. Since I live in a tropical climate my tanks are naturally around 82 to 84 degrees which is warm enough already. I put two in a thirty gallon tank and my tanks temperature skyrocketed to 90 degrees! I have since moved them into my 125 gallon and have no problems with them raising the temperature. Could be great if you live in a colder climate which could save you money on a heater!Update #2: After using them in circulation mode for a while I have noticed that they have a huge problem creating heat. They give off so much heat that they have even become a problem in my 125 gallon tank. I had to take one off and am now only running one of them. The temperature increase is not noticable with only one of them, but when I try to run two of them it can go up to 88 degrees (normal temperature hovers around 82-84 degrees) in my 125 gallon tank. The reason why I say 88 degrees and not higher is because when I noticed the temperature was that high I took one of them off imediately. Would be great using them in a cooler climate (would take some of the strain off your heater), but here in Hawaii it can be a problem. They are still silent and dont seem like they are anywhere near breaking. The trio of suction cups hold on good and strong. They do make a rather loud clicking/grinding noise when first starting them up (after unplugging them) that makes me think like they might break, but after a few seconds they start up perfectly and do their job very quietly. I think the problem is their large power consumption compared to other circulation powerheads/pumps. I have two Hydor Koralia Evo 1400's that dont even come close to heating the water even in my 30 gallon tank (they also dont make the loud clicking noise when restarting). Still if your looking for a cheap circulation/powerhead and you live in a cool climate, or only want to use one in a large tank, or have a really large tank, they work great. Don't know what happened to other reviewers maxijet pro's but mines are really really quiet, infact over time they have become SILENT. I have to literally put my ear up to the tank where they are mounted to hear anything from them, even then they are still hard to hear (after the restart that is).

My cats, luckily, love these things. I think it has more to do with competition for ANY food than anything else. My old method of dosing involved grinding up a tablet of Lysine and putting it in beef gravy. My 3 cats loved that but it was messy and time consuming - though inexpensive. These treats are much more convenient. I find that they compete for most anything and can't stand to miss out on something that one of the other felines is eating. I maintain their good health with 1 treat twice daily. If one of them develops a weepy eye, I increase the dose to 2 treats twice daily until it clears. These are pretty expensive but much cheaper here on Amazon than at the vet's office.
summary: Better than my old dosing method!

These pads seemed like the ideal solution to occasional housebreaking problems. My other cresteds, although housebroken, have small bladders and no patience.The pads themselves have a plastic floor protecting barrier, a quick dry top sheet and an absorbent core.  The packaging boasts of  a pet attractor and an odor neutralizer.  The pads measure 21 by 23 inches, perfect for small dogs.Unfortunately the dogs do everything but eliminate on the pads.  They will ignore them, sleep on them, play with them and tear them to pieces.  They will however, pee everywhere else, all around them but never on them.  I tried them with the pad holder but still no go.  Each of the dogs in question was paper trained but apparently they have mental blcks when it comes to using these.  I think they are a good idea, especially if you are training a puppy.  But if you have an older dog or a stubborn dog, see if you can get a sample before committing to a whole pack.

I was having trouble deciding how many "stars" to give this product.  I don't think it's a bad product and I know that it works well for many dogs; but it REALLY didn't work for mine...and actually seemed to make him worse.My 2 year old German Shepherd was diagnosed with severe hip dysplasia at 5 months of age.  The orthopedist prescribed strong anti-inflammatories and pain meds for him to be on for the rest of his life.  Full hip replacement of both hips ($10,000) was only option with no guarantee that it would improve his quality of life.  I spent a lot of time researching online and talking to various holistic vets in hopes of finding a combination of natural supplements that would help his mobility and pain without destroying his liver.  The idea of giving a puppy these strong meds twice a day for the rest of his life seemed like a horrible plan.  After trying a few different well-known joint/health supplements, we settled on the one that seemed to offer him the most pain-free mobility.  Although his hind quarters will always wobble because of the joint defect, our current supplement regimen has allowed him to run and play with our other dog.  Usually 2-3 times a month, he'll still need the strong prescription meds after chasing too many tennis balls.Since he is still a very young dog, I have continued looking for other joint products to improve his joint cushioning.  After reading the positive reviews of the Hyaflex and talking to acquaintances who use it for their dogs, I emailed the Hyalogic company that produces it to see if it might work for situations such as my dog...or if it was intended more for older dogs suffering only from arthritis.  I have to say that their customer relations is GREAT.  The most I expected was an email response; but a representative of the company called me to address my questions.  She felt that it "could" work for my guy, but the main point she made was that it works great for many dogs, but not at all for some.  This is very consistent with everything I have read of hyaluronic acid for humans...whether it's knee injections or the oral form like this company's human version called Synthovial-7.  Hyaluronic acid works great for many, but not at all for others.It was worth it to me to give it a try.  So I ordered 2 bottles (not sure why I did that, maybe just optimistic?).  The Hyalogic rep indicated that if it is going to work for a dog, they generally experience noticeable improvement in 1-2 weeks.  After the first week on Hyaflex, it was tough to tell (mainly because he was already on a different, but very effective, natural supplement combination for inflammation/pain.  He did seem like he was more "raring to go" in the mornings; but was then considerably more stiff by late afternoons and through the evening.  I was still optimistic though; and I sort of excused his late day stiffness to the fact that he did seem like he was racing around more during the earlier parts of the day.  But after nearly 2 weeks on the Hyaflex drops, the afternoon/evening stiffness became much worse.  For the first time EVER, he would come to me whimpering in pain.  By early evening, he would struggle to stand up from a down position.  For the first time in well over a year, he was back on daily or twice/daily prescription meds.  I stopped adding the Hyaflex to his morning meal and he returned to normal (or his version of it) in a couple of days.Bottom-Line:  For those folks with dogs who don't respond to other joint supplements, I guess I would still recommend they try the Hyaflex; but with the understanding that their dog may be one of the ones that it doesn't help at all.  And also to watch for signs that their dog might be suffering from some type of reaction to it.  I do know a number of people who get great results for their dogs and swear by the product.
summary: Works for some/Not others -- Use CAUTION

reviewText: I bought this version (XL Heavy Duty) of Kong after my pit/lab mix destroyed the medium, red Kong and the medium, heavy duty Kong. I would have given this a 5 star rating but this Kong only lasted 1 year. Max, my pit/lab mix, managed to chew through the grooves in between the spheres.We bought more for our pit mix because these are the only toys that he CAN'T destroy within minutes. I put in sliced apples or small carrots to keep him busy. I, sometimes, use peanut butter but that can get messy. I wash these on the dishwasher every few weeks to keep the bacteria out of the middle of Kong.To size this Kong to your dog, I would choose a Kong where your dog has to have his or her mouth more than halfway open to have the large end of the Kong in the back of their mouth. Anything smaller (especially a pit bull) and they will leverage their jaw and chew through it quickly. Meaning they will use their back teeth to chew it open if it can fit one backside of their mouth.I hope that makes sense. :-)This is made very well and from what I understand, this is not harmful to your pet (in other words, chemicals that can leech into your pet's systems with each chew). I love this toy and I always have two on hand to keep Max busy for hours.

reviewText: I bought this collar for dog walks after dark during the winter months. I have a white dog and would have to say that the dog is more reflective than the collar unfortunately. It seems durable, however I don't feel the dog is much more visible when we use it.

This kit comes with a regular-looking toothbrush and a "finger" brush for your cat, as well as a tube of toothpaste. I had previously used a finger brush a couple of times with little success, so I stuck to trying the regular toothbrush.The brush looked like the bristles were too long, but when I set it down in front of my cats, they all loved the way it wobbled a little, and started to play with it and bite the bristles. Every day I presented them with the brush and started putting paste on the end of it, and they would pick it up in their mouths and practically brush their own teeth by chewing the bristles. I was very shocked (and happy) about this behavior.It has been about 3 weeks now, and the cats now accept me putting the brush against their teeth and slightly brushing. I haven't progressed to the point where I try pulling their gums back to reach farther along their molars, but all three of my cats are very accepting of the brush, and as long as I don't hold their head rigid and keep things lighthearted and don't push it, they stay happy. One cat (a kitten) doesn't care about the taste of the toothpaste, one cat sometimes acts interested in the paste, and a third cat actually comes running as though it's a treat.I highly recommend this product, and am so pleased that I found a brush that my cats don't run from.

My excellent vet suggested this product might help one of our senior dogs (15 years old) with new and troubling behaviors--panic attacks, sudden bouts of unexplained barking, and a general desire to be left alone. The dosage is one large pill for dogs up to 40 lbs, but our two old guys (littermates) are only 8 and 9 lbs, so I decided to give 2/3 of the pill to the dog with problems and the rest to his brother. Here's what happened:Dog #1 who was showing a lot of problems:--nothing changed at all for two weeks--during the third week, he started engaging our other dogs in play, something we haven't seen him do in years--by the fourth week, we realized he'd only had one panic attack and that was just two days after we started the NeutricksDog #2 who we didn't think needed as much help--again, nothing for two weeks--during the third week, he started walking UP THE STAIRS....something he hasn't been able to do in several years, AND he is once again seeking out people for laptime and attention, AND he is showing more energy and bounce during our daily walksA few people who just saw our dogs for the first time since last summer said they seem friendlier and more energetic. That surprised me. As for Dog #1's barking problem....well....he still goes into a few barking fits each day.....but I'm so happy with all the other improvements,  I do plan to keep using Neutricks for as long as it helps them.UPDATE: 4/20/13 Another surprise:Dog #1 is starting to LOOK younger....his facial hair, which was black and turned gray, is now turning from gray to black!Dog #2 is continuing to increase his activity level.
summary: After 30 days, some unexpected positive results in two old dogs!

reviewText: This is by far the most economical way to purchase Greenies.  And my furry ones love them. My only warning is to watch your fingers when you're offering the treat; you may lose one.

I have been buying this prodcuct for years.  Everyone was getting along fine, so I decided to quit using it and see what would happen.  I foster cats and have had up to 25 or so cats living in my house at one time.  Most of them have been with me for several years now.  The unadoptable ones have added up over the years.  Everyone wants the perfect pet.  No one wants the shy cat, scared cat, 3 legged cat, diabetic cat, cat with stomatitis, cystis, or even a cat that is friendly, but won't lay on your lap.  Thus I have accumulated a houseful of misfits.  After stopping the feliway it only took a few weeks for the bickering to begin.  A couple of my "nervous nellie's" were being terrorized by a couple of my more dominant cats.  No one was hurt, but there was definite picking and terrorizing going on.  I put the feliway back into all the rooms of the house.  Within a week or so after the pheronomes had time to take affect everyone was once again getting along and peace was restored to the house!  Won't discontinue the use again.  I love my cats and I love seeing them all happily interacting with each other!

I was a bit skeptical when I purchased this collar, but for my dogs it has been worth it's weight in gold! I have two problem barkers and as soon as the collar is on them they cease barking. As with any other collar with some weight to it, the dog does realize when it's NOT there. Because of that fact, I do not consider it a training tool. My dogs will bark without it on. It is simply an aide to stop inappropriate barking as needed. I love it! I have no barking through the night anymore! I would however, strongly suggest getting the citronella spray. The odorless had no effect on my dogs.

this is the way to do it.  It took my husband and I (you definitely need two people) about 45 minutes to put together.  It is well made and looks very nice.  FYI it is bright white in color. reviewText: The squeaker came out like other reviewers said, and then it was like splitting a pineapple. He had it cored in 3-4 hours tops...Don't waste your money. Now, if they ever took out the squeaker....it would be a winner.

I have a 17 year old goldfish and he's never been sick at all. I've always only used a top quality water conditioner and he's alone. A few weeks ago I noticed he was not himself...not eating and staying in the corner all the time with little perky swimming. I keep him in a very large, old fashioned bathtub with a big fountain for water // oxygen. I also notice a type of white stuff on him. First it was very pale white then became almost like a white salt look on him. I went into a major panic and bought this product. (along with a few other's from Amazon for treating ich and other diseases).... I moved him into a small tank with this medicine and completely cleaned out his pond and fountain. I added this to his fresh new pond/tub, along with water conditioner called Stress Coat (which I've used for all these years with no problems at all)......I have a soft / large net to gently pick him up to move him and he was so quiet. He's usually a perky one....I got the net here on Amazon also. He's at least 9 inches and looks 'fat' to me so I worried it could be bloating too. I put him back into his fresh tank / tub and waited a day before trying to feed to reduce anymore stress. YAY, he is eating again and swimming. He does enjoy my company though, lol.....I just love him. He's bright orange and I don't see any signs of disease again, yet. I did notice at times now he'll spit out his fish food and go for tiny pieces of flake food on the bottom. That worries me a little bit so I've ordered new food for him too. I was very pleased with this product. Seemed safe and complete. It seems to have saved him and I am so grateful. I wish I knew what he'd enjoy eating so I can keep him happy and healthy. I hope he'll be around for a long time. THANK YOU for this product. I used the Aquarium salt too but I think using this product primarily, did the trick as did cleaning out his tank // tub area completely too. It arrived on time. Amazon has saved my day more than once!! Any suggestions would be welcome to keep my fish glowing  and going. Do I use it during EACH CHANGE? TIA~..............UPDATE:::: 12/18/2013 - Ohh no - My fish has that stuff on him again and he's not acting right. I bought him blood worms and new fish food of pellets (I have always only fed flake food) and he won't eat any of it now. He's not his perky self. He knows when I come in and swims over to me...is breaking my heart. I took pics of him but not sure if anyone can view them that knows goldfish. He seems 'off'....and a tiny // slight tilt. He does not fight me when I reach down to pass my hand over his side to remove those white thingys (like salt)). I don't like touching him as I may injure him more. IS THERE ANYONE TO ASSIST ME IN HERE? He has never been sick 1 single day in his life until we had to move to this horrid place. : (( - Should I attempt to move him outside as I have a big pond thingy out there for him but worry about wild animals then. I also bought Pimafix from Amazon but not sure if I can add it to his water too. It treats fungal infections. I just don't know the answer and don't want to make things more toxic. Thank you.>>>>>>>>>>>>>UPDATE Dec. 28, 2013 - ALL IS GOOD : ))) Ich is gone again and I keep re treating. This is a great product // Thank you and Elvee thanks you. You MUST re treat as this disease has cycles per my Marine Vet.********UPDATE January 9, 2014 - This did NOT cure the Ich - per my mobile fish vet today she told me to buy this from Amazon, which I did::::Mardel Quick-Cure Aquarium Treatment, 4-Ounce..............I did not know they "sedate" a goldfish to examine them.... I could not watch.. my vet is great and I purchased the new Ich medicine above, more oxygen piping, etc. My fish vet sedates my Elvee, in a separate bucket and it is Ich. Also my water was not right so I had to buy a API water test kit here on Amazon. You can never oxygenate too much. She said my Elvee is happy and spoiled tho... : )).......
