Received this today and after reading the precautions on the packaging I WAS SHOCKED! I gave it the benefit of a doubt since a lot of times the warning label on an item goes to the extreme to protect the company selling the item.  I was thinking probably one idiot lost a finger when grabbing the cord and retracting the cord...ANYWAY...I took it out of the box (MISTAKE)then walked my dog halfway down the street.  WHOA, I'm am extremely uncomfortable with this leash.  Not only is it heavy & bulky, when I tried to retract the cord back inside the handle it came in SO DANG FAST that my dog got SMACKED in the side of the head so hard she whimpered.  I'm terrified I might burn my child's legs as she walks along with us or God forbid, have someone lose a finger if they grab onto the cord by mistake.  Yes, this thing is that strong.  The info. on Amazon.com should clearly state the precautions & warnings as the box and THICK detailed instructions do.  Since I've already made the mistake of trying it out I guess I am stuck with this piece of crap and out $20 plus bucks.  I will be buying a belt style leash to replace this dangerous one.

Thin sticker that normally will not work with acrylic tanks but I just slipped mine inside the tank instead. The wheels work great. I just shove the container out of the way for cleaning floors, etc.(2) Both containers have little flip-lock openers. Very handy!(3) The small container fits great on top of the large container, or I just toss the small one on the utility room cabinet because it's handier for me there.I've used these for several years now and I'm very happy with them.

Tug-O-War balls . Simply a sensational, well made dog toy. Highest recommendation.5 Paws Up!

reviewText: My Shetland Sheepdog, Baird, has some dirty teeth. He's also... weird... for a dog. He doesn't chew on ANYTHING really. I mean, as a puppy he chewed the wall once, but we sprayed that with some of that nasty tasting spray stuff and since then, no problem.He used to love to chew on cow hooves, but for some reason he just seems to enjoy licking them now (maybe he likes the pasture flavorings). He doesn't chew any of his chew toys.So how do you clean a dog's teeth if they don't chew on anything? The answer is brushing (which is always good regardless of whether your dog chews or not!) and not much else.While at the vet I saw the CET Enzymatic HEXTRA Premium chews. $30 a bag for 30 chews. It seemed excessive, but to keep from having to put Baird through the scary procedure of a full teeth cleaning, it seems a small price to pay. My fear was he wouldn't chew on them. Turns out... he LOVES them!The thing is, the $30 price tag really got me, so I decided to try to find something a little cheaper, when I happened upon Amazon and found the "one step down from top of the line" Virbac (makers of the CET chews), "C.E.T. Enzymatic Oral Hygiene Chews for Large Dogs, 30 Chews." It's not completely clear what the exact differences between these and the HEXTRA Premiums, but the chews do smell different (I think this has to do with the chicken flavoring on these which the Premiums don't have).And it turns out Baird loves these as well.One thing to remember is that if your dog has yellowed teeth, simple chews won't fix that. All you can do is get those teeth deep cleaned... however, this is just generally surface staining, so brushing and providing chews like these will actually clear the plaque. And the plaque is the part you are worried about, given that's what can cause health problems with your dogs.Over all, I'm happy that Baird's happy with these chews. If you can't brush your dog's teeth all the time, these make an OK alternative to brushing.C.E.T. HEXtra Premium Oral Hygiene Chews with Chlorhexidine, Large Dogs, 30 Chewsare available as well, they are just a few dollars more. Next time I order I will most likely go with the Premiums out of nothing more than personal preference.

It has been almost a year since I have purchased this brand. My cats love something one day, and turn up their noses at it the next, as all of you "cat parents" know all too well.  I now have several brands and varieties for the little darlings. My job is to guess which one they want today! The "Mature Adult" line of Hills is better for my cats with renal disease because it has less phosphorus. Too much phosphorus and they feel ill and don't want to eat at all. I also mix this with some aluminum hydroxide phosphorus binder as well. All of my cats (5) are older and they all love this tender tuna chunks flavor. Hills has a nice variety of mature adult flavors. Since I have never personally tried this food, I must rely on my cats who gobble it up, to say that it must be flavor full. !!!
summary: Good, and lower in phosphorus than other varieties

reviewText: I've had these Lixit waterers for years, used by all different dogs and all I can say is, they work. No more droodles in that nasty pan of re-used water. Just make sure your faucet is in the shade, otherwise the nipple can get hot in the sun and your pet may relate a bad experience with drinking. Took one day for my Lab to "get it".

Pro's:1. 24 hour per day available water for your pet.*  Excellent in hot climates.2. Clean / sanitary water source at all times.  Definitely better than a bowl or bucket that often must be cleaned with anti-bacterial, anti-mold, anti-fungus cleaners.3. Easy for the dog to learn how to use.4. Eliminates your dog from 'playing' in its water which makes a mess and causes the dog to go without water for long periods until you get home/discover his full bowl is empty.5. No installation procedures to follow.  Just screw it on to your faucet as it has the same threads as your water hose.  Turn on your faucet and you are set.**Con's:1. *24 hours per day is contingent on the lixit not freezing or breaking.  You should check it daily as you would a bowl of water.  Common sense!  You should never NOT worry about your pet every day!  Besides, it takes just a second.  Press the trigger to see that water is flowing when testing.  The lixit can loosen over time and leak since it is suppose to be put on 'hand tight'.  I use pliers and tweak it just a fraction past hand tight and it holds for long periods of time.  Like water hoses, sometimes the rubber washer needs to be replaced.2.  It is an 'outdoor application only' for use on your outdoor faucet. **NOTE: I recommend you NOT share a hose with it and DEDICATE the faucet to the dog waterer ONLY, as it would be easy to forget and turn off the knob after watering your lawn thus depriving your dog of water!  In fact, I recommend you turn on the lixit then take the knob off of your faucet so no one will accidentally turn it off.  If you are handy, you could tap into your water line and construct a dedicated water line just for your pet!3. Freezing is a common problem.  I've never had a frozen lixit ruin my faucet.  What happens it that the lixit is made from a metal that is a bit softer than a faucet so the freezing water causes the lixit to expand around the threads.  It has never ruined my faucet and lixits are fairly inexpensive so I keep an extra on hand.  If you live in northern climates, you'll have to put the lixit on a faucet that is located in an area that does not freeze.  It's worthless in freezing weather.  If you have outdoor dogs in cold climates, better to go with a heated bowl / kennel.4. They do wear out eventually.  Usually the trigger gets stuck to one side and it dribbles water.  I've had lixits last 2 or more years.5. Direct sun does warm up the chrome colored metal lixit but with just a few seconds of water it cools right off and does not deter the dog from drinking.

Small dogs bark! One neighbor has 5 non-stop barkers. The other neighbor sleeps early and does not like barking. They were very polite about it. My 2 dogs happen to be on the non-barker neighbor's side of the house.This works well. I have a Bichon and a Poodle mix. My sister has a Beagle. This collar fits them all. However, they each have their own and their own settings. I have never had to use the stimuli past 3. It does go higher than that if you have a very stubborn barker. I can now leave it on just the pulse and they stay quiet.I noticed some said their dogs learned to "growl" quietly. Yes, mine have done that when they play. there's two of them that's how they communicate in their playtime. Anyway, My Bichon did discover that he could bark again quickly before the collar registered his 2nd or 3rd bark. But since he is the very stubborn one he also wears the Dogtra training collar for small dogs. So, I controlled the the 2nd bark and after a few times he hasn't tried it again.I do not have them wear it every day. They don't need to. They have learned, however, like all of us we have relapses and need a reminder once in awhile.I do find it amusing that they have associated the collar with the need to NOT bark. At least for a short time. Once I get them moving or playing or walking or whatever they quickly forget they're wearing it and it's business as usual, even though they might get a slight reminder.I have had dogs all my life, most of them large dogs who didn't bark, and never had a need, desire or neighbor that required me to consider using a bark collar. Truth be told I had two initial thoughts. 1. they didn't work or 2. how horrible.Well, 1. THIS WORKS 2. It's better than the pound coming to debark your dog!
summary: For little yippers and not so little ones too!

reviewText: Best stuff on the market, hands down. Our black lab mix got/gets chronic yeast infections and symptoms from allergies. We have spent numerous amounts of money on vet prescribed ear medications and washes, with nothing but temporary relief. Found this stuff and it's been the best investment! Within 2 days our lab wasn't pawing and shaking his ears, the smell and redness were gone and he was much more at ease and not distressed. And this hasn't been a temporary effect, it's actually long term! No more going to the vet and buying pricey meds that don't work. My dog thanks me too, because now he doesn't have to endure a stressful office visit!

After watching my daughter's young dog entertaining herself by throwing her kong toy around, I was intrigued enough to order one for my young puppy.  There was a suggestion on the packaging to try freezing it with some peanut butter placed in the hollow center cavity, which I did.  My puppy sniffed the peanut butter-filled toy, and was completely uninterested.  I then had the brainstorm, that if I could freeze peanut butter inside it, I could freeze anything inside it, and promptly put some canned puppy food into the toy, and froze it.  I gave it to my pup the next morning.  He sniffed the frozen food that was flush against the bottom, and he happily went to town, working it for a couple of hours until he got all the food out of it.  Anything that will keep this chewer busy for a couple of hours was well worth the price.The only reason I gave it 4 stars not 5 is that without something frozen inside of it, my puppy has no interest in it whatsoever.
summary: Frozen With Puppy Food Did the Trick!

reviewText: I keep accidentally referring to this as the Omega Magic Box instead of Omega Paw whenever I recommend this system to friends and family. I absolutely love it!I'm one of those classic individuals who hates to clean, especially when it comes to the cat box--yet I'm also a warped version of a germaphobe. I can't tell you how many times I've blown it off, sometimes for days, just to avoid the mess, or how many times I've had fouled up litter spill all over me. Eww! In fact, I always feel like I have to wait to shower until after I clean it, which sometimes will wait all day and I've cleaned the entire rest of the house in order to avoid the task. Enough said!This litter box is amazing and I'm actually "sifting" it several times a day, which even my partner is amazed by--it's that easy. Better yet, I don't feel like I need to be quarantined after emptying it, which is a definite plus, and hardly any litter is kicked out by my over-eager diggers (we're talking hardly anything), thanks to the height of the actual tray--meaning, I'm not walking on much litter when I come out of the shower, though I do plan on buying a litter mat soon and turning the box away from my walking path. I use Fresh Step and Scoop Away, which both seem to work fine in this box, though I normally get Fresh Step for Multiple cats.Thanks to the reviews on here, I got it in the large to accommodate my cats, especially one who is a hefty 18lbs, but mostly due to him being the size of our dogs. The size is a bit of a burden, especially if you don't have a lot of space in your room, and it is tall, but two feet will suffice--though four feet may be needed to efficiently roll it. I also had trouble with litter spilling out during my rollfest, but then realized the grate (possibly kicked out by my cat in the beginning) and clips weren't in correctly, and this resolved the problem without any other incidents. I do get some used litter sticking to the tray, which is nothing new, but smacking the bottom mid-roll helps this (or using a hand sifter to scrape the bottom quickly before rolling will help if it's really bad). I may also try the suggestion of using Pam spray on the bottom the next time I change litter, but still debating and will update if I do.In order to add to my lazy and time-saving endeavors, I also got the Litter Locker, which is used to store waste in as you empty the box until I can be bothered to run to the dumpster. A simple turn of the device traps odors in a waste bag until you're ready to toss it out (like a Diaper Genie). It also comes with a sifter that fits into a pocket on the contraption. This is great for when I'm pressed for time and also eliminates steps during moments of utter laziness, and the tray with this litter box actually works perfectly with it. Lastly, for odor control (for before cleaning and due to a dog practically living in my room), I also love and use the Febreze Odor Eliminators, which are carbon air filters to get rid of room/pet odors. Can't smell a thing and cleaning is even easier, taking less than 30 seconds (even with me having to turn the box to roll it), and this box definitely is the icing on the cake.

reviewText: EDIT:quite suddenly, Sam developed problems getting up the stairs tonight, after being somewhat (unusually) needy today.I'll leave the review intact, as it Seemed a good replacement for glucosamine, and we still give him his 'ZiwiTreats' that he absolutely loves, but my hopes for an easy replacement of the glucosamine failed in just over a month. ZiwiPeak never intimated that these were a glucosamine product, fault is strictly mine. GREAT TREAT and food!!!end editMuch as I might love to feed this full-time to my 11yr Golden, $15/lb is a Bit beyond our budget (Newman's senior for us)I had been very happy with the greenies senior treat with fish lips, and it seemed to have a positive effect for Sam's poor ol' hips, making it easier for him to get up. Greenies stopped production of their senior treats for reasons that I have not been able to find, so after research on green-lipped mussel (glucosamine  & Chondroitin), I accidentally hit upon this food.Granted, it does not specifically say so, but the air dried fish that is included seems to provide the same oils for relief for his hips, so I am sold by that experience. I throw a scoop a day out on the kitchen floor and he happily tracks all the 1/2 inch square pieces down, they are slightly moist and seem to have a great smell as he never misses one, then drinks a gallon of water after (well, a lot, anyway). Reminds me of fresh jerkey.Not sure how many 'scoops' (included) a kilogram is, but it seems to be lasting nicely, definitely less than a buck a day for a treat he goes crazy for - less than the greenie seniors.The attempt at providing a 'zip-lock' closure system for the back failed gloriously, their team needs some work there, but the bag was delivered fast and fresh, as we've come to expect from Amazon direct (Not alternate seller).
summary: Great as Senior treat with the fish oils

My dogs (2 Dachshunds, a Chihuahua and a French Bulldog) love these Cardinal Laboratories Pet Botanics Training Rewards, chicken flavor and their size (1/4 of an inch in diameter and 3/8 of an inch tall; a tad bit smaller around than a dime - see customer image I uploaded) in conjunction with their consistency (neither too moist, nor crumbly) makes them ideal for keeping in your pockets so that they are readily accessible when training your dog. And with over 550 treats per bag, they go a long way.They are MADE IN THE USA, have only 3 calories per treat, and contain neither soy, corn, nor BHA, BHT, or ethoxyquin (artificial preservatives).The primary ingredient is Pork Liver (chicken is 5th on the list - see below). Pork Liver is a nutrient-rich organ which provides your dog with protein, fat and vitamin A. It is also a good source of copper, iron, niacin, phosphorus and zinc. It provides many B vitamins, omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids, and essential amino acids. Liver is of great benefit to your dog's health when offered in moderation (too much can lead to a condition called hypervitaminosis A, or an overdose of vitamin A). These little treats are a great way to add the benefits of liver to your dog's diet.They are also great for crate training, too. Just give them to your dog through the crate door as soon as you put them in and eventually they will associate something good with being crated. Soon enough you can just toss 2 or 3 in the crate when you need to crate them and they will happily go right in. My dogs have their own room that their crates are in. When I open the door to their room they run and get in the crates sometimes quicker than I can put their training rewards in.INGREDIENTS: Pork Liver, Barley Flour, Whole Ground Potatoes, Sucrose, Chicken, Potato Starch, Glycerine, Wheat Bran, Gelatin, Rice Flour, Flax Seed, Salt, Natural Smoke Flavor, Garlic Powder, Phosphoric Acid, Potassium Sorbate, Mustard, Citric Acid, Mixed Tocopherols, Rosemary
summary: PRODUCT INGREDIENTS; Excellent training reward my dogs love...

I got rid of the litter maid that my cat hated and pretty much attacked every time it came on.  This product works a lot better.  Sometimes automation IS NOT the better way to go. I just roll this over every morning and the litter dumps into the trough, I dispose and kitty is happy.

I wanted to like this product.  I really did.  We had been using a clumping litter which was working out pretty well, except for the litter being tracked around our apartment.  This was annoying. To make things worse, our cat is a digger, so every visit to the litter box meant he emerged covered in a layer of dust.  We decided to look for some litter alternatives and decided on the Tidy Cats Breeze system.The benefits include: not having to scoop out urine clumps daily, no tracking, no dust.The downsides include: if your cat is a digger, you are going to have pellets scattered around your floor, and since you don't change the pellets frequently, there are going to be pellets stained with feces and urine on your floor.  Also, there is VERY poor odor control.  We have set up air purifiers around the apartment, but they can't fight the odor from cat feces.  Since the feces can't be buried as they would be with clay litters, they remain exposed, filling your bathroom (and the rest of your apartment) with the noxious smell of poo, until you clean them up.  And let's face it, you're not going to always be around when your cat does #2, even despite your best intentions.It's back to clumping litter we go.  I'll take tracking over a gag-inducing smell any day.

As the title says, it can grow plants, don't try "high light" plants with this its not strong enough for that.Don't want to risk the "dark spots"? Bump up a light size and adapt legs as needed.  A 24-36 model only has LEDs over a 17 inch space, the rest is the casing and legs (that can be extended).  If I had bought 2 of the 18-24 inch one it would leave dark areas in my 55 gallon.Cord on the lights is nice and long so I have plenty of slack to get it across to the other side of the tank.I have 2  24-36 inch ones over my 55 gallon Tetra tank, the space fro the lights (lip at the top) is 23 inches... so close... To make these fit the legs facing the center of the tank were removed, and a small plastic black block used to prop the lights up so they are not directly on the tank's divider/brace.  They fit snugly against each other and will not move unless pulled apart. They are very low profile/slim and don't detract from the tank like some bulkier fixtures can.I've had these since the end of September or beginning of October 2013.  While the tank they are over was being cycled I housed several types of low light plants including: anacharis, hornwort, anubias nana, java fern, and marimo balls.  All had noticeable healthy growth while under this light.  Since my pleco has moved in and likes to eat plants I only have the anacharis left as its fast growing and good for absorbing nitrates.  Even with the fish occasionally eating it/breaking it, the plant still grows fast under this light.  I have not tried medium light plants with this light so I cannot offer any hint to if they would or would not thrive.I have the tank on a 7.5 hour light cycle and have not had any real issue with algae yet (but I do have an algae eater in there too).  I use a light timer so I don't have to remember to turn them on and off.  I've never used the blue "night" lights only the day-time ones so no comments for the blue lights.I will also note my Madagascar rainbow fish looks very good under this light, the yellow/orange colors of its scales/fins show much better under these LEDs than the florescent bulbs of their old tank.  My other fish (pleco) likes to hide under his driftwood during the day to stay out of the lights, but the Marinelands make the tank bright enough you can see great detail in his hide (not a scaled fish) compared to florescent bulbs.
summary: Adequet for low light plants in taller tanks.

reviewText: My kitty LOVES this video.  I pull the ottoman up close to the tv and she'll sit there for hours - most of the time watching, sometime just sitting and listening to the outside noises.  When I go away I plan on putting the tv on a timer so she can watch it for a while during the day.  I would recommend not buying this unless you have a glass tv screen - my kitty paws at the tv constantly.  You don't want to come home to find holes in your LCD!
Its a bit smaller than I was hoping for, but it works! My own fault for not figuring out exactly how big its listed as being.

I may be one of the few people who bought this not for the claim of a less smelly litter but because of allergies. I was told by my allergist that I needed to either wear a mask when I scooped the litter or have my husband scoop it for me (which isn't gonna happen). I was never a huge fan of the clay litter with all of the dust that it kicks up and I had started using the new pine/walnut clumping litter but it sort of smelled like a dirty gerbil cage after a week or two. Plus there was litter everywhere. No matter the litter I tried, I found myself scooping away for at least 3 minutes (thanks to my yoga posing kitty who always manages to pee right along the litter pan wall).I'm a fan of this litter box because all I have to do is scoop the poop out and once a week replace the pee pad underneath. I have 3 cats (1 with kidney disease and another on steroids) so the two of them urinate a lot, and I still only have to change the pad once a week. Switching from normal litter to this box has saved me from fits of insane sneezing every night.However, if you are looking to eliminate litter box odor.... it doesn't. Poop is poop, and if it smells it smells. It's like one of those riddles, if you poop on the floor instead of in the toilet, does the poop still stink? ... yes! When they poop in the litter box, it smells like my kitty just took a deuce, regardless of the fancy litter. And when I pull out the pee pad to rotate it, it smells like a pissy diaper. But I didn't get it to eliminate smell, I got it to eliminate the dust from the litter and the clean up time due to allergies and that is exactly what it has done for me. So for what I bought it for, I give it two thumbs up. My only complaint, the litter/pad price and the fact that I cannot find them locally, so therefor I must order them online. Otherwise, love it!*On a side note. I know people who have this box and have converted it to a normal litter box by using those pine pellet litters instead of the fancy stuff this is supposed to use. It helps cut down on cost and if you bought this litter box and your cat doesn't like it, I'd give the pine litter a try and see if they just didn't like the pellets.

These tiny treats are great because I can give the dog a lot of them without filling him up on junk treats.  He thinks a tiny treat is just as good as a big one.  And, buying six saved me $10 over the retail store price locally.
I don't know what I would do without this toy. My cats are Bengals so are extremely active and require a lot of stimulation. I change the toys every few days to keep their interest.

I like this products, they are lightweight and I was told by the Green Store near us that you could actually give these to farmers to use in their compost.  Thought we have not yet done that, we have used TONS of these bags.  We originally started off with recycling the plastic bags that stores give you- and although I would stick as much poop as I could in there, I still felt bad about what they were doing to the environment.  I have also on numerous occasions had a bag break on me.  However, since we switched to these bags, I have not yet had one issue- regardless of a dog stepping on them while playing, getting pulled extremely tight in a leash, etc.  They are so tiny, you can easily fit 5 or 6 in your pocket without having all the bulk that you would with plastic bags.  The best part is, that it easily accommodates all the deposits that each of my dogs make-whether it be my 5 month old puppy, my 60 pound husky, or my 80 pound aussie/chow mix.
summary: Poop Detail Made Easier for a Woman with Three Dogs

Received this product on time and in good condition - however when I set the temp to approx. 80F (I like my tank a little on the warm side for coral growth) using the instructed acclimation guidelines I came back a few hours later and noticed something was very wrong in my tank - all my snails were at the top of the water line - and sure enough checked tank temp 86.4F and the heater was still on so who knows how hot it would have gotten. Played with it since and it seems to be holding a steady tank temp of 80.5F - 81F but the temp setting on the front indicator says 74F so a 6-7 degree difference between set temp and actual temp. Debating whether to return this or not - it might be a 'lemon' since everyone else seems pretty satisfied with theirs - in any case I figured it was worth a warning if it saves you from cooking your tank critters. The other thing I've noticed in the two weeks I've had this product is that algae growth on it is incredible - I leached it in RODI saltwater with a powerhead for 72 hours before putting in my tank and still I've had to clean it every other day from algae growth - on the fence whether I'm gonna keep it or not.Updated 11/19/13 - Finally exchanged original heater when temp started fluctuating wildly received new heater yesterday and so far so good - temp setting is close to indicated and seems to be holding setting - should have returned the first one immediately. So product updated to 3 stars (would be 4 stars if original had worked) with a warning to immediately return yours if temp is way off.
summary: Be Careful - temp WAY off!!! Updated 11/19/13

This worked great on one of my cats - in fact, worked faster than the prescription the vet gave us. And in the past it worked great for our dog as well.Prescribed antibiotics took until day 6 or 7 to kick in (on a 10 day cycle) and by contrast, the Vibactra kicked in on day 2. And it saved me $100 in vet fees.I always prefer natural remedies, whether its for myself, my children, or my pets. They have fewer side effects (often none at all), and are more gentle on the body. Plus, if you read the literature (Journal of American Academy of Pediatrics, Journal of American Medical Association), studies show these ingredients are often more powerful than prescription antibiotics.I must giggle when people say you can't have a "natural" antibiotic. The very first Penicillin (discovered by Alexander Fleming) was straight-up mold! Can't get more natural than that. No chemicals, nothing artificial, etc.The only drawback is, you have to give 4 doses per day. But even when I missed a dose or two, it still seemed to work faster than the prescription stuff.My other recommendations: If you have a pet who gets frequent infections, has topical infections, etc, try these two things:(1) Colloidal Silver (2 sprays orally, daily of 150ppm for a small animal). This is also proven just as effective as prescription antibiotics, and there is no drug interaction when used with Vibactra. Can also be used topically, but not on open wounds.Also (2) Grapefruitseed Extract is a powerful antibiotic & immune booster - just add 1 or 2 drops to food or water (do not feed directly).Hope this helps!
summary: Powerful antibiotic - only 1 drawback (plus some other tips here)

reviewText: The Havahart Ultrasonic Basic is dog training device that uses an ultrasonic frequency to provide a negative stimulus to dogs, in an attempt to correct unwanted behavior. It is a remote-shaped device with an auto feature for barking, as well as a manual button that can be activated when your dog acts up.DESIGNThe first thing I noticed about it, is the ridiculous amount of excess packaging.  The box is the size of a shoe box, while the remote is maybe the size of a small baked potato, and the only thing else it comes with is a 2 page manual. You could fit 4 of the devices in one box, and most of it is empty space, likely in an effort to consume more shelf space in stores and attract more attention.  The actual device has a bit of an awkward design.  It is shaped like a tube of moisturizing cream, with a somewhat slim base that gets wider, ending with a circular speaker. It's easy enough to use at home, but it doesn't fit in a pocket very well, and there's no belt clip, making it awkward to take on a walk.  There is a power button on the side of the device.  You press it once to turn it to auto, again to turn it to manual, and again to turn it back off.  Seems easy enough, but it doesn't register your presses very well.  I was constantly pressing the button, and then staring at it to wait for the light that indicates what setting it is on to flash (it comes on after about five seconds), and then trying to cycle back to the right setting when I realized it wasn't on the one I wanted.  If your dog starts barking, you can't easily pick this up and use it quickly.HOW IT WORKSYou initially train the device by waiting until your dog is tired or resting, then cycle through one of the five frequencies until you pick one your dog responds to. I have a young dog so he picked up on the first one right away. The next step is to wait until your dog initiates bad behavior, then do a manual correction by pressing the button. This will emit the saved frequency. The idea is that the frequency is annoying or unpleasant to your dog. When your dog barks or jumps, you hit the manual button which will send out the frequency.  The dog then associates the unpleasant frequency with the behavior they have just committed, and will learn to stop the behavior.  This is the exact same training method as saying "NO," hitting your dog on the nose, or using a shock collar, and is commonly referred to as negative reinforcement behavior.  An ultrasonic noise is designed to be more humane than some of these.  The auto feature on the device works only for barking, and will emit the frequency automatically whenever your dog barks.USEFinding the correct frequency for my dog took about fifteen minutes.  The first problem is that you have to get the training device fairly close to your dog, and once he knew I was using it, he was very interested in it, so it was difficult to determine when he was registering a frequency. Additionally, he picked up on more than one frequency.  I was finally satisfied I had the one he responded best to, however he was far from annoyed by it.  He definitely heard it, but only registered mild curiosity with it, and I had to have the device about a foot away from his ear for him to do that.  The problem with that is, even if he was annoyed by the sound, the action of trying to hold the device close enough to his ear is going to distract him from the negative behavior anyway, so this won't work.  Since my dog is right at the required 6 months, and since the device advertises that it only works on 66% of dogs, I went off to find more test subjects.I went to my dog trainer's class and tried it out on the dogs in the group as well as several friends' dogs. My trainer took one look at the device and told me it was never going to work, but I tried it out anyway.  Out of fourteen dogs, only two appeared to be genuinely affected with the sound, and even those two did not seem to exhibit annoyance with it, but rather curiosity.  If the sound isn't unpleasant to them, it's not going to be effective for me.  After two days, the only one annoyed was me at having to spend so much time programming the device to find the right frequency for each dog.I will say that the auto method did seem to pick up on the barking very well, and it worked to silence the barking, but not because the dogs were annoyed, but because they were distracted.  One dog even appeared to bark more. I will continue to use it on more dogs and see if possibly my sample size was just too small (although that would be a big coincidence), and update this review if I find it to be any more effective.CONCLUSIONI have studied both positive and negative reinforcement.  I am a fan of the former, but find the latter to be more effective in most dogs. With Havahart advertising that the product only works on 2/3 dogs, you are taking a gamble on whether you will have any luck with it on your own dog.  Even if it does register with the dog, I find that it's not enough of a negative reinforcement to eliminate the bad behavior. For training to work, you have to have a strong enough deterrent to eliminate the behavior, and it must be consistent.  The Havahart lacks both.  Unless you are trying to correct a behavior that you can predict 100% of the time, it won't work because you can't activate it fast enough.  If your dog has a problem with jumping and you don't have the Havahart on and ready to go at every jump, he will learn that he can get away with jumping some of the time.  I would advise anyone considering any type of ultrasonic training aid, to borrow one or find out if it works first before committing to it.  If you can afford to spend a little more, I would recommend going with a bark collar or shock collar instead. Although some may think these are inhumane, I have used them on myself, and as long as you learn the appropriate way to train with them, and get one that has a highly adjustable level (like aDogtra IQ - Yard Training Collar), they will not hurt your dog at all and can be much more humane in the long run when your dog quickly sheds the negative behavior.
summary: 12 out of 14 dogs agree - this thing doesn't work

reviewText: I used to work in a grooming salon, and this brush works well on short coated dogs - Danes, Bulldogs, and others with similar coat. Also, it is a pain that the hair doesn't collect in the brush and instead falls to the floor, BUT I would rather get it out in one sitting then deal with my dog shedding over everything!

reviewText: What you probably need to know, if you're wondering whether to buy this cat food:1.  The first ingredient is meat.  Not turkey meat, chicken meat, THEN turkey meat.  You don't get to the mystery meat by products until the third ingredient.2.  There's none of the chinese wheat gluten listed in the ingredients at all.3.  This food is probably okay for kitties who have special needs involving their kidneys or digestive tracts.I review a lot of cat food, mostly because I have a feral cat (Mary-Kate) with CRF who is very finicky and has to be limited to foods that don't make her sick.  The food has to be extra tasty, and it can't have too much protein or phosphorus, and cheap ingredients will make her really sick.I split this between her and her son, who has kitty IBD.  He is not a picky eater, but some foods disagree with him in a different way.Both kitties enjoyed the Sheba with no ill effects.  Sometimes, it takes more than one can for problems to make themselves known, but I would definitely feed this again.  The only ingredient it has listed that gives me pause is starch, probably for the gravy.  Cats don't need it, but if you're trying to feed a finicky sick kitty, sometimes you have to feed them what tastes good.For reference, my cats will eat Fancy Feast.  They won't eat cat gravy or any of their prescription diets or Felidae or the delicious-looking Tiki flavors.  They like Friskies, but it makes Mary-Kate sick.  I'd put the Sheba up with the Fancy Feast - not the worst thing they could eat, although not the best, and nice and yummy.
summary: Good ingredients.  My cats ate it.

reviewText: Our kitten prefers to sleep in an Amazon.com shipping box with some blankets than in this pet bed. so for now it's money wasted. I home it works when he grows up though
summary: Looks nice but our kitten doe snot like it much to sleep in

reviewText: I love this food and would encourage all to try it. It's of high quality, looks and smells delicious, and my dogs love it. I love Amazon too, but they really aren't handling the shipping of this product properly, so buying it from them became nothing but aggrevation and waste. BEWARE: DENTED CANS ARE NOT SOMETHING TO CHANCE. There was no packing material for any of my 3 cases, and approximately 25% of my cans were dented, putting their contents at risk for contamination. I did not see any options to return these cases whole or be compensated in any way, so I was forced to work around my problem as best possible. I refrigerated the 12+ dented cans I first spotted at arrival and used them asap. The other cans looked fine upon inspection, so I stored them in a safe place and thought all would be okay from there on in. Unfortunately, weeks after the initial order, I noticed that other cans were showing signs of damage too i.e. sunken or slightly distorted tops that were not dented upon my first inspection.  I know that nothing damaged these cans in the interim, so I believe their seals must have been compromised when the others were initially dented, and with time the vacuum must have been compromised which resulted in the cave ins.  I was not going to take a chance and give contaminated food to my dogs, so I ended up throwing out 5 cans (there goes my savings). Thereafter, I also felt nervous to give my dogs food from the other cans that remained. This whole purchase was very stressful and wasteful and therefore I cannot recommend taking a chance to buy this great food from this site again, unless the issue of proper packaging is remedied.  Also, reveiwing others comments, I have noticed I was not alone in this experience.  If cans aren't packaged with some insulation, there is probably a good chance they will get dented. Maybe the shipper dents the cans, but the packager i.e. Amazong should protect them so they are not so vulnerable and we get the product we wanted and paid for.
summary: WARNING - Great product, but DAMAGED CANS

reviewText: We have 3 dogs and before purchasing the fountain we were having to refill their water dispenser daily.  With this fountain we don't have to refill for 2-3 days.  The price was excellent compared to the almost $70 charged at local PetSmart.  It took a bit to get used to the sound, but it's no louder than our fish tank's filter. Even our cat is using it and not bugging us to turn the water faucet on for him any longer!

We should have invested in this when our cats were little, this thing works fantastically! We had issues with them jumping up on the countertops and kitchen table at night after we would go to bed. This worked in a matter of a few times, we no longer have the problem but still use it just in case. HIGHLY RECOMMEND if you have issues with your cat(s) getting into areas you don't want them.

The water is drawn into a pump through a filter at the bottom of the unit and bubbles up through an opening at the top.  Then it flows down a channel and finally spills back into the bottom basin.  It is powered by a low voltage transformer so safety is not a concern.  The build quality is quite good.  You can adjust the force of the pump but for my guys, the next to lowest setting is fine.  The filter works well and my cats seem to really enjoy drinking from this.  It is easy to take apart to clean and to reassemble.  The cleaning process is also quick and easy and the fiilters are inexpensive and have a good lifespan.  The fountain does make a bit of noise but to me it is pleasant, the sound of a babbling brook, softly muted.

Certainly the quality of this dog food is very good.The Wellness Lamb and Sweet Potato is by far their favorite canned food.  It has protein content of 37% and a fat level of 23% (which is a little higher fat level than I would like but...).  I use an independant dog food advisory site when considering any dog food I buy and the Wellness canned dog food was rated a 4.5 (out of 5) stars and was highly recommended.I feed my dogs dry food (consistently the same), but for their evening meal I split a can for my 2 large dogs.The bottom line for me is it is a very good quality dog food and my dogs love it.

What can I say? It is a bio-degradable plastic bag for picking up what you pet leaves behind. I suppose my dogs waste would be preserved longer in the landfill if I used those plastic bags you get at the supermarket, but If I wanted it to keep, I would probably have a collection at home. Do not buy more of these than you can use in a month or two. They will also bio-degrade in your cabinet, waiting to be used.

Reasonable price and quite sturdy.  It held up under the assault of 5 kittens and their mother.  The "mouse" NEVER detached from the unit.  I suspect that those who griped about the mouse coming off hadn't seated it properly on the arm that moves it back and forth.  Some people complained about noise, but that's the normal sound when one or more kittens have it "trapped".  Once the kitten moves, the mouse resumes its motion and the noise stops.  The noise is the result of the mechanism slipping under stress, sounds like a ratchet releasing, and never resulted in any apparent damage.  It has held up for months under attack, for hours a day.  A nice product.  Your major expense will be batteries, especially once your cats learn how to turn it on.

reviewText: I have a big GSD that up until we tried Nutrience I would have thought would eagerly eat the rotted corpse of a porcupine if given the option. I've tried and reviewed plenty of dog foods so I figured this one would probably impress her. Alas, for the first time ever she gave me a look of "I'm supposed to eat this?" as soon as I started mixing it in with her current food. After a while she's decided to eat it but instead of vigorously chowing down she will leave it sit half the day before eating. Obviously, my girl is not impressed.Though I noticed no improvements in her coat or other physical traits I do think we'd need several months on this diet to see any major changes. The one change I did notice was a more frequent and (to put this lightly) more mass in her BMs. I'm going to assume  that the peas and corn in this formula probably have something to do with the increased "output".Though I think I'd need her to eat this for a minimum of 6 months to be sure it's worth switching her disinterest in it makes it not worth it to me.

I am writing a new review, and am going to keep it simple to avoid another person missing my point and leaving annoying comments. The brand name "SafeStart" will certainly initially lead some people to think that this product is all that is needed to start up a tank. The directions state "add entire bottle to aquariums up to 40 gallons. The Aquarium is ready for fish".  Silly me, but after reading that, I thought that after adding the product, I would not see all but one of my fish dying within one hour.  A few paragraphs down it addresses tank preparation with a whopping 6 words.  One might think that this should have appeared above the line "The Aquarium is ready for fish", not buried in fine print 2 paragraphs below in print so small one can hardly read it.  Does it not make sense that preparation instructions should precede, not follow a few paragraphs later?  Even so, I was not sure what those 6 words meant, it seemed to me to be just an advertisement for one of their superfluous products.  Never does it mention toxic chemicals, whether this product removes them or not.  Just call me silly, but perhaps, if space was an issue, rather than using 9 words to address keeping your aquarium at a suitable temperature, they might have more sensibly used those to explicitly state "this product does not remove toxic chemicals" and had two words to spare. All of these elements make is likely that a number of people will misunderstand what the product does, and does not do.  I am not the only person that was left confused by this, whether it removes toxic chemicals, another recent review states something similar.  I am certain that an unacceptable number of people such as the less experienced, or children, will misconstrue the purpose of this product, and end up with dead fish as I did.  I consider directions such as this negligent, a little thought should be given to where the purchaser might be confused.  The person that commented on my earlier review made me think of professors I had in in school who had horrible communication skills, but felt that they put it on the board, if you missed it, or misunderstood it, it was your fault, they had done their job.  But with pets one is always faced with this risk, as you really can't sue them over pets, and they know it.  With people, corporations are a heck of a lot more careful about what a judge might find to be poorly expressed directions that resulted in a tragedy.Regarding the usefulness of this product for what it does, the only time I have ended up with dead fish starting a tank is when I used this product, thinking that it neutralized the chlorine, the one big thing that you have to really worry about.  A lot of people consider other than clearly essential additives, items such as this are just gimmicks, and I concur with that.  I would not use it again, I only got it because I thought that it did what the brand name said "SafeStart" and that the words "The aquarium is then ready for fish" meant that my fish would not die if I treated the water with this product.

We cater to the needs of four toy poodles, and you would think they were Irish Wolfhounds by the way they always want more food and "wolf" down everything placed in front of them. If given their choice, they'd probably eat until they were nothing but round lumps with four legs sticking straight out to the side.Therefore it really isn't much of a tell when they gobble something up more quickly than you can possibly see them chew it and make it disappear. These treats vanished in the same vein .... gobble, gobble, gone.Toothwise, I don't see much different between this product and any of a number of chewable strip treats on the market. So if that is what you're looking for, compare prices and let that determine your final selection.Nutrutionwise, the promo copy claims that they have a calcium supplement in the product that is good for dogs. I can't say that really draws me as an exclusive benefit of this product. The dog food we use is nutritionally balanced for our pets all on its own, and I doubt that giving them these treats is going to make a lot of difference. They are already quite healthy. Still, the dogs liked this treat, and at about 10 cents a strip, it isn't going to break you.

reviewText: This is the perfect size for my 4.3 pound chihuahua and she likes it. I read the other reviews stating that it was too small. For an average-sized dog, I can see that being a problem. This is great for a lap dog. It is made well for what it is. I don't recommend trying to use it to carry your dog outside of the vehicle. The seams are well formed, the sheepskin lining does not cover the full interior. It covers the lip and sides of the unit but not the bottom. I put a blanket in the bottom and it still had plenty of depth to hold my wee beast.Installation was super easy and simple. No brain surgery here! All in all. This is a good seat for the price you are paying. My dog did enjoy it and it helps me to feel safe driving with her as the clip in the back attaches to her harness and keeps her "buckled in" securely.I will say that I really like this and that it serves its purpose. It is inexpensive and I recommend it to the thrifty shopper.
Our dogs love the squeaky eggs.  Perfect size for any dog, lots of squeak! I think the eggs that come with the toy are a little more durable but dogs love both.

Was fairly easy to put together. Cat just loves playing with it, but she only plays for a minute or so and loses interest. She doesn't seem able to see the ball itself, only finds it when it's moving. Good product though.

I am very happy that it fits my size can and it appears to be a bit more sturdy than the previous ones I have had ( break quickly ) However, from the advertised picture and the price I expected 2 lids...very disappointing.
My dog and friend's dogs love these things but they are really stink! I can't get over the smell to keep them in my house.

This is one of my 4 month old miniature dachshund's favorite toys. We got it after reading all the reviews on amazon when we first got him at 11 weeks. He was so little at the beginning he could stick his whole head into the toy to get the treats inside. Now that he's older, he has to pull out the squirrels to get to the hidden treats. The squirrels are the perfect size for him to chew on and he brings them all around the house. I like hiding the squirrels underneath blankets and he has a great time trying to find them.

Our original Petmate, now several years old, developed a leak so we decided to replace it (although we might have repaired it). This new one seems a much better design. The opening in the mouth of the bottle is large enough to get a cleaning brush into, the  old one was not. This one has a carbon filter built in, we use R. O. filtered water but an additional filter is a plus. The bottle latches positively on the base preventing it from falling off. Microban is built into the base. That should also provide some semi-permanent anti-bacterial protection. It holds a reasonable amount of water for our dog, any more and it would be too heavy, any less and it would require cleaning and refilling too frequently.
summary: Nice, Reasonably Priced, Pet Auto-Watering System

reviewText: Excellent for all aquariums! Great for cycling and start up, overstocked tanks, adding new fish, and especially for ammonia sensitive fish. Perfect for goldfish

My dog was ecstatic when I opened this package and she realized it was for her. I had to use scissors to open the bag but once it was open I pulled out one of the 1" wide x 6" long x 1/8" thick dog snacks. These are hard snacks and look similar to the "cheap" ones that your local grocery store carries. These last a little longer though. My dog pranced around with it in her mouth before she sat down to indulge in it. She found it easy to hold and it was both crunchy and chewy. She enjoyed it. I enjoyed that it had extra calcium for her teeth & bones. Nice product, good value with 60 of them in the bag.

I was relieved that my chubby Russian Blue cat, Maggie, happily lapped up this "healthy" cat food.  She has a big appetite but she knows what she likes.  For awhile I was worried that she was a junk cat food addict, because she turned up her nose at the other "healthy" food I tried -Hill's Pet Nutrition Ideal Balance Slim and Healthy Natural Chicken and Peas Recipe Adult Dry Cat Food, 3.5-PoundShe definitely prefers this brand over Hill's.  Since they are both similarly expensive and claim to offer higher quality ingredients, Nutrience is the clear cut winner if we're going to splurge.  Maggie's tummy happiness is what counts!

reviewText: She eats these things as if they were cat candy. By gosh they are...But at least they seem to have OK ingredients. Amazon was great not only with he packaging but with the speed in which they were delivered.

reviewText: My dog (and her pals) love Zuke's mini treats.I switched to peanut butter after all the dogs in the dog park would stand around me when I had the salmon treats in my pocket (or when the pocket was empty but the smell remained).  We really like the peanut butter - dog likes because they are tasty treats, I like because they are good quality and the smell doesn't linger in my pocket.

I bought these hoping they wouldn't be too small, they weren't for my three little wiener dogs mouths. They fit perfectly and had good squeakers. They didn't last long though because my female dog is a toy murderer lol.

I am glad I got this over the all in one. I use this on my puppies  (mini doxies) and they did so well. The way I have it set up I am able to put them in the basement sink and dry them on the counter top. The loop I didn't like and bought another one.I love that the arm can be adjusted in height and the clamp opens up quite wide. It is sufficiently sized for my 4 inch thick butchers block I don't understand ones that make a complaint about it not being wide enough.I noticed it made little square indentation mark/ scratches. To remedy this I am going to buy stick-on-felt and cover the metal plate.

reviewText: These are the firmer Nylabone material, and well made.  I got two of them, so if they get gnawed to death, I've got a back-up. I did this with my last dog, and the only thing she destroyed was a roll of paper towels- nothing expensive.  With enough of her own toys, she was a dream to raise.... I'm hoping the next  puppy follows suit !!

I used this on a spot that was repeatedly hit by 2 cats. First I used a large syringe to inject the rug base and pad and let it sit for about a week. Then I put the solution into my spotbot and shampooed the area without vacuuming up the liquid. Let it sit for another week. Got down on my hands and knees and sniffed--NO CAT SMELL and neither cat has it the spot again! Great stuff!
summary: No more smell on old cat spot!

reviewText: I have several different varieties of these countertop cookers, and have been surprised at how well they perform.With a plethora of rescued dogs, I would really need ten of these lined up to cook enough treats for everyone at once!  I used a recipe I found on the internet years ago, sort of a Cheddar Bay Biscuit knockoff. When the biscuit is cooked, it is still soft, not unlike a biscuit for humans. Dogs love them soft, but I also put 6 of them in the oven on about 200 degrees and let them dry out until they became more crunchy.  They loved those, too.Overall the machine cooked fairly evenly, though the back cavities took almost a minute longer to cook than the fronts. It's a little hard to get the cooked biscuits out, but i just take a plastic fork, cut out the middle two prongs, and use that as a scooper/lifter.I can see myself using this to bake cookies for humans, too. So all in all, a fun little machine that performs very well.

I was so blinded by the excellent price ($38 and free shipping at the time) that I didn't really think things through. I bought this for my Betta, but now wish I had not. The tank is nice enough, but not really appropriate for the pet I have (that's my fault, I wasn't thinking)Since the tank is skinny and very deep, you'll want very tall plants if you hope to near the top (the XL 18 inches will come close). Bettas like to sleep near the top, using a plant as a hammock, so I suction cupped one to the top - not exactly the look I was going for.For most fish, (esp. Bettas) a heater is a must - add $15-20 to the price.It comes with a tiny filter - not great for a Betta because they don't care for moving water. Since its long and skinny, there is poor surface area on top. I had to turn the filter off so that his food doesn't blow around when i feed him. I finally just stopped using the filter, since Bettas need to be near the top of the tank to get some breaths of air.And the 360 viewing experience? The curve of it obscures what i can view. I often can't find him if he stays along the sides.Since the 6 gallon was only a few dollars more than the 3 gallon version, I figured I'd be crazy not to get it -- it looks a bit lumbering. If i want to vacuum the gravel, I'll need to buy one of those giant ones like I used to have for my 75 gallon tank, since this tank is easily 24 inches high.I'm going to do some research and see what else I can put in this tank and move my betta back to a gallon tank.The night light feature is awesome - you can choose blue, white or my fav, blue/white combo. if this is in a kids room for a night light, then neato, although I doubt the constant stimulation would be happy for your pet.I hope some of these points can help you decide if this product fits your individual needs.
HiI purchased this for our new puppy. She would not use them. I think they are a great idea but she wouldn't use them. They scared her. I ended up giving them away.dee
simple concept that works well. lightweight. wash/drys quickly. took koda all night to work it off, but then he's a determined dog.

Since my cats *love* tunnels, I ordered this one, my second, because it was a lot longer than the first.  Alas, the wiring around the openings isn't sturdy enough to keep it open.  Once it collapses, that's the end of the tunnel fun.
I try not to overdo it (easy to do) but both our dogs love these and they are one of the healthier treats on the market. NylaBone products are the best so far as we are concerned.

Bought this to brush cat hair off my clothes, tablecloth, and bathroom rugs (which are microfiber / memory foam).  It pulls off the cat hair as well or better than the lint roller I used to use.  While you do have to brush the hair off this into the trash (is opposed to just tearing a sheet off the lint roller), that beats the lint rollers where you need to keep buying extra rolls of sheets (and where I used to go through three sheets just trying to do the tablecloth).  It has done such a good job, I've been thinking about buying a few more for convenience to keep in different rooms.
summary: Magic is a good word for it

reviewText: I actually have this tank in Black, not that the color makes a difference in how it all works, which is very well indeed.The sponge filter medium is HUGE for the size of the tank, and has two good-sized cutouts to hold the bio-beads and any other medium you might want to put in the filter.  I added a second bag of bio-beads as this tank was replacing a "standard" 5 gallon that had a betta and a couple oto cats in it.  By using the bio-beads from the existing tank's filter I had no concerns about cycling the tank before moving my fish into it.The filter pump is surprisingly powerful for its small size, even on the lowest setting, so much so that I had to make a spray bar return for it to reduce the force of the water coming back from the filter.  My betta was getting "blown" around the tank because the current was so strong, and it made us both unhappy.  With the home-made spray bar my betta was much more comfortable.Because the center of the lid is open (so it doesn't block any of the light from the LEDs) the tank is prone to evaporation loss more than it otherwise would be. As I do weekly water changes this isn't much of an issue, and it is common with open-topped tanks anyway.  But I wanted others to know that it is something to deal with if that matters to you.The light works well and my live plants are growing nicely with it.  The screw that holds the light bar in place is only plastic, and seems to have stripped the threads even with careful handing, so I will probably have to replace it with a metal screw so the light bar is more secure.  I have the light on a timer, so the 2-way switch for white vs. blue LEDs is not an issue to me, but if you don't use a timer on the light you'll have to manually switch from white daytime to blue nighttime lighting.Everyone who's seen the tank comments on how good it looks!  I'm very glad I bought it even with having to make the minor modification of the filter return.  For fish that like a strong current or a nano marine tank the powerful filter pump would be ideal.

Am in need of a treat that is small, bite size for a 13 lb. pup.  Equally important the treat needs to be made from fish.  Our pup is in obedience, agility and now therapy dog classes (not all at the same time).  We are not able to use this product because it cannot be cut into small pieces. It crumbles if it is cut.

its truly hard to tell if these work or if time is what has calmed our cats down. but at one point we had 4  of these and i noticed changes in behavior and then found 3 to be empty.  was it coincidence? not sure but we didnt want the 4th one to run out and find out for sure.  i have had a behaviorist come to my house due to bully/victim situation (ongoing), and she did recommend these and thespray.  i will continue to plug away and hope for peace. : )

My puppy loves these! For a while she was on a limited diet--We were trying to check for a food allergy, so she couldn't have the freeze-dried chicken that you can find in all the stores. So we switched to turkey. Turkey worked well.My only complaint is that I wish PureBites would make these in the same larger sizes in which you can get the chicken ones.
summary: Great treat. I wish the bags were bigger, though...

reviewText: I love Smart Bones because one of my dogs (Teddy) is VERY picky about what he eats. Tikka, however, will eat anything you throw at her it seems. Both of my dog LOVE THESE!I know some of you may be concerned that they are "Made in China". I was concerned too but I did some research. If you message SmartBones they will tell you..."SmartBones are made in China in a facility that was designed by SmartBones Chief Science Officer Martin Glinsky, Ph.D. It was built specifically for their manufacturing requirements following strict quality control and assurance programs –so it’s 100% safe."

Ok, so unlike most of you, I have many cats and kittens that test out toys when we purchase them and this one got 1/2 a paw up.  It was enjoyed more by the kittens 12 weeks and younger and the older ones thought it pointless.  They much prefer the cat toy where the ball goes around in a circle with the scratch pad in the middle.  If I had a choice, I'd tell you to spend your money on that toy and skip this one.  I would vote this one a WASTE OF MONEY!  Cheaply made and losses their interest is not the way I want them to spend their day.  I want them happy with a toy they enjoy to play with!

reviewText: 1 of my 2 dogs was diagnosed with inflammatory bowel disease. Part of the treatment is a change to a diet with a different, non meat, non poultry protein source. In addition to a main diet change snacks like beggin' strips and milk bones had to go. But the dogs enjoy these just as well. They are pricey but I supplement with easily digestible homemade snacks like potato puffs and sweet potato fries. Seems to be working because his appetite is improving.

Once the cats try this treat, they like it.  Unfortunately, the problem is getting them to try it in the first place.  There is no enticing aroma to get them started.  The cat just has to trust you that you wouldn't feed them something awful.  Once they have eaten one piece, they are hooked and love it.

reviewText: It is entertaining watching the cats "working" for their food. They have it figured out pretty well. It is pretty sturdy and the kibble stays in the bowl. After watching the cats with the first one, I then got on Amazon and ordered another one, since my "kids" aren't so good with sharing :) Worth the money. It is hard to get cats to lose weight, you can't go take them on a run, or throw ball. Little steps like this, helps shed those unwanted pounds on your little fur baby.
This Filter is awsome. Ignore all the reviews from this people that dont know howe to assemble this filter. U guys should have stay iin school. Best out there.

Purchased this as a timer for my Marineland DoubleBright LED light.  The gradual dimming function wont worth with the Marineland, but otherwise, the timer was phenomenally easy to set-up, and has worked flawlessly for me.  I'd definitely recommend spending a little more to purchase this item.

reviewText: I bought this only because I had another one the cats just loved they like to lay in it more then anything But one of my cats when no one was around just peed on it? so I have it now on my deck they still scratch on it but so upset at my darn cat he was mad about something!

This ball is made of a very heavy duty material, which I think even my Airedale (who can destroy most toys in 20 minutes or less) will find tough to destroy.  It is a bit heavy, I assume from the "giggle" mechanism inside, but she is able to pick it up with no problem.  The only reason I didn't give it five stars is the sound it makes -- it doesn't sound like a "giggle"-- more like a clicking sound.  To get it to make a more elaborate noise, I have to pick it up and shake it and even then, it isn't a "giggle".  Still, my dog does notice the sound it makes and she does respond to it most of the time.

We already have the SportsDog fence system with a SDF-100 collar, so we wanted to get one of these for some problem spots inside. reviewText: I thought my dogs would love these, but it's not to their taste. I'm sure other dogs will love them and I gave a couple to a friend who has two dogs and they did like them, just not my dogs.

Not a bit deal as you can easily move the liquid to a better bottle, but just gave me one more reason to dislike this product.  I won't be buying this again.
This is a great product for the price. It was easy to put together and is very balanced and stable. We have three cats and this size is big enough for the three of them to be on it together.

These don't have a funky odor, no greasy feel in your fingers and being made in the USA is a big plus too. My only complaint is that they are very expensive if you're using them for for multiple dogs on a daily basis.

reviewText: One of our dogs has a grain allergy and it can be hard to find treats for him, but these are perfect - all-natural, grain-free, and, to them, delicious.  They gobble them up and get excited when I reach for them.

reviewText: Very satisfied.  I used to use Nature's Miracle on my carpet but it still left a faint urine odor (which dogs would find much easier to detect).  Rocco & Roxie's seems to get the job done completely.  My dog sniffs the area where I applied this product, but I think it's to explore the product's scent which is new to him, not because there's any urine odor left.  There have been no accidents on the spots where I applied this product.  This product is definitely better than any other product that I've tried.  Only downside is that they only have 32 Oz bottles.

After reading the great Amazon user reviews for this product I decided to get a couple for my girls.  They absolutely love them!  They acted just like the cats in the user videos.  Just adorable!  My cats are very picky about cat toys so I'm thrilled to find some that they really, really enjoy!  The banana size and shape is just perfect because they can hold them with their front and back paws which makes it easier for them to enjoy the catnip inside.  This catnip is strong because I could smell it the minute I opened the package and could also tell from their reaction.  The banana itself seems like it will hold up quite well also.  I definitely recommend this product for the cat's enjoyment as well as those watching them have a blast!  :)

reviewText: This is the primary food that I feed a tank of mixed Cichlids, including Mbuna's, Haps, and Peacocks. I do supplement with frozen Krill occasionally. reviewerName: Big c "the big guy in the part"
reviewText: I am using this heater in my biocube 29 gallon tank, the built in thermostat is very accurate..I know first hand, I set the heater at 78 f , the glow light on it showing it is heating went off as my floating glass thermometer went right into the green zone of 78 f

They call it chicken so that we, the consumers are happy to buy them because we eat chicken too, but what if they said they came from some other kind of avian source?  Anyways, I digress.  My dogs love these, they have no digestion issues from them whatsoever.  I would only feed them, at most, 1 per day.  It is a good value to buy them in the big bag, the smaller bags cost more at my local pet store.

I have three cats and they all like different things so I can never find anything that they all will actually play with. This is better than most because both my girls will play with these balls, but my big boy isn't interested at all. The girls love the crinkly sound and it doesn't seem to be very easy to hold on to so it often gets pushed out of their paws so they have to chase it. It's a good, easy cat toy! These peppermint treats have quickly become a household favorite of my dog. Though considering his predilection for mint flavors, came as no surprise to us.  He adores them! The minty fresh scent admittedly does not provide a long-lasting solution to fresh doggy breath, but in the half hour or so immediately following, there is a marked improvement.Our dog gets one of these a day as a special treat. It has an almost solid licorice feel, that he enjoys chewing on. The green color, thankfully, has not stained any of our white carpets nor has it ever seemed to cause any adverse reactions to his overall digestive health. reviewText: This product is really good. I loved. I all ways going to used in my two dogs. I will recommend this product to my family and friends with dogs. THANK YOU.

If you are looking to buy this for a scoop free box, I would recommend it. However, I bought this to try in boxes that we scoop ourselves. It does cut down on room smell and mess on the floor outside the box, however because the urine is absorbed and all you scoop is the poop, the nasty urine soaked crystals stay in the box until it is time to throw it all out.  Unless your cat is very good at "spreading the wealth", you have to stir up the crystals for even distribution when you scoop, which when you are crouched over the box is a miserable task. Emptying the entire litter box having a month or so worth of pee soaked crystals is an even more unpleasant task, not to mention time consuming.  We went back to clumping litter where you can get rid of all the waste when you scoop and hardly ever have to empty the whole box.
summary: Do not suggest for manual scoopers.

reviewText: This must have one great taste, because the ferrets love it!! It is made from good products and a known name brand!

This ridiculous invention, a piece of bended wire with three pieces of cardboard attached to it, simulates the movements of flying insects which arouses the cats to no end. The cats love it above all else and never tire of it. The pieces of cardboard will come undone over time due to the cats catching it in their paws.

reviewText: This is pretty much solid meat and my dogs love lamb.  It is a very good brand and is soft enough to mix with dry food.

Eventually some smart entrepreneur had to come up with a better mousetrap for the disposable cartridges designed for the Scoop Free.Not only has this product (in conjunction with the Forever Tray) saved money, it is an intrinsically better design. Case in point. One of my two cats is 15 and has developed a kidney condition as the result of 2 years on anti-inflammatory meds. Accordingly, he drinks more water and goes more frequently. The original cartridge can, in the case of heavy urination, seep into the cardboard tray and reek sooner than the time it takes for complete saturation and expiration of the crystals. This is somewhat ameliorated with regular mixing and stirring of the crystals, but that defeats some of the carefree advantages of the purchase of the Scoop Free. I should also point out that the tray is easy to clean in a standard utility sink after dumping to sanitize before re-use.Just the Crystals was formulated out of common sense and necessity as indicated on the company website. It's granular size was adjusted to be somewhere between the Fresh Step and Tidy Cat versions as this was found to be a better compromise on the mechanism, preventing clogging or uneven spreading. The packaging was made in two convenient 4.4lb bags which 1) was determined to be a better (and more generous) fill level than the Scoop Free cartridges and 2) easily shipped in non-plastic containers.
summary: Clean and simple solution to Scoop Free disposable cartridges.

This product works great! My 16 year old cat has CRF and diabetes. It's difficult and expensive to treat both. This price for this product helps me keep the costs lower! Her kidney numbers improved lots after being on this product a short time. I open the pill and stir it into a teaspoon of food, which she gobbles up like there is no tomorrow! She thinks it's a real treat!A word of caution: whoever you order this from online, be sure they ship in cold packs. Even if they do, check how long they'll be in transit and if it's hot out. This has to be kept cold. If it's summer and hot, consider just taking a hit and buying locally so you'll know it's cold. Otherwise, get them to ship in dry ice if you can. I ordered this from Medi Vet and despite being packed in 3 cold gel packs, in a foil padded envelope, surrounded by air bags, it was still not cool enough when it arrived. It was only in transit for 3 days. But, the USPS lets things sit on trucks/planes in the 100 degree heat for hours. No cold back can withstand that.

I bought an old-style 75 gallon aquarium which was designed without a center brace.  The hood that came with it didn't have lights, and a hood with a light bar would have cost me about $160.  I bought two of these for a grand total of about $32 with shipping, and they work like a charm.  The braces didn't have anywhere to hold onto, but a couple Command strips secure them nicely (they're pretty light) to the upper trim on both sides of the tank.  Two of these illuminate my aquarium nicely.  The modes all work, but oddly, the two lights cycle through their modes in different orders.  The power cords are also a little short for a larger aquarium setup, but considering the cost and the money saved, these lights are excellent.
summary: Great for the price, very convenient

reviewText: I would give a 5 star rating for using "both" the spray and diffuser, but since I don't know which is most effective...I'll give it a 4.We moved from our resident condo to our rental unit during renovation project that will last 8 weeks.  We have been in our rental unit for about 3 weeks.  Prior to moving into our rental unit I went in and sprayed walls (8" above floor) and hooked up diffuser a couple of days prior to move in.Cats were not initially happy and we had one in particular who had a habit of spraying.  However, thus far he hasn't sprayed and it seems to be working.  This is not to be confused with a cat squatting down and urinating (simply an old age problem).  Regardless any urine is cleaned with a mix of alcohol and water (as recommended in package insert) and then dry and spray with Feliway spray.Compared to what we went thru before the spray and diffuser the combination seems to work very well.We will eventually have two diffusers in our resident unit when we move back.  One in the living room and one bridging the two bedrooms, I'll have these in placed about a week before move in and spray the walls as a precaution (according to package insert you'll get 500 doses from one can).Note: Diffuser lasted a little over 3 weeks.  I'm considering having each of the two diffuser units hooked up on a timer and have each run for 12 hour intervals (a.m. and p.m.)Would strongly recommend dual system approach in multi-cat household.
summary: I'm using with the Comfort Zone with Feliway diffuser so I need to give it a 4 star ... regardless seems to be working

Again, it's solid, like a giant (to her) treat, but as she chomped on it, it broke into pieces.The bag says it is for any size dog, and it says you can give them one a day. (Although coming back to this page, I see someone recommended taking it in the shower. I might try that!)It occurred to me that an ordinary bathmat, the kind with the textured fabric nubs, might do a better job of capturing the litter from my cat's paws, and moreover be easier to clean because in addition to shaking out the loose pieces I can throw the whole thing in the wash whenever a deeper cleaning is needed.
