One of our cats has always peed on the floor, so we basically had to figure out which part of the floor was the "pee area of the week" and line it with pee pads (training pads).  It will poop in the litterbox, but nothing else we have tried--special sprays, litters, extra litterboxes, etc.--has convinced that cat to pee in the litterbox.  If we put a litterbox where the cat is peeing on the floor, the cat chooses a new spot to pee on the floor.  We even had to give this cat its own private suite (a room larger than our bedroom) because it hates the other cats and hates strangers, and any extra aggravation causes it to pee and poop everywhere (one time it even smeared poop on the wall because it didn't like one of my wife's friends).So needless to say, I was skeptical when I read the "100% litterbox use or your money back.  I guarantee it!" label on Dr. Elsey's litter.  I told my wife we should try it, but we both shook our heads and said we were going to have to put that money-back guarantee to use.Now here's the amazing part: we've been using this stuff mixed about half and half with normal clumping litter for a few months now, and the cat doesn't pee on the floor any more.  Although Dr. Elsey's Cat Attract litter is expensive, I don't think the price difference is any more than what we were paying for the training pads before, especially since we've been able to get away with mixing Dr. Elsey's litter with normal litter.  On top of that, the room doesn't smell like a pool of urine.  This stuff might not work for all cats, but it worked for ours.  If you have a problem cat, you've got nothing to lose in trying this at least once and claiming the refund if it doesn't work.  In fact, if you go to the company's website you can download a rebate and get it free even if it does work.

Fenbendazole is a good weapon for an aquarists to have in his or her arsenal.  This medication will treat a variety of internal parasites from your fish.As a previous reviewer has stated, thorough treatment is required when fighting some of the more persistent internal parasites, like roundworms.  Start the treatment as soon as you suspect internal parasites.  Your chances, the fish chances, are much better if you start the treatment while they are still eating.  If you wait until after they stop eating, then you are limited to medicating the water in the tank.  The best way is to also mix fenbendazole with the fish food and feed it to the fish in conjunction with treating the water.The fish will be more likely to accept the medication if you mix it with frozen food.  You can thaw frozen shrimp and soak it in fenbendazole.  For added efficiency, you can use a binder like Seachem focus to help draw the medication into the food.  You can also try mixing with flakes, but the flakes will get soggy and messy.The main value of this medication to me is its use as a preventative.  I feed this to newly-acquired fish.  Basically, I make the assumption that the new fish are infected and treat accordingly.  This medication will not harm the fish and it will clear away internal parasites that may be hitching a ride on your new fish.  In this manner, in the event that the fish are exposed to a stressor later on, at least they will not succumb to intestinal worms.  Even if the fish do get stressed, if there are no low-level camallanus worm infection in any of the fish in the tank, they will not get infected.Some hobbyists use canine de-wormer on their fish.  However, this is not an expensive product and you will be better off simply using the fenbendazole that is already packaged for use with tropical fish.  This will save you from having to buy canine tablets and having to ground it into a fine powder.
summary: Another weapon in your arsenal against fish parasites.

My hamster can climb out. It is cool when I am doing homework, and I like it. She can just climb out. SO watch your hammy. But my hamster loves it. Great, I kinda recommend it :DD

the container is a good size to hold a few days food for my dog but the water bottle that comes with it is kind of junk.  Once the bottle is filled it is difficult to empty completely and doesn't hold much water. I do like that the top unscrews to form two bowls.
summary: It works for food not water

reviewText: Looking at the construction of the muzzle, the quality is good; no lose material, or stray threads; the closure worked perfectly, it is everything the seller claims....Just 1 tiny problem(my fault, not the seller's....I should have measured my dog's muzzle prior to buying this...it did not fit my dog's muzzle. my mistake.Because the cost of the muzzle is so cheap, it would cost me more to send it back than I would get back...so I just tossed it.If you have a need for a high quality muzzle, then this is the muzzle to satisfy your needs.I highly recommend this product.
summary: SODIAL(TM) Adjustable Dog Puppy Safety Muzzle Stop Biting Barking Nipping...

reviewText: My dog likes this. What more is there to say? Well, having had one dog have issues with China produced wet food (pouches), I try to make sure the ingredients are made in the United States and keep up-to-date on any alerts issued about recalls. This isn't the best dog food around, but it is a decent one. The first ingredient is chicken, but the next three aren't so great:  Corn Meal, Ground Whole Grain Sorghum, and Chicken By-Product Meal. I do mix it with organically grown raw foods (veggies and meats) so hopefully the health of those ingredients offset the ingredients that prevent this from being a top dog food. As a l;arge dog owner I like the supplements for joints.This is a very decent dog food and my dog likes it. What more can I say?
Works well in calming cats.

Reviews I read prior to purchasing this product identified it as a liquid that can be used on hard wood floors.  I have one small rug in the living room but mostly I have wood floors.  I have a rescue dog who has accidents sometimes while I'm gone at work.  I haven't used the product too much since I bought it, but I will say that it smells amazing, doesn't affect the finish of the floor AT ALL, and as far as I can tell, kills the urine smell.  I highly recommend it for these reasons.Also, the vendor, Bubba's Rowdy Friends Pet Supply Company, has emailed me at least 4 times, asking if all is well, if I have questions or concerns about the product, and seems to be right there with a sincere desire to be sure I'm comfortable with the product.  I value this customer service far more than I can say.All in all, I recommend the Terminator very highly.
summary: Smells divine and kills the urine odor

reviewText: I already have one of these but cats love it so much had to get another since the feathers will surely get damaged.
it smells nice and leaves my cockapoos hair smooth and silky, she doesn't seem to itch as much when I use a conditioner.

Not for our dog.I guess every dog is different.  Our  new pit bull, adopted 12 days ago (est. 2 years old, emaciated when rescued) Brandy, has been pretty good with all of  our dog toys and has not destroyed any of them,  although after a week she did destroy the squeaker in a wooly kind of toy, although she still likes playing tug of war with the wooly toy, squeaker or not. [UPDATE: Yesterday Brandy destroyed one of my good leather sneakers].Whatever.  I gave this supposedly super strong  toy to Brandy as soon as I opened the box from Amazon.  I could hear the toy squeaking as Brandy first played with it, but surprisingly Brandy also whimpered while she squeaked it as if something about the toy bothered her.  In less than an hour Brandy had totally--and I mean totally--destroyed the toy.  I found the cloth skin in the hallway and the plastic inners in two different rooms.  Brandy seems to do better with squeaky latex toys--she doesn't take the squeakers out like our last dog did (or at least she hasn't yet).  So to each dog his own.

This is a pretty standard tug toy with a big knot in the center. This is something I didn't really think through when I purchased it. My dog is pretty skittish, so the noise that the big knot makes when it hits the floor is loud enough to discourage her from playing with it. I gave it to a friend and their dog loves it. Very strong, durable toy.
it works incredible, the tines are nice and close together, and they remove everything from the dog and cats. wonderful product.
My ferrets love to tunnel through this upside down and it is so adorable. It is well made and well worth the price.

These are bit larger than I expected them to be; however, they do the trick.  I actually break them in half and wrap one dog's pill in it, and give the other half to my other dog as a treat.  This keeps her from thinking she's been left out.

One of my cats is OBSESSED with these things! I have to keep buying them because he dissects them and destroys them. Good thing they are not that expensive. My hunter-cat's favorite independent play toy. Keeps him entertained for hours.
summary: Keeps my hunter-cat entertained for hours.

reviewText: I hate to leave this tank a bad review, but I just can't justify the problems I'm having with the equipment.As far as the bare tank- the cube itself, I'm happy. It's simple, well-designed, sturdy, and classy-looking. However, I had a major issue with the filter that comes with the tank...the thing hangs up above the top of the tank and makes a ton of bubbles that pop above the tank (this is just how the filter works) and it gets water all over the place. Without keeping the water level at an awkwardly-low level to keep the filter low enough not to have this problem, I could not resolve this issue. It's also not the quietest running filter either, despite being called "Whisper." Within a few days I decided it was not going to work out and am replacing it with a TOM filter.Also, the light leaves a bit to be desired. The light I had for my old smaller tank showed off my betta's beautiful colouring wonderfully, but this one kind of leaves him in the dark, and I'm starting to consider replacing that as well.It's kind of a waste to buy an aquarium kit if I have to replace all of its components apart from the bare tank. I would recommend just going with one of the comparable Fluval tanks as they seem to have a better system, or building your own tank, unless you can find a way around the problems I've faced with it.
summary: It's alright, but there are a few important issues.

reviewText: If you have a newborn puppy to care for...maybe you could use this.  But truthfully, skip this unit all together and just lay your newspaper down on the floor.  Others including my breeder didn't think these were useful and just a waste of money...and they're right.  It's not a bad product at all, and if your dog chews the potty pad edges, this will deter them.  But if your dog tears pads and eats them, don't use plastic pads, and switch to paper towels instead.  Try that first before spending more money on wasteful dog products.  I have a box of useless items, and unfortunately, this is one of them.But nothing wrong with the construction or concept!
summary: Nothing wrong...just not useful in general.

reviewText: First I bought the Marineland 5.5 gallon tank - the filter sounded like an air conditioning unit, so I sent it back.  Then I bought the Top Fin 5.5 gallon tank, but the output was too strong. Based on recommendations, I bought the TO Aquarium Mini Internal Filter to put into the Top Fin tank.  I was skeptical but it's great. The diffuser was too strong, so I used the spray bar. It doesn't spray, it just trickles out against the tank wall. This is a keeper.***UPDATE June 8, 2013***  It was a keeper...for two months. It just stopped working. Before that, however, I was unable to find replacement filters and resorted to adding my own charcoal. I contacted several pet stores who all told me they carried the filter but not the cartridge replacements.  I ended up buying a Whisper filter but it doesn't have the great diffuser bar.
summary: I needed a quiet filter for my betta and this is it - updated

reviewText: My title says it all.  I appreciate the fact that these are built with nutrition in mind, but since my dog ONLY eats healthy dog food I'm not entirely concerned about a small, fun snack for him from time to time.At the sound of me saying "treat!" my dog almost looses his mind.  When I first gave him this he took it in his mouth, ran over to his treat-eating spot, and then dropped it and looked at it, not sure what to make of it.  After a while he bit into it (CRUUUUCH!) and ate the entire thing.I offered him another one the next day and he took it with a lot less enthusiasm than he usually does when taking treats.  It was almost as if he was saying, "Well, if that is all I get I'll take it, but next time you say 'treat' it better be something I can get excited about."  He ate it as well, but without the usual glee he puts into his treat-eating.So, he'll eat them but there are a host of other treats -- most of them also built with health in mind -- that he would prefer to eat first.  I'll still give him all of these square little biscuits from time to time but only because I don't want them to go to waste.  I won't be getting another bag.
summary: Nutritious, but pretty hard and my dog isn't too excited about them

reviewText: ****I have conducted extensive research on Rachael Ray and have arrived at the following conclusions: (1) She has received no non-honorary degrees from any colleges or universities domestically or internationally that would suggest she's an expert in formulating dog food.  (2) She has never been employed in an AAFCO-approved laboratory capacity at a major dog-food concern.  (3) She's cute.  For this I neither add nor subtract any stars.It's reasonable to conclude that her name on the package of the product under review, Rachael Ray Nutrish Dry Dog Food, Beef & Rice Recipe, 6-Pound Bag, implies not the application of her expertise in formulating this and the other types of dog food in the Rachael Ray line but rather her willingness to lend the considerable selling power of her name and face in exchange for money.  (I want a job like that.)So, since we cannot rely on Ms. Ray's own personal expertise in formulating dog foods, how can we decide whether this particular product, which presumably WAS formulated by experts, is a good one both for the dog and for the price?****The list of ingredients and their ranking by prevalence is a good start.  If, for example, the first three ingredients are cow dung, hay and sand, you can be pretty sure the rest of the ingredients, no matter how healthful they are, are not going to make up for those first three.  The first three ingredients in the product under review, in order, are said to be beef, chicken meal and ground rice, some of which sound edible to me.  Also included are tomatoes, olive oil and parsley, which sound like a good start on a spaghetti sauce.  Also included are such mysteries as pyridoxine hydrochloride, cobalt sulfate and sodium selenite, but, unlike as with, say, sand, I'm pretty sure the manufacturer wouldn't go to the trouble and expense of adding them for no reason.****Another factor is whether dogs will eat it.  To test this I offered my dog, PheyeG'hdeaux, whose seventh birthday is today, an unbiased choice between an ounce of his regular dog food, Eukanuba, and an ounce of the product under review.  He ran up to the two bowls on the floor, thinking at least one of them had a true treat such as melted ice cream or taco detritus in it, and he sniffed the Eukanuba bowl first, then the Rachael Ray bowl, then he ate the Rachael Ray, then the Eukanuba.  This doesn't prove much, because if his regular food for years had been Rachael Ray and I offered him Eukanuba he might have eaten the Eukanuba first just because he was tired of the Rachael Ray and wanted to experience new tastes and smells.  For this I neither add nor subtract any stars.****The price on Amazon as of this writing is $10.98 for six pounds, which works out to $1.83 per pound.  The price of the Eukanuba I buy from a store averages about $1.20 per pound, which makes the Rachael Ray about 50% costlier.  That's a considerable difference.  If you feed your dog(s) a mere 100 pounds a year, the Rachael Ray costs $63 more annually [($1.83 - $1.20) * 100 = $63], or $5.25 more per month.  Of course, all of the foregoing assumes Eukanuba is at least as healthful for and appealing to your dog as the product under review, which I assume it is because it's the brand my dog's vet and this other expert on dog foods recommend.  For this I subtract one star from five.****Wanting to go beyond what's expected, for the entertainment of the handful of people who will read this review all the way down to here, I now report on things this product, which I remind you is dog food, can and cannot substitute for.-- Can substitute for giraffe food in a pinch.-- Cannot substitute for panda or koala food, even in a pinch.-- Can substitute for weight in your trunk to get more traction for a rear-wheel drive car in the snow, but you'll need a lot more than one 6-pound bag.-- Cannot substitute for sand when mixing concrete according to the standard dry recipe of 1 part cement (a powder), 2 parts sand, and 3 parts gravel.-- Can substitute, however inconveniently, for a door stop.-- Cannot substitute for six pounds of gold, at least not in sheer value.  As of today's writing gold is worth $1,590.80 per ounce, which makes six pounds worth 6 times 16 ounces times $1,590.80, which is $152,716.80, which is a LOT more than $10.98.Five stars minus 1 for the price is four.****

I cannot find much scientific evidence for or against, so I can only state that they worked for our dog.  We are suckers and let our Goldens jump on the bed.  Our seven year old Golden began to have some arthritis and just could not jump on the bed any more.  We consulted with our vet who said that that Cosequin couldn't do any harm,, so began to give them to him every day.  Within a few weeks he was able to jump on the bed again, so we are now giving them to all our dogs.We use double strength for the Goldens and regular strength bonelets for the six pound Chihuahua..

This is a wonderfully tiny filter perfect for a 5 gallon (or 5.5 gallon) aquarium. The very low flow rate is great too, and with the addition of using the spray bar you can really get the water movement down.All of my aquariums are fully planted at the plants themselves are the main filtration. I only need a filter to catch floating solids and to keep the temperature in the tank even along with nutrients for the plants. The vast majority of freshwater fish that people keep come from swamps, bogs, flooded rivers, and very slow moving streams. The common factor is low (but not zero) water movement.The filter compartment itself contains just a regular course sponge, which is perfectly fine. It will hold up for a long time (compared to a pad) and is easy enough to remove for washing. Above the sponge is a very small compartment that comes pre-filled with loose activated carbon. That went straight into the trash, activated carbon does absolutly nothing for a planted aquarium, and very little otherwise with how infrequent people tend to replace it. In its place I put a small bit of filter floss (otherwise known as poly fil from a craft store, or quilt batting also works) that increases the filters performance with small particles.Noise wise the filter is pretty quite. You can hear the hum, but it is less that you would get from a HOB or sponge filter. The power for this filter is DC instead of the more normal AC so it comes with a 'wall wort' as I call it, the large plug that takes up space near the outlets.I use this with a Betta, but it would also be fine for an invert tank (shrimp and snails). And did I mention it is really small? Huge plus for me as space is at a primium in these small tanks.

This is the 2'nd Nina Ottosson game I've purchased for my corgis.  They masteredCompany of Animals Nina Ottosson Dog Brick Interactive Gamefairly quickly, and I wanted to give them more of a challenge.  They definitely have to think to figure out DogCasino.  I followed the training instructions on the DVD.  (Love the DVD that comes with these games!)So, I started with the drawers only then moved to bones-only, and finally to both.  Surprisingly, my "bad boy" who knows how to open kitchen cabinets & can open locking plastic containers without damaging them, took a while to figure out how to pull out the drawers.  When I use both parts of this game it still takes him several minutes to get all the treats.One thing both my dogs figured out quickly was that if they grab the game in their teeth, lift, and drop it, the drawers open.  So, I have to keep a hand or foot on the game while they're playing.Like the Brick, this is a well made game.  We've had this game for about a month, and it still presents a good challenge.

They don't state this anywhere in the product description, but the Cascade 170 is tiny.  Like, fits in the palm of your hand tiny.  It's 3 inches tall, roughly.  Don't let that fool you, though, because it pumps water like a beast.  Even on the lowest setting, I'm going to have to build a diffuser so that it doesn't blow my poor betta in circles around the tank.  It's a powerful motor, but I'm not sure yet if it'll work for my tank because it's so small.Also, I can't seem to find a carbon cartridge anywhere on it.  The only filter media I've found is a black stiff sponge, but I might be missing something.  It's not really a problem, I guess, but given that it says mechanical and biological filtration, I expected some carbon in there somewhere.  The fish in my tank don't produce much waste and I've gotten into the habit of vacuuming the gravel every week or so anyway, so I guess it's not that big of a deal.

I put this in a 5.5gallon tank with one betta. The tank sits about 3 feet from the couch in the living room and I literally cannot hear a thing. The flow is gentle and adjustable and even that cannot be heard or even noticed. Perfect for a betta or small fish. The suction cups at the bottom came away from the glass twice in the first day but after pushing a bit harder it has not come away since. I was afraid it would be large and take up space but it is nice and compact. I really like this filter and would recommend it for anyone with a small tank.

My barely 5 lb. 6 months old yorkie loves these bones!  I have been buying them for a few months now and she is so excited when ever she knows she is getting one.  They also keep her occupied for a little while as she tries to burry them into blankets, the couch cusions, and any corner of the house she can.  Very entertaining!  But once she is ready to eat them she goes to town and doesn't want anybody messing with her because she doesn't want them to take the bone from her, very protective over the bone. Also, better price on Amazon than they are at PetSmart or anywhere else!

I've only used the leash once myself but my girlfriend has used it several times with her 70lb German Shepard pup at the beach. With all that sand and salt water, the leash has held up great. I was worried about the clip because dirt and clips don't mix, but with a quick rinse it works perfectly fine, not to say it doesn't work with the sand, because it does. I'm actually ordering my girlfriend one for Christmas. Keep in mind that this is a training/walking/hiking lead and is not a tie out.

UPSET MY PUGS STOMACH BAD!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS TO FEED PUGS IN THE LEAST!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I HAVE TRIED DIFFERENT VARIETIES OF THE NATURAL BALANCE FOOD AND HAVE HAD NOTHING BUT MEDICAL PROBLEMS IN FEEDING THIS FOOD TO PUGS.
summary: natural balance sweet potatoe and duck

reviewText: If you have a small dog, don't bother. Maybe these would be more useful with a large breed dog that can scarf one of these down in half a second, but with a medium to average dog, they are simply the wrong texture and consistency for fast paced clicker training. They are strangely hard and chewy, and my dog needed to stop after each treat and take at least ten seconds to fully chew the treat. If you are at all familiar with clicker training that relies on mere seconds of response time, you can understand what a great hassle this can be.They smell strongly of bacon, but neither of my dogs were especially "crazy" about them to begin with. I would not purchase again. On the plus side, Amazon refunded my order.

I give these to my dog when the monthly topical treatment seems to be wearing off before a new dose is advised.  There seem to be no adverse side effects with these and my dog doesn't suspect me of trying to poison her when I give them to her, so they must be pretty tasty.

My Yorkie has become somewhat incontinent so I needed back up. My living room and dinning room rugs were beginning to reek! I ordered the Allmax Puppy Training Pads, and I am so pleased! I cleaned my rugs, put these down and all is well with the world again! I wouldn't be without them now and I only wish I had ordered them sooner.

My oldest cat is 18 and 1/2 and at the last visit to the vet they said she was in great health, but had lost a pound in the past 6 months. A pound!! That's a lot for a cat. We thought her days were numbered. But then I found this.After a few weeks of giving her maybe a tablespoon of this High Calorie gel in addition to her normal food each day she had gained a few ounces at the next vet visit. Super great news!!It's been a few months and I think we have put at least 6-8 oz. back on her. The formerly protruding bones are nice and padded. We can pet her without fear of hurting her. No longer does she feel lighter than air. She is now back to a normal look and as a bonus her fur is really getting back to it's nice and silky smooth self. This is good news as when they get older they seem to thin down a lot and need a little fat on them and as they age their fur doesn't look as hot. We don't want her too fat so we have to hold off on giving it to her sometimes, but on the days that she is having a hunger strike, we have a trick up our sleeve.She REALLY likes it too. She knows this tube of high calorie gel by sight and always gets super excited.Seems like she's a happier cat overall now.
summary: filled out the bones on my old cat!

reviewText: I ordered a size large for my miniature poodle. His back length is 15 inches and his chest is 20 inches around, plus he has some fluffy hair cut to a one inch length. He weighs 17 lbs. The length was just a teensy bit long on him, but not too bad. I CANNOT get over how cute these are! For the price, the fabric is a good quality. The little faux butt flap is adorable. There is quite a bit of open area on the belly and legs, so if you have a dog who gets really really cold they might need something different. I like how the legs were short enough that it wasn't difficult to get the pants onto him; he has a luxating patella and bending his leg too far hurts him. These are great, well worth the price!

If our little 10.5 lb. Maxx could write this review himself, he'd give this one a 'paws down'.  The treats quite simply--weren't.  At first I thought he'd just need to get accustomed to a different smell, texture, and flavor.  He eventually accepted it in his mouth and then sniffed, spat it out and laid it at my feet.  I tried on two different occasions to get him to brush his teeth--albeit the doggy way.  He just doesn't like them.That being said, I can't find anything wrong with them, other than his personal preference.  Your dog may find them to be great treats and want to brush with Milk-Bone's Brushing Chews.  After all, this review is just one dog's opinion.
summary: Doesn't Make Maxx Sit-Up and Beg

reviewText: My little girl loves these mini bakes. They are a nice size, and good quality ingredients to keep her healthy, while happy. She loves all of the Zuke's line that we have given her.

It is an excellent product, as compared to other conditioners should be placed a minimum amount of liquid to obtain the same result, besides that instantly removes chlorine and chloramines, also provides a protective coat to the fish and helps neutralize NO2 and NO3
These are great dog chews. I hesitated to try them because I wasn't familiar with them. These yak bones last longer than bully sticks. My dogs love them, and sometimes you've gotta spoil your dogs.
this has grown on us.  the ribs on the outside are pretty much useless for us but the inside for treats etc is wonderful.  This ball has given my dog many hours of chewing time...

This remote provided me with the most flexibility, which I liked.  Automatic bark collars would trigger after the dog yelped from the first shock, which created an awful cycle and caused a lot of pain and distress for my dog.  With this remote, I can use vibrate as a warning and control the level of shock.  As other reviewers have stated, the numbering of the buttons is completely nonsensical, but once you figure it out, you just have to memorize it.  The bigger problem is that sometimes the buttons get stuck, so the shocks continue if you aren't paying attention.
I have two min. schnuazers and my dogs love this canned food. I especially appreciate the home delivery and a good price as well.
summary: my dogs love this canned food

reviewText: My cats love this brand of treats and wait every night to get some before bed. They love all of the flavors and this is a bargain price compared to what they sell them for in pet stores.
summary: Great treats for your best buds

reviewText: I like it and the odor.  The odor does disappear though if you have a problem.  Haven't had to use much because the itching my dogs are dealing with have been more of a fungus problem than fleas.

Was very easy and fast to put together, except that the cats kept playing with the screws, standing on pieces I needed, and grabbing the assembly instructions and running away with them.  :)  I did struggle with the ramp for a minute, as it seemed uneven or something, or maybe one screw hole was bent differently than the others.  I ended up just forcing it on there and screwing it as tight as I could, and it's very sturdy despite that.**I found two downsides with this tree, but both are special circumstances, if you have a special needs cat, please read**  So the only issues I had were as follows: One is that my blind kitten would go to the very top platform, and get a bit confused on how to get down.  The two side platforms are pretty low down compared to the highest one, so if you have a blind cat who will "feel" her way down, just know that you might have to "rescue" your cat a few times when she gets stuck up there.  The second issue I had was with my other kitten, who has moderate CH.  He simply cannot climb up the bottom portion of the cat house (and as a moderate CH cat, of course, has almost 0 real jumping ability).  He can climb the lower sisal posts, but the "lip" of the bottom house and platforms are too much for him to overcome.  I'm going to have to get a set of cat stairs to put against the lower part, so he can get up there.  Once he's up on the lower portion, he can successfully climb to the top house, though, again, he cannot climb over the "lips" of the very top platforms.  Still, he seems thrilled to be even 3/4 of the way up the tree.  Just note that if your cat has problems jumping/coordinating, you may need pet stairs to help them overcome the lower part.(Of course the "normal" foster kittens has no issues at all leaping and climbing on this tree. ^)The highest sisal post seems to be the cool place to be for all the kittens, and they spend a lot of time taking turns hugging it and just chilling on top of the highest little house, playing and scratching on that sisal post.The little hanging toys are a massive hit, and I'm surprised they're still holding strong now on the second day, as they were receiving ridiculous amounts of kitten abuse.I also got this tree in about 4 business days, which is wayyyyyyyyyyyy under the amount of time it was going to take just to "process" it from other sellers who were charging more!  (4-6 weeks processing?  Pffft.)Highly recommend this tree in every single way.  And this seller.
summary: Soooo good.  Not wobbly at all.

reviewText: My dog was trained by a professional with one of these and he is a hand full most of the them all I have to do it put the collar on and he acts perfect. This is my third one the last one battery died and they cost more than just buying a new one so that is what I did.

Toted as an alternative to glucosamine, I was interested in trying this supplement.  I routinely use a glucosamine supplement and wanted to see how this compared.  Unfortunately, this did not put a dent in my achy joints.  In fact, I developed an unfamiliar ache in my shoulder when I started taking it.  When I stopped taking it, the shoulder ache went away.There is no "test" to prove that this works or does not work, but that weird ache in my shoulder compelled me to stop using this.I wish it would have worked for me:  The pill is a tiny oval and you only take one a day--very convenient.
summary: Despite this pill's convenience, Glucosamine works better for me

reviewText: We recently moved up to a larger aquarium & the thought of carrying buckets of water back & forth for water changes seemed exhausting to us. So we decided to purchase the water changer. We chose this one because the adapter is brass not plastic. After using the water changer to siphon water a few times, we decided to run the hose outside instead of hooking it up to the faucet. I couldn't stand wasting all that water to perform weekly water changes. Some reviewers state that after siphoning begins  you can turn off the water; it didn't work for us. Siphoning slowed down to a snail's pace unless we let our water run full force.It won't hook up to our bathroom faucet but does fit the kitchen faucet after we remove the aerator. Our faucet is similar to this oneDelta Orleans 2457 Two Handle Kitchen Faucet with Spray, Chrome.The oval-shaped, gravel tube is a generous 18" long & comes with a removable gravel guard which keeps gravel & fish from being sucked up into the tube.We hook it up to the faucet to put water back into the aquarium. (We run the water into a glass & test with a thermometer until the water matches the temperature in the aquarium.) As the tank begins filling, we addSeachem Prime 500mlto the tank to remove chlorine. It also removes ammonia & other harmful stuff, as well as, providing a slime coat for the fish.50' of hose is more than we need so we cut a few feet off & don't have to hassle with that extra length anymore. The hose is thick & wasn't easy to cut.Easy to understand step-by-step instructions are included.Great product, sure makes weekly aquarium upkeep much simpler.
summary: 50 foot water changer...you might want to siphon the water outside...

reviewText: The main thing here is, your dog has to like it and eat it, not how healthy it is for him.  My dog will eat this when there are no other options (Ex. cat food, mooching food from someone), but he won't dive on this stuff first thing.  I also had some Blue Buffalo food which got the same response; that bag was given to me by someone who couldn't get THEIR dog to eat it.
My cats like PetStages toys. The netting on the mice make these toys fun to chew or toss. These toys are safe & durable.
My dogs love these. I am so glad they have them on autodelivery so that they just show up at my door :-)

We bought two dogs from overseas as pups and both were lacking in normal socialization (typical!)  Regardless of decades of experience training dogs and all my normal techniques both were horrible jumpers (keep jumping in your face all the time) and pulled on the lead so bad you literally could not walk them.  This harness has made an amazing difference.  Placed on the dog correctly, the harness does not squeeze the neck (which never works anyway on dogs with powerful necks) but squeezes behind the forelegs which is very uncomfortable for the dog but not cruel.  I have found this extremely useful with these two dogs.

Great product, well made. I particularly like the swivel catch on this leash. I previously was using a thin rope (my dog is 20 pounds), and found myself spending more time untangling it than actually running my dog. This leash does not get easily tangled and is very light weight. Good buy for anyone who wants to let their dog run---and still wants to be sure you will be able to catch him/her if needed.
Great non-toxic dog toy option.  We fill it with peanut butter as a special treat to give our 9mo puppy when we leave him at home.  He's so excited by it he doesn't get anxious when we leave.

We actually use brushing teeth as a reward for sitting nicely after being groomed - because our dog LOVES to have her teeth brushed!  I credit that partially to socializing her to it right away, but also to this easy-to-use brush and (apparently) delicious peanut flavored toothpaste.  We only use the largest end, and it works well for brushing her teeth, roof of her mouth, and tongue.  I wouldn't say it leaves her with breath you would want to smell for pleasure, but it certainly freshens up that "dog breath" odor and makes it so that we essentially don't notice any odor at all.
summary: Dog loves having her teeth brushed

reviewText: I bought this for my Aqueon water changer, which I've used and loved for several years without issues.  This extension has ruined it.It is clearly a larger outer diameter than the tube that comes with the Aqueon water changer.  As a result, it simply will not fit into the slot.  I'm very curious to know how the other reviewers got it to work.  Perhaps theirs were sized correctly and I got a bad extension or my original water changer is somehow different from theirs.Regardless, I attempted to solve the problem by using a Dremel to grind off some of the outer layer of the extension tube so that it would fit.  Well, it fit more of less, but not without cracking the slot on the water changer and pretty much breaking it.  That piece cannot be bought by itself and necessitates buying a whole new hose.I am going to attempt to use some silicone to plug the crack and hopefully continue to use it, but I thought that I should warn everyone that the extension tube might not actually fit their Aqueon water changer.
summary: Sized incorrectly, broke my Aqueon water changer

reviewText: We tried this on my mother-in-laws dachshund pup and she had 5 ticks on her and it didn't work on any of them. We were not using the product wrong...it just did not work.

The smell is so strong and awful, it gave me a headache.  I wish I could continue to use it, but the smell is just too strong.  So, in short, it does work, but unfortunately, it keeps humans away also.  LOL

I just got this a few days ago. It does make the walk better so far, but I do notice that it is easy for it to escape from. The only draw back is that an extra lg. is a little snug. It is loosened as far as it can go. I got this size because I knew a medium was too small. For what I paid, its okay for now but I will have to find larger soon.

In short: The vacuum which is supposed to be designed for pet hair removal does its job, but not as well as they would like you to think. I would recomend it for a dog that sheds mildly with less wirey hair consistancy, not for one with multiple or heavy shedders with sharper hair. It is not a vacuum that lasts long with typical use.Positives:*Removes the sharper hairs (ie lab hair) that can wind into furniture and carpeting.*Has a decent amound of suction*Canister allows pet owners to save on the cost of vacuum bags which can get full very quickly*Attatchments are handy for furnature and pet beds*Pink atattchment (indicated for use on apholstery) with soft rubber head can be used to vacuum dogs and they seem to enjoy the sensation :)Negatives:*Attatchments are chunky and can't fit into many small spaces or corners*Special pet hair removal atatchment becomes clogged very easily with pet hair. Eventually it becomes clogged and you will need to take it apart and pull the hair out of the belt in order to make it function.*Hose is cheaply made and spiral support piping becomes loose and will create kinks in the hose that cannot be fixed.*Vacuum itself is large and cannot fit under furniture.  It is difficult to move and cannot get into corners well.*Doesn't remove all pet hair. Sharper hairs like that of a lab can be left behind (about 1/4 of the hair wont be completely removed with 4 passes over carpet or dog bedding and will require more vacuuming.)*Vacuum is heavy and difficult to carry or use on stairs.*Canister and filters need to be emptied and cleaned frequently to keep the vacuum funtioning.

Arrived quickly, nothing damaged or missing.  My hermit crabs love this. I do one end of the tank crushed coral sand mix at 6-8 inches deep the other I use this about 5-7 inches deep, they love to tunnel and burry themselves. Also great to mix in with sand half and half this holds moisture well.

I purchase this product on a regular bases, but my dog is a very poor eater n getting large quantities is useless, haven't the room to store. But she loves eating these chunks that I break up, n it stays good in her bowl w/o spoiling or drying out.I find that it a good way to get protein into her, w/o the need of supplements plus the other products I feed her, keeps cost shiny n clean. Aporeciate having delivered instead of carrying from store, a lot!
summary: Great Dry, Hardish Protein, Good For Teeth

reviewText: Cordless is exactly what I needed to do some trimming on my Border Collies. This worked right out of the box and does exactly what I needed it to do. BC should be groomed on a regular basis because of their thick undercoat. This clipper kit comes with various size combs that slip over the end of the clipper to keep the hair clipped to the desired level. Priced right and good quality. Would purchase again.

My dog loved them, but I could not stand to be in the same room as him when he was eating them.  Or get close to him afterwards for that matter.Luckily he went through them pretty fast, which I am grateful for because I was tempted to start giving them away so that I didn't have to deal with the smell anymore.

When it comes to treats, the big things for me are "Are they safe?" (read not made in China) and "Do my dogs like them?"  My dogs have never met a treat they don't like.  These are made in the USA (stamped prominently on the bag).  So yeah, why not?I don't give my dogs enough treats to worry an awful lot about nutritional value  They're treats.

reviewerName: K. Salinger, MSN, FNP, RN AHN-BC
reviewText: You may as well buy this over a drinkwell or the other plastic fountains for the price. However, the motor is VERY loud, and it becomes even louder as the water runs lower.Filling the reservoir is easy, and we've had no operational issues with it at all. The major downside is the noise and it gets a nasty film in the bowl and along the water line where the reservoir sits within the bowl.We've tried all of the other plastic variations of fountain water bowls at one time or another, and none are really any better than this one. However, one to absolutely avoid is the CatitCat It Fresh and Clear Small Drinking Fountain - Cat It 50053- if the power goes out they cannot get to the water, as it sits below the lip of where it flows when turned on (look at the picture to see what I mean).We're going to give a ceramic fountain bowl a try and see if it is any better, but if not this is the plastic version we'll likely return to.
summary: Super loud motor, but for the price works just as well as the more expensive plastic fountains

reviewText: I have purchased many different nylabones for my dogs over the years and I have never seen them go this wild over a nylabone!  They both are always fighting over who gets to have it!  I have a feeling its the wolf taste/scent of this bone that does it for them! Must have!
summary: My dogs love this so much!!!

reviewText: Does the job, has a nice removable tray for "accidents" - we haven't needed it.  We put a sleeping bag style bed inside and have adjusted the crate as the pup has grown, he loves it (he puts himself to bed when I stay up too late).  It is adjustable so there is no "extra room" when they are small to void - so it has helped immensely in potty training and he can now hold it through the night. It also breaks down to a briefcase sized box with a handle so we can take it with when we travel, camp, etc.  So far pretty good construction.

I'll start off by giving a description of my dog....Name: TheodoreBreed: Mutt (lab/chow mix)Age: 1.5 yearsSize: 70 lbsPersonality: very friendly, loves people WAY more than other dogs, and very crazy. He tends to have a very short attention span. He is quite smart, but if something is distracting him, he will completely tune me out. He works very well inside the house, but once I take him outside, anything can happen.I wanted to try this product to see if I could correct some very bad behaviors he has picked up. He is a jumper. It used to be OK when he was a puppy, but now he's 70 lbs and he will jump on small kids at the park. I'm afraid that his jumping habit is going to injure a child in the future, so I wanted to correct this ASAP. He also likes to sprint full speed when going to meet someone. He doesn't really deccelerate and one time, he even knocked down my GF by taking her legs out from under her and he messed up her knee pretty good (she is currently wearing a knee brace). Normally, I would hate to use a collar that administers any sort of pain. But in all reality, he is an animal, and I can't risk any more injuries to humans. We tried formal positive reinforcement training, which was good for him, but didn't seem to solve his high-energy and jumping problems. So those are my reasons for wanting to use this collar.All the being said... I only had to "correct" my dog once at level 3. He felt it and knew immediately that what he was doing at the time was wrong. Since that one time, I have not had to use the correction again. I was so surprised!! What I mainly like about this collar is that it helps me to get my dogs attention again in a distracting environment. He is a smart dog. He knows his commands, and he knows to listen to me. So once I have his attention, he is a very good boy. This collar helps me get his attention and I have the option to use the "correction" if I feel like he is putting a human at risk for injury (which has not happened since we started using this product). So I enjoy this product and I hope that I won't have to use it very much longer. He is already improving, and soon I won't be afraid to walk him off-leash :)

I have been feeding my kitties premium cat food all of their lives and have had one kitty who has experienced two urinary blockages (despite the good food).Kitty has been stable on the Royal Canins urinary s/o dietRoyal Canin Veterinary Diet Feline Urinary SO Moderate Calorie Dry Cat Food 3.3 lb bagbut I have found that the price has just increased so much and the ingredient list was nothing like what I have fed them in the past.  The RC has made my cats gain more weight ... I decided to explore the OTC Purina product - pro plan - and after researching I found that this seems like a good substitute for the dry part of their diet.  The royal Canins canned food just became a total turn off to the cats and they all avoid it and I have found that there is a lot of waste.  The main thing to get my cats to do is drink more water.  I keep many fresh water sources around the house and they seem to be drinking and urinating fine.This kibbles from the Pro Plan look almost identical to the royal Canins and the cats seem to tolerate it and eat it.  I'm saving about $25 a bag on this.  So far so good.
summary: Looked nearly identical to Royal Canins urinary s/o

reviewText: I love love love how my dog looks right after using this shampoo! He looks like a white teddy bear, maybe white wolf *because he has a wolfy face :)* My dog is usually really sensitive to most shampoos but with this one, he is struggle free! The soap doesn't give me teary eyes and no skin allergies. On top of that, we get countless compliments on how clean he looks. I am so happy with this product!

UPDATE:  They just raised the price another 3.00.  When are merchants going to learn that keeping the prices down lead to happier customers.  I will no longer be ordering the product and will go back to buying at Trader Joe's.  2.00 a can is as much as I pay...looks like greed is playing in on this...My dog is really, really picky (perhaps even spoiled)...we switched him from a dry food to wet food diet a little over a year ago when he was diagnosed with a chondrosarcoma in his mouth...since surgery, he's been put on mainly a FULL protein diet with as little carbs as possible...I do give him a bit of Wilderness or other high protein dry food as a crunch, but he's on wet food.This food has a great breakdown...essentially, add up the moisture, protein, fat, etc...and what is left over is carbohydrate...your dog is not an herbivore...he's a carivore.Feed your dog as much protein as possible and he'll be healthier...cancers feed on carbs...trust me, after researching this endlessly, I figured out what a dog needs best...This food is chunky, not ground up mush....you dog will like it...enjoy!

This was a nice change for my shih tzu and poodle! They were getting tired of the plain Milk Bone biscuits they were snacking on.Besides being tasty, these are better for them too.These treats were fresh, the right size, and easy to open and close package.When they hear me opening this, they come running!Shipped quickly and securely.

I got this for my friends dog (I don't know much about dogs). I always thought a treat is a treat, but apparently, her dog has high standards. We went over for the weekend, and I brought them. She warned me of her dogs narrow tastes and was fairly certain that Tobi would not like it. Well, to her surprise, she was wrong. Tobi ate the treat and wanted another. The weekend was a success, and my friend now has a new treat to offer her dog. This was pretty hard and I wonder how good it would be for a small or small/medium sized dogs teeth. I suppose the hardness helps to remove the plaque. I suspect it would take more than a weekend to evaluate how well it cleans, and I'm sure that you still will have to take your dog for cleanings, though I don't know the frequency. I would guess this would give you a little more time in between cleanings. I think the most important thing is that a dog with picky tastes enjoyed it and also did not get sick from it. Just getting back to the hardness, it is not really harder than some of the other chew toys I have seen other dogs eat, e.g. bones, etc. Lastly, for the price, it seems like a good value. You get a lot of biscuits....and I suspect this 24 ounce box will last a while.
Awesome shampoo.  Wonderful smell, uses less that other brands and seems to moisturize the dogs scalps where the shampoo takes some away.
This is great for keeping pet food fresh and it looks nice and neat back in the pantry.  Good choice with free shipping.
summary: This keeps our cat food nice and fresh

reviewText: easy on the stomach. dog loves them. only treats she gets with her allergies! all of her doggie friends love them too.
I really like this comb for combing out the dog before the bath. Being made of stainless steel, it has the strength needed. Being both fine and coarse, it really does preform.
Wonderful ingredients list but the peas are whole. If I don't mush them several of my cats just eat around them.The cats & I all prefer the regular Felidae formula and it's a little cheaper, too.
The doggies look forward to these treats, crunchy and healthy. But i am not convinced they really make the dogs relax or calmer, but they are yummy (according to the furries)!
summary: Not sure it makes the dogs chill, but they love the treats.

reviewText: many said it had an odor and when it came out of box had a slight odor but 2 days I aired it out and no more odors as for how it works it does a great job I have 2 rotie/kelpe mix puppies and it keeps my seat safe and clean abd its waterproof I rate it 5 starts

This food appears attractive and healthy when poured into a bowl - it looks like chunks of dried meat among veggie-rich kibbles. My dog very happily scarfed it down.I, unfortunately, read the ingredient list. It is extremely soy and corn heavy (both almost guaranteed to be GM), and includes nasty items like poultry by-product meal and animal digest. Whatever those chunks are, they are in no way related to real meat.As much as my dog loved this, I will not be making it part of his regular diet - it's just not real food.
summary: Dog Loved It; I Couldn't Love the Ingredient List

reviewText: My Golden Retr. nudges my leg towards the "Greenies" Box. Only wish these puppies weren't so expensive! But, when it comes to the dog, seems like nothing is expensive when they enjoy it so much.
My dogs love these jerky treats. They are all natural. I have had no problems with choking. The only problem I've had is running out.

I have purchased many a great product from this Seller,this was no exception.  Got on sale so bought even though not needed. Picked up and took to a friend with a semi-feral cat with mats the size of tennis balls.  Took a while but the sound was very low so as not to scare the cat and did not heat up like my really old Wahl one.  Highly recommend.!  Worked so well my friend wants one too.
Okay Pads
I was disappointed with the clippers because they get hot quickly and I have to stop frequently to let them cool down.  Other than that they are quiet and work well.

Just made a mistake and gave a review of this for the thermometer, oops.This is a well designed unit that both raises the temperature in my Fluval 5 gallon aquarium and fits perfectly in the pump section so I can see my fish and not a heater.
This has wonderful clumping ability, better than any other brand I have tried, and for that reason I will buy this again and do recommend it. However, it doesn't do much for odor control.
summary: Clumps super well but doesn't eliminate odor

reviewText: Light in an aquarium creates not just a beautiful environment, but also permits a healthy ecosystem for fish and plants.The benefit of using LED lighting is that it does not generate the heat of an incandescent bulb and some compact fluorescent bulbs, so temperature fluctuations are avoided, and it is energy efficient to keep operating costs low. And, as is the case here, LED permits a variety of stunning effects ranging from sunlight to sundown to moonlight.Unobtrusive in appearance with its low profile (under a half an inch,) this unit emits a full spectrum of light required for my fresh water aquarium. Programming of the device is straightforward but if planning to keep it unplugged when not in use, note it will not retain the programming so the step will need to be repeated. For me keeping the light plugged into a power source is not an issue, but this will vary depending upon the user.Nothing about the light fixture looks or feels inexpensive. It is clearly a high quality piece of equipment. When initially plugged in it automatically cycles through all of the built-in light effects. In essence, it is a mini-light show that allows the user to quickly evaluate all aspects of the light’s potential. It was breathtaking and I remain impressed.
summary: Aquatic Life LED 24 inch Aquarium Light

reviewText: 7 of my 12 cats began vomiting while on this food.  None of these cats have sensitive stomachs.  They have never vomited on any other food.  I took them off of the food and the vomiting stopped. Thinking that maybe, just maybe, it was something else making them sick, I put them back on the food, gradually.  The vomiting resumed.  I cannot recommend this food.

awesome product, good shipping time, item arrived in new condition. only down side is the price. at my local pet store cricket food products are generally $5-$6 max and this one including shipping ran me approximately $8. not a huge deal considering how much my crickets love it, but the price could improve a little. lower price would equal a 5 star review

While my 6 mo old GSD didn't destroy this one as badly as the other it too has had some nibbling done to it. Again wish it came in black. I had wanted something to leave in with her overnight, she wants to get up at 4am to play and was hoping this would keep her busy.
summary: good toy not for strong chewer

reviewText: When we got a new puppy we really didn't want to go the puppy pad training way, but he was sick the first week and we had no other choice but to let him use the pads.  I tried 3 brands and the Out! brand seems to be the best.  I hate the fact that the puppy is associating white squares on the floor with acceptable places to relieve himself, because I have some awesome white throw rugs in my bedroom (which is off-limits, but he got in there once, and it wasn't good.)Hopefully this stage won't last long but these pads come in handy.  He only uses a pad once and then he's done - wants a clean one.  It's basically a waste of money.  A tip most everyone knows is to clean the floor real well under the pad after he's soiled it, and it has been removed, so he doesn't smell his odor on the spot anymore.I also recommend a puppy training manual.  We are using one from Cesar Milan, the dog whisperer, and it's helping a lot.

I don’t know who dislikes claw clipping more – me or my cats. This clipper doesn't do anything to make the cats like the process more, but it certainly helps me get through it.These are large clippers and are designed mainly for medium to large size dogs. But, if used carefully, they do a great job on cats. The advantage of using a larger size clipper is for those of us with older hands – large clippers are easier to grip and they require less force to get through the nail.The overall build quality is very good. They feel solid, and the handles are ergonomically shaped to permit a good, solid grip without any slippage or hand pain. The cutters are sharp and have no problems getting through a nail.The cutters have a stopper to avoid cutting into the quick of the nail. The stopper would work fine with a large nail, but for cats, the stopper is ineffective. That’s not a problem, since my old clippers (which were small-sized for cats) had a stopper which I never used. I prefer to just pay attention to where the quick is, and avoid it since it can vary from nail-to-nail.It includes a small nail file which is stored right in the handle, and can be pulled out when needed. It’s too coarse for a small cat nail, but for large dog nails I expect it would be useful.The handles have a locking button to keep the jaws closed in storage.No complaints about this at all. (The cats, however, probably would raise a number of complaints regarding any type of grooming product.) Well worth considering if you’re looking for an easy-to-use, comfortable set of clippers.[Sample provided for review]
summary: Designed for large dogs, but can be used for cats as well

reviewText: I always buy the durachew products for our dog and am very happy with them.  They hold up well for a powerful chewer.  This one was rather small and should not have been labeled "wolf".

I purchased this item because I was going on a short trip and needed a second carrier so I could drop both cats off at day care. I have two cats, one is about 10 lb and the other is about 8 lb with a small frame. The bigger kitty couldn't fit into this comfortably and the smaller kitty just barely made it in. If you have a regular sized cat, I would recommend looking for a different carrier because they will most likely not fit. I used the shoulder strap but it didn't feel very sturdy, so I probably wouldn't use it again. When I was leaving the kitty day care center after picking up my cats, the one in this carrier managed to pop his head out of a zipper that hadn't been snapped shut. (I think it was overlooked because we had a hard time getting the kitty back into the carrier) If you get this carrier, make sure all of the buckles on the zippers are closed when using it. It doesn't look like it but they can really easily move the zippers around and escape so it's definitely necessary to use the snaps!
My cat loves it, he wont eat anything but this particular brand. I ordered a bag of another brand but he wouldn't eat it, so ill stick to this one.

I ordered this harness for my new 1lb 3 ozs Chihuahua puppy.  It fits her really well and the way the velcro is positioned allows her room to grow.  She is adorable in it.  The reason for only 4 stars is because the piece on the back where the d-ring is attached is sewn on a little at an angle and not completely straight but that doesn't affect the way it fits.  I also got it a day before the estimated delivery.  For the money and the way she looks in it, it is worth it.UPDATE: I ordered the yellow one also and it is adorable.  The only thing wrong with it is one of the points on the collar is a bit longer than the other one, but probably no one will notice it but me.  My little Chi girl is sooooo cute in it.  I like them both.

My little dogs do not like having their nails clipped. These are very sharp and work extremely well. They just move better then other clippers and my little chug doesn't shake anymore when the clippers come out. I used on my cat as well, total success. Not sure what makes them different but they clip with grace and are very sharp so there is no time for my pets to flinch, its over in a second. Very impressed!!

I have small dog and these Greenies are the perfect size for her.  She is a super picky eater, but she really enjoys chewing on them and I hope over time they improve her breath. Some days it could knock you over :-) I know all the chewing will be good for her gums.

I got the largest one, even though my dog is under 50 pounds. It's big enough for her and her food.  Latch on bottom is a bit harder to use than one on the top... maybe it doesn't align perfectly.  Still does the job.

I love this KONG toy!  My shepherd is very smart and needs to stay busy.  This is a great way to entertain her and also to improve her problem-solving skills.  I love watching her as she bats it around, nudges it with her nose, carrys it across the room and even growls at it (maybe she thinks she can scare the treats out!).  She has a great time with it.If you want to put food/treats in the large-size KONG and not have any spill out of the hole when you initially set it down then follow the instructions and limit it to only 1-cup of food/treats.  There is technically room for more than one cup.  I should also note that the hole is different (smaller) than that in the majority of the pictures in the product description.  It is now just a circle, not the "kong" shape in the first set of pictures.  It is possible that the manufacturer has addressed the issue of the hole's size and made it smaller as a result of customer concerns.  Since it IS a toy with the intended purpose of having the treats come out of the hole, that shouldn't be a problem either way.  :)The entire base of the KONG is weighted and solid.  The top part is hollow.  This KONG can be tightened a great deal so you shouldn't have a worry about it coming apart.  Just use the correct size for your dog and you'll be fine.Grab this KONG, fill it with treats and then sit back and prepare to be entertained!I hope you found this helpful. If I can answer any other questions, please feel free to ask in the comment section. I will reply as quickly as possible.
summary: Entertainment, problem-solving and treats in one great KONG package!

reviewText: I have a 24 pound cocker spaniel. In most books, she qualifies as medium. I also have a 13 pound Siberian cat, which is usually listed as a large breed cat.These clippers are marked on the package for medium and large breeds, with photos of a dog and cat together. Judging by the looks of the clippers, they are better suited to the thick nails of my dog than my cat. I didn't realize that my dog keeps her nails pretty short. I don't ever cut them, so I thought they'd be longer but they look totally trimmed. I tried the nail clippers out instead on my cat.I was afraid I would accidentally cut something other than her nails (the nail cutter is big and unwieldy for such small paws). I didn't use the guide, since it was about 3/16 inches deep, and her nails didn't need to be cut that short. All went well, but for cats, I prefer the smaller cat nail clipper I already own.This is one heavy duty, well-built nail clippers. It has a safety latch, keeping it closed when not in use, and rubberized handles for a good grip. I like the guide, which my cat nail clipper also has, and there's a nail file stored inside the handle. For a medium or large dog with long nails, these clippers would be useful. For cats, even large cats, it's too big.This product was provided for review by Pet Magasin._______________UPDATE 4/29/14: While looking at my dog's paws, I noticed one exceptionally long nail. These clippers cut her thick nail with ease. They are very heavy duty.

My dog usually only eats Science Diet, but she made an exception for Chef Michael's Oven Roasted Chicken dry food. It is somewhat of a cross between typically hard kibble and soft canned food. The chicken looks like little pieces of chicken, with peas and "carrots," although the carrots are not a true orange color, but more of a tan.It is not as good as Science Diet when it comes to ingredients, but the dog does love it. Of course, my dog would eat a sock if it smelled like fish oil! I am not too concerned about ingredients though, as this will merely be a treat when it goes on sale.I recommend it for shoppers who have dogs without health issues that require special food.

Both my cats and dog eat Taste of the Wild food. They all love it and it keeps them nice and healthy! It is so nutrient dense that even though it is more expensive than a lot of foods they need to eat much less of it. I have never had a single problem with food allergies or any tummy troubles from any of my pets while using this food. I do give my cats a can of wet food daily as well for extra moisture in their diets for urinary tract health.

I used these bio rings in my 75 gallon bow front tank with a Fluval FX5 filter. These rings do not need a bag because they are large enough to just set in my filter baskets. Fast shipping and nothing to complain about

I bought three of these to replace the 22" bulbs in my nova light strips. The first two were just fine, but I wish these were a bit brighter. These tend to be more on the yellow side of the color spectrum. The third bulb I tried fizziled out as soon as I installed and turned on. Dud. Trouble shooted by shifting bulbs around and checking, definately the new bulb is dead.My 10k bulbs are very bright and crisp, making the colors on the fish brilliant. This bulb is not as impressive.

Come my chinchilla's bath time, I cannot imagine it without using this superior product as most chin insiders will state.  It is very soft, very fine and chinchillas love it.And it is safe.  Many dusts sold for chinchillas are not.  They are scented (not natural for a chin) and simply made of outdoor sand.  The best chin dusts are made of ground pumice stone.This particular chin dust comes highly recommended by long-time chin owners like myself who have been caring for these delightful crepuscular rodents coming on 18 years now.  My chin, Danny Boy, loves it (see my Profile for a glimpse of him) and has a marvelous time rolling around in it.  Inside a good plastic chin bath house, it doesn't fly around everywhere, and it is easy to maintain and store.I cannot imagine using any other chinchilla dust.  In fact, it will never happen!
summary: The Supreme Chin Dust for a Pet Chinchilla

reviewText: This vest is very well made and the medium size fit my 25 lb beagle perfectly. The handles on top worked wonders, I was surprised at the number of times I ended up using them, my dog is not very fond of the water so she kept trying to swim to shore. I could literally lift her up safely using the handles, they are awesome! This is a must if taking your pup into the water for long periods of time. This vest is also very light and not bulky at all.

I feel good using this food. My schnauzer was having minor food allergies and I had trouble finding food without grains and by-products  The price was good and even better with the auto order and free shipping.  I live in a rural area that doesn't carry Paul Newman foods so door to door delivery was great.  Will use it again.

My dogs love these. I have a long hair chihuahua and a sheltie mix. Both dogs ran up and grabbed these things from me as soon as I opened the package. They smell good (treats not the dogs) and once the dogs ate them it did help the breath situation a bit.A good value, a good treat. I say get it.
summary: Dogs love them, breath smells better

reviewText: My Syrian Golden hamster loves these things. He eats them so neatly, pulling off one kernel at a time. It's fun to watch him. I have yet to pop the corn. I'll try it and see what Ted E. thinks about it. I'm sure he'll approve. LOL

Ordered after reading great reviews and unfortunately, no great success with my catnip loving feline.  He normally loves anything new, especially with catnip, but had a luke warm reaction comparable to showing him an old sock. As others mentioned - no way to refill the pillow, and there was absolutely NO reaction from a cat who loves anything with catnip. I got a perplexed stare and the 'what's this for' meow. Perhaps ours was old stock? I could feel the catnip pack inside it. When not in use, I keep it in a ziplock with catnip, but that re-introduces the messiness factor. I will say that the pillow is very amply sized and the fabric is durable and bright (we got the tiger) - nice firmness and enough give. 'We' found better use for it - Moxley loves it as a pillow and it fits neatly inside one of his bigger 'bed' boxes.  He uses it as an elbow rest while watching TV (yes, it's true) and then uses as a pillow. So, even though the original use was a bust, it's been well loved as his bedroom accessory and worth the cost w/prime shipping. I'd give it a 4 if catnip worked and a 5 if refillable.
summary: Great concept but we use it as a elbow rest....

reviewText: I'd like it smaller which is my problem not realizing it would be large for a little dog.  It works though.  I have a Teddy Bear Shichon.
summary: Bigger than I thought it would be

reviewText: UPDATE:  I went back to using a battery operated litter box as the tabs on this box eventually broke. Cat litter would spill on the floor meaning more work for me.  I will admit it took about 18 months for the litter box to become unusable.Several years ago we purchased an automated self-cleaning litter box. It worked OK, and the cats would use it, but it was ugly. The cats did not like the tent cover so the litter box was left open for all to view.Another problem with the self-cleaning automated litter box was the cost and difficulty of finding the plastic collection containers. Finally, the box had to be plugged into an outlet or run off a battery.The Omega litter box solved all those problems. The box is self-contained and the unsightly litter box is covered. The box contains a reusable pull-out tray. Finally, the box is human powered when it comes to cleaning the litter box. No batteries are required for this task.To use:  Fill the box with a clumping litter. Attach the top. Make sure the tray is inserted.Daily roll the box towards the tray. Remove the tray and toss the soiled litter into a container. Refill the box with clean litter as needed.Tip: Keep a plastic bag or storage container near the box. Each day empty the tray into the bag/container. I use old plastic grocery bags for this purpose. At the end of the week seal the bag and throw in the trash.Tip: Be sure the tab closures are fully locked in place otherwise the box lid will fall off and the litter will dump onto the floor. The tabs should be a bit sturdier but they are not. It is about the only negative thing that I can write about this litter box design.Updated Aug 8: Am very frustrated with the poor quality tab closures. They tend to pop from their connections thereby dumping kitty litter on the floor. I absolutely love this litter box design except for the tab closures. More work needs to be done to improve their quality.

I bought these because I was looking for JUMBO Sparkle Puffballs to replace the ones we had before.  "These sparkle balls are over 2 inches in Diameter" is very misleading.  I was expecting something about the size of a golf ball, but these are half that size.  I measured them with a micrometer, and they are barely 1 inch in diameter.  They are so small I'm afraid my cat will eat them.  The seller graciously allowed me to return them, but argued with me about the sizing.  You can't argue with a micrometer.  Oh well, the search continues for true Jumbo Sparkle Balls.PS.  Do not buy these from  Knockout Dealz Pet Supplies.  He is very rude in his emails, uses inappropriate language, and is abusive in his responses!

This is probably the fifth or sixth Mike that I've bought over the years. I have a pit bull who loves to chew and tug. The previous ones never fell apart, now matter how much she chewed on it. I had to take this last one away because little pieces were breaking off at the ends where she would bite into it to try to get the treat out. I'm pretty sure KONG has only been the manufacturer of this toy for a few years. Maybe quality has gone down since they took over. Whatever the reason, I will no longer be buying this particular toy for her.

My 45-lb doggy dog loves to tug of war with this, loves to chew this, loves to proudly carry it around.  I love that it's been durable, that she likes it and that it's easy to throw in the top rack of the dishwasher to keep clean.  A win.
summary: I love that it's been durable

reviewText: This was a perfect size for my weiner dog.  The squeekers folded in on themselves in a few days to where they no longer squeek.

Purchased this because my husband would empty the litter box every night outside. He didn't like scooping it out. So I purchased this, set it right near the litter box in my bathroom and I can just scoop it out quick every morning and night and throw it right into the Litter Champ. I am very pleased that it lasted a whole month before we disposed of the first bag. We only have one cat however. My only with is that it was a bit taller and that the inner door opened automatically also.  But I do love it and so does my husband.  Also, hubby said it was very simple to change the bag.
Two Yorkies fit nicely (more than enough room).It's their "go to" location when we're not at home.  Can't tell if the self warming feature actually works, but they enjoy sleeping in it.

This is a great product you can use whether your dog is sick or not. It must taste great they eat it with no problems. My only suggestion is that you do give some to your pet off & on just so they remember they like it. That way when they are sick they will still accept eating it.

This is the first rope toy for my lab/ridgeback mix. He doesn't play with it a ton, but if I get it out and try to tug with him, he does. We leave it in his crate during the day so he has something to play with. It is not yet destroyed after 2 months, so that is a definite plus.  And the price is right!  I'd buy another one.
Does the job. But I'm not in love with the product. I preferred the Petscan eltric toothbrush. Although this toothbrush may be better made in some ways.
summary: But I'm not in love with the product

reviewText: Now there is no reason for my cat to ever have a dirty litter box.  Pair it with the CatIt Hooded Litter Box and you have the easiest litter disposal system.  I LOVE it.  We've had ours for almost a year and still haven't needed to change the bag cartridge.  We use to have the Litter Genie, what a waste of money!  Lucky Champ is the best bang for your buck.  Ours doesn't have the magnet, it has a hook on the side for the scoop which I like more.  I love it, especially when our cat became sick and had diarrhea, so easy to keep it clean for him and keep my house odor free.  No smells at all.  I cannot recommend this product enough!
I use them to keep my dogs teeth clean and for teaching tricks. Chop them up in little bits for after trick rewards.
They get 2 or 3 every night at bedtime - it signals them when it's time to settle down and sleep. I ran out once and tried to substitute something else. We didn't sleep very well that night.

The cats didn't really play with it. The rubber section at the bottom didn't quite fit it/attach to it properly right from the start, but when my husband tripped over it one day the center column snapped. It wasn't even a hard trip, there really was no excuse for this item to break that quickly over such little force. Poorly made.
summary: Cats barely touched it, then it broke

reviewText: I purchase this twice a month for my 2 cats. They love it in combination to their hard cat food. Its a cheap decent food I would recommend.

it worked for awhile, but strangely tends to get holes when folded the plastic cracks or something, and gel leaks out, rendering it useless. Outdoor blue duct tape patches the holes for a while, unless the goo leaks out and it pops off. :{ disappointed. bulldogs really need this in summer.

Loved the idea of this and so did spouse but the actual use of the product leaves a lot to be desired. Frankly, it's purely a practice in poor design.For example, as a female user, the belt loop is absurd. I don't own a belt of that size nor is the size of this organizer able to be properly positioned on any belt that I do own...or even my waste. It's just too big. Also, I rarely use a belt so there goes the entire hands-free portion.On the other hand, it would fit an average sized mens belt BUT, it won't fit their hands. My spouse had no trouble fitting this on the belt look but literally found the fit for hands/other cumbersome due to the small sized compartments etc...So, setting aside the fit issues for a moment, this also is of little value for anything other than a small...very small...dog. I'll leave it at that. My dogs are big...they tug at times, tend to pull here or there, their treats are bigs, their doggy bags are big and the rest is big. This organizer won't stand up to pulling or normal "dog behavior" especially for bigger dogs...as for the rest, forget it.Last but not least, it doesn't feel all that well made and tends to slide around.Bottom line - great idea, something that is much needed but very poor design limits the usefulness of this product.

My cat and I have had a lot of fun with these so far. I am sure I'll get more in the future where I have stepped on them and they've started to crack.  They are not the biggest item, so the trouble is where did kitty hide them now?
summary: Fun for you and your cat

reviewText: This litter works exactly like its title - it clumps and seals, perfectly. There are no crumbles, no breaking apart, no gunky/pasty spots on the bottom. Scent control is great.
