The only exception to the scent control is that one of our cats does not cover her #2, so when she uses the box, it does smell some. I have 3 cats and 3 litter boxes. The only time I notice any bad smells is when that one cat uses it, since she doesn't cover it.I can keep scooping the litter box until there is basically no litter left in there. There is much less wasted litter and a box of this lasts a long time, since you are able to completely scoop out all of the "used" litter.I like the scent and the cats do not seem to mind it at all. I don't think it is a strong scent either. You can smell it a little when you pour it in the litter box, but after that I do not smell it at all.There is NO dust at all and very minimal tracking.I have a septic system and I scoop this and flush it. I haven't had any issues so far with clogging or backing up in the system.It is priced the same as any other clumping litter but definitely works better. You can download a coupon on the Clump & Seal website too, for even more savings.I have also used the multicat version of this and it works just as well. It seems the only difference is the scent and the strength of the scent. The multicat version has a little more of a stronger scent, but again you only smell it the first time you pour it in the litter box and after that you don't smell it. I have seen some reviews that say you can smell the perfume in the litter all over the house and that seems a little crazy to me, unless perhaps you have a really extra super powered nose. I have a litter box in one of our smaller bathrooms and you cant even smell it n that small area. I cannot imagine being able to smell it throughout the house or anywhere really. Even when scooping it, you can barely smell it.I will continue to buy this brand regularly because it really lives up to its claims and does exactly what it says it will.

This is a sturdy, good quality crate.  I made the mistake of ordering a size too big, though.  I ordered the 36" thinking the 30" would be slightly too small for my medium sized dog.  I have a mixed breed, who stands 19" tall at the withers.  He's about the size of an average border collie.  He didn't need a crate this big.  The 36" is a good size for a lab or golden.  I probably should have gotten the 30", because both my dogs fit in this one comfortably (so I guess I could bring only one crate.)The crate has a very sturdy frame with thick bars.  A dog would not be able to collapse it or roll it like dogs can with flimsy pop up crates.  As an added security feature, there are tabs for you to stake it into the ground if you're outside, so the dog definitely can't go anywhere.  In addition, there's a zipper lock, which is a hook you clip onto the zipper pulls when it's closed so the dog can't manage to pull it open and escape.  This is a relief to me, since I bought this for my dog to take to outdoor agility trials, and he's quite the escape artist.  I tried leaving them in a pop up playpen, but the floor velcros on, and it took them about 2 seconds to figure out how to escape.  So, that was useless.  This crate seems like a much better purchase.
summary: Sturdy, had lots of security features

reviewText: Thought this was the answer to the big X shaped scratcher that broke but the cats still prefer the broken one.  They sleep in their paper bowls (Petstages Snuggle Scratch and Rest) and don't consider this big enough for naps.  I have one each 11 and 13 1/2 pounder boys and they'll lay across this one and use it for their paws once and awhile but otherwise, it just sits there.  Can't find the blue tickler though - they love that thing!  It comes right out no matter where you stick it in or how far and they have it out playing with the feathers.

My cats love to play - two Burmese - but I think they are too smart for their own good.  After a few sessions of play they now know the red light comes from the thing in my hand.  So now they go after my hand......LOL

My dogs love this as far as a ball goes...but the maze part isn't as great as I had hoped.  The food falls out pretty darn easy and doesn't really provide a long-lasting challenge.  Still they do love to play with it as much as their big red ball from Kong and it's a bit cheaper for the size.

To those who are unsatisfied with the product because your dog doesn't get it -- IT TAKES TIME TO TRAIN! As far as the product itself, I have had it for a couple of months and it has not fallen apart (I have it hung on my backdoor and is constantly moved and touched several times a day). My 4 month old puppy got a hang after about a month of training, and now she's starting to use it on her own to let me know she needs to go out. It's cute, does not get in the way of the door when the door opens, and the bells are loud enough for me to hear from the second floor. Good product.

I have a scaredy cat that won't get into the bath and the only way I can give her a thorough wash is if I gently scoop water over her... And still she would moan. THIS stuff saves my life. A foam means that your cat won't really "get wet" in the traditional sense, and by the time she realizes she's soaked it's too late and the "bath" is over. I use this every week for my indoor cat and give her a "wet" wash every month. The only downside is that this smells kind of medicinal and like an old person - but its so much better than stinky. Doesn't have weird effects on her medium-long coat either. Shake before use or it may be watery!
summary: Live savior for cats that hate water... Or all cats

reviewText: My Labradoodle love this toy. It's large enough to he can't swallow it and he hasn't destroy any part of it yet.  Seems to be made well.** UPDATE - 5/2012 **My doddle destroyed the ball via light chewing.
summary: Great dog toy for fetching, not for chewing

reviewText: Been through many it my day...this one is large enough, strong enough and nice looking.  The spaces are perfect too.
I love this scoop - it's like a shovel!  It's much larger than your average scoop.  I use it first pass, then another smaller one to get around the corners because I have an oval shaped litter box.

I have two 12 year old labs. One with hip problems for several years, one in the early stages. The one was on Petco brand stage 2. I went to stage 3 and the pain seemed to increase (the second dog refused to eat the pill at all). I bought this on recommendations from others.  Both dogs now look forward to the pills. I am giving them one each in the morning and at bed time. They obviously feel much better and have begun jumping and playing with each other again. They haven't done this in a long time.  As pain increases, I can up the dosage without going to another product. This order was about $75 and will last 2 months (60 pills/treats per month per dog). Amazon offers this from several different venders so make sure you price compare before buying. Same product but prices varied.  Also, make sure you close the bag every time. These are moist cakes and will probably dry quickly if left open.

I started a young dog with no hip socket on these chews when I inherited her.  She was on an anti-inflamatory and scheduled for hip replacement surgery.  I held off on the surgery and fed her the chews.  Lo and behold, my dog went from non-weight bearing to running on her hip.  I weaned her off of the anti-inflamatory and have been a convert to using the chews ever since.  This product is fabulous and the dogs love it.  Sometimes the chews are harder than at other times, but the dogs eat them as a treat and so they don't really care.  Something the dogs love to eat--AND--it's good for them.  I have every dog in my house on these chews from puppyhood.

This is perfect for my two kittys, the only thing is that I wish the front was a little higher so that the litter wont spill out, which is partly my fault because I really fill it up, my kittys really like to dig alot, I even bought the canopy, looks so cute!

Initially I mixed this with their regular poultry flavored toothpaste, but amazingly I quickly found my dogs didn't object to the peppermint flavor at all.  It's very easy to dispense a small dab of the gel in the palm of your hand and then use your finger to rub a bit on your dogs back teeth. I just started using this gel recently in an effort to maintain the results of a recent cleaning which was no fun at all for my boys!

For my two boys!  Neither of them are really into these balls yet even though I ordered the extreme chewers because they have chewed up several other balls that were for tough chewers.  These may be just a little bit too big for them to pick up comfortably.  My Peekapoo puppy has a really small mouth.  My ShiPom has a larger mouth but this ball is heavy and he just doesn't have an interest yet.  Not to say they won't become a favorite in the future and I will update when they do, but for now, they sit around.  I'm giving it three stars for the product, because it is a great product!  It lost two stars from the shear weight of the ball.  They are heavy.
Went crazy trying to find and air tight dog food container for my Border Collie. This one fits the bill perfectly. Locks up super tight and keeps the freshness inside.
This is a warm, thick hoodie that looks cute because it looksjust like a human hoodie.  Keeps my dog warm.

I ordered this product a few months ago.  The first one that was sent to me had a huge crack down the container.  Amazon was very easy to work with for a return/exchange.  Even going as far as scheduling a pickup of the one that needed to be sent back!  When the second container was shipped to me, the plastic clasp that holds the lid to the container was broken, actually, it looked like it was never meant to fit on the container in the first place.  Being that I really needed a container for my dog's food, I opted NOT to send it back for a second time and hope that the third one would actually be in complete, working order.  The container does hold about a 30-lb bag of Blue Weight Control dog food and the wheels make it extremely convenient.  Overall I am satisfied with the container, even though it is not "as described."  I am, however, completely satisfied with Amazon's customer service.
summary: Third Time Might Have Been A Charm

reviewText: I have used this for a couple months now with no problem. Since some reviews mention a problem with the temperature i monitor carefully and have had no problem. i have a 100 gal tank and have been using this along with another heater that has a digital readout just to play it safe but so far so good.
I bought the medium for my french bulldog and it fits him perfect. The price is great. I only use one door, and never used the "life stages," but as a normal, everyday kennel, it does it's job!
19 days later and still no cat litter. Petco, I think you may be biting off a bit more than you can chew. This product itself is great, but is it worth waiting 20 days for?

Great color, though the velvet gets dirty pretty quickly. It works very well. When my 58lb husky mix sees a squirrel he wants to chase, there's no way I could hold him back with a leash and collar without him either slipping the collar or choking himself. The harness allows me to control him.

EXPERIENCE TO DATE:  After 1 year, highly recommendedPROS:Excellent value.  Really.  I couldn't believe I was paying this for a dog bowl, and still had on-going cost of filters.  After a year, I can say it was well worth it.  If something happens to this one, I will buy another.Very easy to keep clean, and great improvement over the perpetually slimy, and quickly empty, standard water bowl.Definitely not a "display piece", but much rather see this than watch the dogs drink from the toilet, which they tried to do before having their own "running water".Dogs gravitate - I keep it in back part of the house for "aesthetic" reasons, but visiting dogs go right to it and drink w no concerns.SUGGESTIONS FOR USE or INSTALLATION:  I occasionally throw a couple of ice cubes on top - part melts, making water slightly cooler, before the dog fishes them out, a bit of a game for them.  I plan to add a timer so that it cycles off occasionally through the night.  Hopefully will save electricity, keep from overheating, and reduce use of filter.  I occasionally turn it off manually from time to time for short periods, which so far worked to allow the plug to cool without any negative impact.CONS:  I do have the following concerns.a) The plug is perpetually hot.  If it does run out of water, it continues to run and gets very hot, not smoking or a burn risk, but a bit of a concern.  An 'auto off' would be nice, but had this feature been added at an added cost, I doubt I would have tried it.b) Had one instance where the carbon from the filter wound up in the drinking water, probably because it was reused longer than recommended.  Fortunately dog let me know right away, suddenly back to the toilets...
summary: Very highly recommended.  Dogs and owner love it.

reviewText: This seems to work only one accident since cat is wearing this

I have two Maine Coon cats, so de-shedding is important!.  This is the only tool I have ever tried that REALLY works and the cats at times are indifferent to it and at times seem to really enjoy it, but they have never tried to escape while I am using it.

Ordered some of these Kong stuffed toys for my Dobie, who is a pretty tough chewer.  She loves stuffed toys, but the other brands seem to come apart very quickly without her even chewing, she just carries them around like babies.  She has had these for 2 weeks now and they are still completely intact!  I consider that a good toy!

This toy is a giant. My two pug puppies have had a lot of fun and the poor snake it still squeaking! The one part they did tear still did not rip into the inner part where one of the giant squeakers are. The squeakers are securely held in there and the squeakers are the size of fist - each one in each segment. I highly recommend this.

I have used this product consistently for all of my goldfish.This product helps keep my fish tank clean and easier to maintain.I highly recomend this product. Is better is used with the other one like that.
I wrote a pretty lengthy review for this item when I ordered them before.  Long story short, I love them! Obviously I do because this is my re-order.

Both my cats were very interested in this Castor & Pollux dry food.  The small size of the kibble seems better for both the 9 year old and the 15 month old.  They knew right away that they were going to like it because of its smell.  The older cat asks for more meals than with his previous canned food.  I serve it with enough water to moisten it and they have a water fountain.What is uncertain, and the reason that I haven't given it 5 stars YET, is how it will be digested.  I will add information as their ability to handle it is certain.  So far, so good.
My Mini Dachshund didn't like these but loves lil jacs liver treats. However I don't think this is a bad product, just my buddies' taste preference. Oh well :(
This is what all my dogs smell like and I can't get enough of them! It is great as an inbetween bath freshener and lasts for days, pair with the shampoo and you will be in heaven.

Nice big box of timothy hay.  My two pigs eat it like candy.  They like it much better than the local store small package stuff.  It's a great deal, and if my piggies happy with it, so am I.  Recommended.

i have tried many different items to clean my poodles teeth, brush finer brushes liquid to put in water to help keep plaque from building up ,i tried the white finger brush which is long enough to reach bk teeth also,along with the flavored tooth paste and it has help alot. no more bad breath,and cosltly cleanning which only lasted a few months,and the worrying of the the effects of surgery.try it it will help.

I have two medium-sized dogs (beagle-ish, mixes) and I've experimented with all sorts of products to contain them safely over the years. I've had the metal barrier which I quickly stopped using because it put pressure on the car's headliner, which could result in costly replacement costs over time. I tried a variety of "seat belt harnesses" with no luck for various reasons ranging from chewing through the seat belt to getting tangled. I had been using a seat divider, which worked ok, but if you had to stop fast, a standing pup would end up on the floor. In an accident, well...I'm glad that never happened.But now I have this Pet Tube Car Kennel, and it is AWESOME. My dogs both fit nicely in this thing, and it encourages them to lie down (which is great in-and-of-itself!). They can still see, and the mesh at the top will allow me to keep the rear windows rolled down in nicer weather. The product installs in just a few minutes and is very secure when fixed to three headrests. I throw a blanket in there with them, zip them in, and I don't have to worry about them until we reach our destination. An added benefit is that I no longer have to worry about my younger pup springing out of the vehicle when we get to where we're going. I can open the door fully, get in front of the door, and have his leash in-hand while he's still in the car.I highly, highly recommend this to anyone.  In fact, after seeing mine, my father-in-law quickly purchased one for his dogs, and he also loves it.

I have a Bissell Spotbot Pet Deep Cleaner, which is fantastic.  However, there are times when I am looking to clean just a small area and don't want to have to pull out the Spotbot, fill it, etc.I have found that the Pre-Treat works great by itself to remove some spots.  It works great as intended (pre-treating), but I've used it to remove small pet food stains on rugs and it works great.  It smells pleasant as well.For pre-treating, I've used it and its removed stains like pet vomit or urine in cases where the Spotbot worked but left an area slightly darker than the rest of the carpet.  A quick spray with the Pre-Treat and everything was as good as new.  I typically have not left it on for the recommended time (12-72 hours), finding a half hour to be plenty.  However, I did have a small, tough stain that other cleaners did not remove, so I tried this and left it covered for about a day.  After a little rubbing afterward with a cloth and water, it did come out.I have used this on an off-white textured sofa and ottoman as well, and its worked effectively.
Although it did what it advertised and within a week, I just feel in order to keep the discoloration from returning,  you need to keep adding it which can be costly

Assembled in 3 minutes flat, very sturdy. I like the top door very much, makes it very easy to get cats out at the vet. I get nervous about it and check it before we leave to make sure it is secure, and it always is.  I would purchase this again and recommend it.

This is an awesome gravel cleaner and fish tank re-filler!  I have used it 3 times to clean my 25 gallon tank and I absolutely love it.  I have also used it in "fill" mode to wash off my Great Pyrenees dog in our bath tub and while that's not it's intended use, it completely rules for that purpose alone.
summary: Many more uses than I had imagined!

reviewText: This was a donation gift sent directly to a local shelter.I did not get to see it but, I'm sure it is satisfactory seeing it was on their wish list.

Finally I have found a good quality scoop it holds nice large clumps.  I have three cat boxes and had....I say had because they are gone now..... okay I didn't throw them away I put them out on the curb with some other free stuff so some other poor soul can have them.....they were three litter scoops (the cheap plastic ones you buy in the grocery store they look like the Purness ones here on Amazon).  They crack and break and the litter cakes on.  For those that say the holes are big I don't know what scoop they were using before but I compared it to the ones I have now and the slots are the same distance across.  I use Word's Best Cat Litter and the litter slides right off the scoop without sticking.  My only complaint about this scoop (and about all scoops) is I wish the top  edge of the scoop had a slightly wider band so that when scooping a stuck on clump I could scrape and get the little saturated pieces that fall behind without it falling through the holes.
summary: I'm throwing out all my other ones!!!!

reviewText: My 2 cats LOVE this fountain. They used to drive me crazy begging for me to turn on the water at the sink, but now they have fresh, running water all the time! I like it because it is quiet and easy to clean.

These work great.  I bought one of each of our dogs and they are so comfortable that they don't even mind wearing them... which has not been the case with other harnesses. I bought large for our medium sized dogs because reviewers said they run small... and they fit perfect with just a little room to grow.My only complaints... and the reason I gave it only 4 stars was 1) They are a little difficult to adjust to the correct size. 2) Because these are nylon, the ends of each strap have very rough/sharp ends.  I imagined that this would be very uncomfortable for our pups... especially under they arms.  So, I spent time with a sturdy emery board and 'sanded' each end to eliminate the roughness.  I would think the company could address this before sending them to customers.
My cocker spaniel carries this thing from room to room with her and she sleeps with it. She is a chewer but this rabbit has held up extremely well. It's actually still got all his parts!

i had a medium sized one for a couple months, and decided to order a large and it is BIG. this thing is really heavy duty. one difference i noticed is the treats on the medium sized bones peeled off easily, but the treats on the size large bone actually go almost underneath the ball so when its screwed together it cannot be pulled out easily, my dog has treats still left on his bone and cannot get the last bit off.
summary: great toy, size large is HEAVY DUTY

reviewText: Great compact product. Affordable and does the trick.This light comes with a 10,000k Full Spectrum as well as an Actinic bulb for blues / dusk. Very happy with product.
My Pomeranian and Husky love these snacks. Sweet potato is supposed to be really good for dogs, so I bought this and it even smells great.

The little doggie liked Chef Michael's Oven Roasted Chicken Dry Dog Food and just gobbled it up. It smelled quite good for dog food. I like the straightforward ingredient list, although it seems much of the protein is from soy.I was surprised to see that this product is from Nestlé Purina. Who is this Chef Michael? Is it just a brand name or is he a real person? I haven't been able to determine that!Nutrition:Crude Protein (Min) 28.0%Crude Fat (Min) 6.0%Crude Fiber (Max) 3.0%Moisture (Max) 12.0%Ingredients:Chicken, soybean meal, soy flour, animal fat preserved with mixed-tocopherols (form of Vitamin E), brewers rice, soy protein concentrate, corn gluten meal, ground yellow corn, glycerin, ground wheat, poultry by-product meal, animal digest, oat meal, calcium phosphate, calcium carbonate, salt, natural oven roasted chicken flavor, potassium chloride, dried peas, dried carrots, sulfur, Vitamin E supplement, choline chloride, zinc sulfate, ferrous sulfate, niacin, L-Lysine monohydrochloride, manganese sulfate, Vitamin A supplement, added color (Yellow 5, Blue 2, Yellow 6, Red 40), calcium pantothenate, thiamine mononitrate, copper sulfate, riboflavin supplement, Vitamin B-12 supplement, pyridoxine hydrochloride, garlic oil, Vitamin D-3 supplement, folic acid, menadione sodium bisulfite complex (source of Vitamin K activity), calcium iodate, biotin, sodium selenite.
much cheaper "generic" option.  works great with both my dog's bark and fence collar -- which never lasts long enough no matter what batter you use.

I work w/ volunteer serv 4 animals & have had many kittens & feral cats. Out of all of them, 1 female Siamese started peeing on our clothing etc. I used this product to "comfort" lil kittens & decided to try it for the peeing. It WORKED! when I spray areas she has gone on & pretty much all over ( in case!) she hasent marked again! I ran out & it wasent long before she started up again. So im positive its THIS that helped . Recomend it 100%

I switched to Wellness Core after my mini-Schnauzer could not tolerate Merrick canned food.  I am an over-the-road truck driver and pay the extra for the smaller cans so I don't have to worry about refrigerating leftovers.  This is a very thick pate and I do a  50% mix of her daily feeding with the dry Wellness Core grain-free kibble as that seems to help keep the cost down. This pate is so thick that I can easily serve this in bite-size portions on her plate and usually there is no food clinging to her Schnauzer whiskers after she eats.  I waited before reviewing this to make sure she didn't have any digestive issues.  So far no gas after eating and she is having solid bowel movements.

This shampoo is very gentle on my hands and I bathe my 3 Cavalier King Charles Spaniels weekly.  This is a concentrated solution so should be diluted and squirted onto the dogs via a smaller bottle for ease of use.  It lasts a long time, as does the pleasant, mild scent on the dogs.  Leaves no greasy residue yet makes the hair soft and manageable.  Love this product - so happy to have found it on Amazon.  Used to have to CALL someone in California to order at twice the price and they shipped it on a slow truck from China... Amazon's delivery is fabulous for a fabulous item.

I had the Petmate fountain and it was a pain to disassemble and clean. This fountain is easy to do everything (disassemble, clean, put more water) and it's cute. It's not noisy and filter is easy to replace.I'm giving four stars because they don't offer other colors
I am the proud owner of 12 cats that I have rescued.  Not a single one of my cats would eat these.

Every time I go to the vet or to the groomer, I always here that my dog's ears are dirty.  After very costly grooming fees, I decided I would try to groom my dog at home to save some money.  This product is very easy to use.  I put the product in her ear, let it set for 30 seconds, then clean out her ear with cotton. Even though my dog hates getting her ears clean, this product was still easy enough to use and does the trick.  I use it about every 2 weeks when I give her a bath.
The proof is in the pudding - my two dogs, Heidi and Renny have been using this ear wash with good effect.

They were large and my dogs have been carrying them around for several weeks and keep going back to them. I would recommend these. I have small dogs and they don't care how large they are. They can still carry them around. They do not smell and did not leave marks on the carpet.

My dog loves these treats. They are very soft and very easy for her to chew. They did go up in price so I have been buying them not as often. I have a 5lb Yorkie and I would give her one treat twice a day. I love the ingredients in this product as they are easily recognizable and not some chemical put into the food for taste and color.Great part is they are made is USA. i would recommend these and will continue to buy.

Nothing wrong with product as cat always brushes corners and has left black mark where she goes yet so far seems reluctant to use it.  Did have a bit of a job to adhere it in place, and did all the suggested things like rubbing it against cat first but one time she might though avoids it so far
summary: Lambert Kay Mr Spats Cat-a-comb Self grooming cat brush
